One night stay.  Got in late Friday night around 9 PM gentleman at the front desk was very nice check in was easy.  Room was nice and spacious.  However no mini fridge (didn't know this at time of booking).  Carpet was worn in a few areas.  Room itself was clean, bed comfort was ok.  Near freeway but the ac unit drowned out the sound.  Not many outlets in the room.  Property could use some TLC.

Summary Heading: Visiting family and friends over holidays
Summary: Nice to return to this property and be immediately recognized as a returning guest by both the front desk staff as well as housekeeping. They always anticipate and meet my preferences. Location is convenient for me.

Never again would I stay there due to  disgustingness of their facility. Nice people work there but disgusting. Tv and lights didn’t work. Phone to call was so filled with gunk couldn’t get it to dial.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re very sorry to hear we disappointed you during your stay with us. I spoke to our staff and reminded them to report maintenance items so they can be addressed before our guests check in. The room attendant that prepared your room will be retrained on our cleaning process to ensure she is not missing anything. I also spoke to our house person in regards to making sure he is checking the property throughout the day and keeping the property grounds clean. We’re happy to hear our staff was nice.  Thanks again for taking the time to give us a review.

Summary: Stay far far away worst motel I have ever stayed in. This place is 20 years beyond needing a complete rehab. The smell in the room was overwhelming. I am sure the last guest in this room had a panther that had sprayed the entire room with urine. While the bathroom was reasonably tidy for a 100 year old motel, my wife still refused to even go in there. Never never never book this place until you hear that it either been torn down and rebuilt or completely and utterly renovated.  Ere
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. We’re sorry to hear we disappointed you and your wife during your stay with us. We do have an older property, so we’ve been working on updating our rooms and building in-house until we get a renovation. I shared your comments with our staff and reminded them the importance of reporting maintenance items so they can be addressed before our rooms get rented. We’re sorry we failed to catch the bad odor and remove it before you checked in. Thanks again for your feedback.

Summary Heading: La Quinta in Costa Mesa california
Summary: Having chosen this La Quinta for location and because of Wyndham rewards membership , I disappointed myself by not finding out the rooms have no refrigerator or microwave. The pet allowance makes for a musty room. The staff is extra helpful and friendly which offsets these drawbacks.

Summary Heading: If it were not for the odor in the room.
Summary: Location was great. The room overall was fine except it had an odor like some had thrown up in there. It was not strong enough where I would change rooms, but it was there. Otherwise it would've been a great stay. Bed was comfortable, it had a fridge and microwave and the room was a pretty good size. There is a Hooters next door and other restaurants within a 5 min drive.

We stayed at La Quinta in August 2019 after we had arrived in Los Angeles and we were on our way to San Diego. This is a reasonable budget hotel in a reasonable location. It suited us for what we needed it for (a clean bed to sleep in when jet lagged). We did use the pool and it was clean and tidy and nice to relax in. The room was clean, the bedding was clean, and the bathroom was clean but a little dated. The carpet was soaking wet when we arrived and can only imagine this was due to the fact it had been recently cleaned. Iit suited our needs and was in a decent location

Summary Heading: Older Property. Don't Walk on Carpets in Barefeet!
Summary: Average La Quinta that needs a major refresh. The property has many dog owners that use this property. Seems that this has an impact on the cleanliness. One couple had their dog in the breakfast area - no one on the staff said anything. The breakfast is almost all pre-made carbohydrates. Price/Value relationship is ok for OC.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We do have an older property and are waiting to hear back on when we will get a renovation. In the meantime, we’ve been painting the exterior of the building as well as updating our guest rooms in house. We do not allow pets in the breakfast area and we’re sorry to hear we failed to address the situation. I reminded our staff of this policy and will ensure they are advising our guests. We’re glad you found our property to be a fair price for OC. Thanks again for taking the time to give us a review.

Summary: We could not get the NBC channel on our tv. We didn't know until checkout day when we tried to watch a NASCAR event. We din't report it. Aside from this, my stay was fine. Location chosen because of its proximity to the cemetery  close by.

I had a little bit higher expectations than I received. I was not impressed with the smell of the room. The unfortunate thing is it determined pretty much the whole entire stay for myself. It put a bad taste let alone smell in my mouth.

We traveled along trip and we were very tired. So it was nice to come to a clean and contrable room. Our stay was an overnighter and we left very early in the morning. My daughter and I felt very safe spending the night at the La Quinta Inn. The location was very convenient as it was off the 405 freeway. At this time there was a lot of construction 405 freeway. at this time there was a lot of construction on the 405 freeway and it made very difficult to locate the La Quinta Inn.

Don’t let the pictures fool you. From the moment I walked into the lobby I should of turned around and ran. I was exhausted and just needed to sleep and was flying out of town in the morning. The parking lot was dark and needs to be repaved and needs to have better lighting. I opened the door and my disappointment continued. I can honestly say not 1 single positive thing about this room. I couldn’t even take off my shoes for fear of catching something. I just wanted morning to get here so I could fly out of town.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to tell us about your experience. We’re saddened to hear we failed to meet your expectations and sorry your room wasn’t prepared to our standards. I spoke to our room attendants and reminded them the importance of using our cleaning process to ensure all parts of their rooms are being cleaned and addressed. The room attendant that prepared your room will be retrained to ensure she is not missing anything in her rooms. We will check all the parking lot lights and replace any that are out. We are waiting for approval to get our parking lot repaired, so in the meantime we’ve been repairing areas ourselves. Thanks again for your feedback.

Summary: Gross hotel. Strong smoking smell outside near no smoking signs. Bedbugs in hotel room. Room smelled of mildew/mold. Stain on sofa. Toilet clogged on first flush. Maintenance staff forced us to plunge toilet. Mattress had black stains.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience. We’re very sorry to hear we failed to prepare your room to our standards. I spoke to our room attendants and reminded them to report maintenance items so they can be addressed before our rooms get rented. The room attendant that cleaned your room will be retrained on our cleaning process to ensure she is not forgetting anything. I also spoke to our maintenance team in regards to making sure they are taking care of our guests needs professionally and efficiently. We’re sorry you had to plunge the backed-up toilet yourself. Thanks again for your feedback.

Summary Heading: Cheapest hotel in the area at the time. Definitely earned that title.
Summary: Beds were adequate, breakfast serving area looked gross but may have been caused by other guests. Large homeless demographic served here which is great when managed properly. Over all it was a bit over priced for what it was but it was the cheapest thing in the area.

Summary Heading: Older Property Needs Some Sprucing Up
Summary: First time ever staying here. Trying to stay budget minded on company expenses and took a shot at this hotel. Large King Suite with more than enough closet space, but property is older and in need of some cleaning up. Front desk staff was totally indifferent when I was checking in, simply not friendly at all. Convenient to accessing I-405 North and South, but a difficult hotel to get into because of a very small entryway and a lot of traffic in the general area. A Hooters restaurant in the parking lot which is convenient if you're in the mood for chicken wings.

The room smelled and the floor was filthy. I was glad we only had to stay there 1 night. The pool area is nice but it wasn't clean either. It's right off the highway so its noisy. The location is kind of strange it's off the main road and nothing's near by.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to give us your feedback. We’re very sorry to hear your room had a bad odor and a dirty floor. I spoke to our room attendants and reminded them to report maintenance items so they can be addressed before our rooms get rented. I also spoke to our maintenance team to ensure they are keeping the pool area clean throughout the day.  Thanks again for your review.

Summary: We came to California to go to Knott's Berry Farm and stayed at our favorite hotel, the La Quinta in Costa Mesa. We love the staff and the accomodations. The price is great and the value is wonderful. I would stay here again for my next trip to Southern California.

Very comfortable rooms. Had a decent breakfast of waffles. Rooms were cleaned and maid staff was very pleasant. Front desk was a little stiff with there customer service but had no real complaints. Overall I give it 9 stars.

The hotel was clean and the staff was nice. Hotel is very old and needs renovation. Good location. They need a bigger breakfast area. I have stayed at La Qunita several times in different cities and was disappointed with this stay.

The room is slightly small buyt WiFi is very fast, the room looks like a more expensive hotel, very clean and the bed is very comfortable. TV has many channels and it is in a good area. I will return. One of the best for the price I have stayed in.

I complained to staff about the flea infestation and how ugly my skin got for my birthday. Definitely had a horrible experience. Staff was nice, but the room have fleas and being bit by them all night and wake up to damaged skin was unexceptable!
Manager Response: We’re very sorry to hear we disappointed you during your stay with us on your birthday. I reminded our room attendants to keep an eye out for fleas when cleaning their rooms since we are a pet friendly property. The room has been inspected and treated and we’ll ensure these types of situations are addressed before our rooms get rented. Thanks for taking the time to give us your feedback.

Summary: This hotel is okay, it is a bit run down and there is still carpet in the rooms the carpet is rather gross and dirty the room itself was clean the bed was fairly comfortable this is a reasonably priced hotel and it is good for one night

Summary Heading: Does not give military discounts. Does not offer buffet.
Summary: Advertising on website claims they have a buffet. It’s just a gloried continental breakfast.  Please change that on your website.  Light in room didn’t work. And the card reader for the door was not working either. I reserved a room through the website and it didn’t offer me the option for a military discount. Explained that to the concierge and she said it was already included. It was not. She didn’t do her research or know how to look it up.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to give us your feedback. We’re very sorry you weren’t honored your military discount. I spoke to our staff and trained them on how to properly look up this information. We’re also sorry you were given false information regarding our breakfast. We will check our sites to ensure they all have the correct breakfast we offer. I reported the light out and key reader to ensure it’s addressed before the room gets rented again. Thank you for your service and again for your feedback.

Summary: i needed a very short (few hours) stay to take a nap before a red eye. kudos to LQ for being dog friendly hotel, but some pet friendly hotels do better job on eliminating the smell. the tub was disgusting, water wouldnt drain. i did request room on the ground floor for easy baggage loading, but it was facing a nasty “hooters”-all outside conversations were heard way too well inside. for a few hours wait before a flight it still beats sitting at the airport. for an overnight stay, i dont think so.  i have diamond status with wyndham, not sure if room next to hooters was my upgrade perk?
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re very sorry to hear your room had a pet odor and a clogged tub. I spoke to our room attendants and reminded them to report maintenance items so they can be addressed before our rooms get rented. I also spoke to our maintenance team and they will check the door and window seals to ensure they are in good condition to help drown out outside noise. We’re sorry you weren’t able to rest well due to the loud conversations outside your room. Thanks again for taking the time to give us a review.

Summary Heading: Customer service great. but property and rooms need work
Summary: The front desk staff is wonderful and has greatly improved their customer service skills. Management needs to work on the cleanliness of the rooms as I found three cockroaches in our room on the night stand and behind it.

this place was not bad, but not good. If i was in a pinch for a spot i'd stay again, but would probably ask for a better room. the room had a unique smell and the bathroom wasn't as clean as i'd desired. and there was a spider. small things, but they added up.

Summary Heading: Not my first choice despite low price
Summary: The first thing my teenage son and I noted on entering the parking lot is that the hotel shares it with a Hooters restaurant. Not exactly what you're looking for if you want family-friendly; we said to each other, "Now I know why this place was cheap". The room itself was clearly older but reasonably clean. However, the lever on the tub faucet to produce a shower was extremely difficult to raise; it finally did but my finger was sore from the effort.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to give us a review. We’re sorry we disappointed you and your son. We do have an older property so we’ve been working on updating the exterior as well as our guest rooms in-house until we get a renovation. I spoke to our room attendants and reminded them to report maintenance items so they can be addressed before our guests check in. We’re sorry we failed to catch and repair the shower handle before the room was rented. Thanks again for your review.

Summary: This is an excellent hotel to stay for my business trip in southern California area. Meet my requirement and my budget. Spend total 6 nights in this hotel, have a good experience in this La Quinta and a wonderful business trip.

Excellent experience, met all my expectations. I was very impressed, my stay was very affordable & I felt like I was staying in a fancy hotel for half the cost . The bed & pillows were very comfortable & the breakfast was amazing best waffles hands down!

Whats the worst motel hell you have stayed at?  Well this isn't that, but its not great either.  The hotel needs a major update.  The staff is great especially the front desk women but the bed is uncomfortable as hell the door allows the light and noise of the outside in because there is a gap all around it and the AC doesn't work correctly.  Don't be cheap and let the price of this property reel you in like it did for me.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re very sorry to hear your rooms AC wasn’t working properly and the door allowed light and noise to enter the room. I reported it to our maintenance team and reminded our room attendants to report maintenance items so they can be addressed before our guests check in. We will also check the mattress and replace if needed. We’re sorry it wasn’t comfortable.  Thanks again for your review.

Summary: Bring sandals or slippers to walk on this carpet.  Staff was very accommodating. MIntance men were very quick and efficient.  Whenever I contacted the front desk for any problem they got us taken care of very quickly.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re happy to hear our staff was accommodating, quick and efficient but sorry your room’s carpet was not clean. We shampoo around 20 carpets per day and I reminded our staff to ensure we are addressing the ones that need cleaning the most first. Thanks again for taking the time to give us your feedback.

Summary: Horrible place. Unsafe, cars were keyed. Rooms smell bad, not clean, we even bought our own bed sheets the next day. People were loitering, drunk, pool was closed because someone pooped in it. My kids didn’t feel safe. We complained and nothing happened. NEVER AGAIN
Manager Response: Dear Kristie,  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at La Quinta Inn by Wyndham Costa Mesa Orange County. I am sorry that your experience did not meet your expectations; please allow me to express my sincerest apologies.   Your feedback is very important to us, and I am saddened to hear that there were problems with your stay. My apologies for the issues you and your team experienced. Unfortunately the pool had to be closed as a guest child could not make it to the restroom on time and had an accident. The pools chemicals needed to be recalculated and put in the which takes time to level them out. We did get our pool vendor out here to take care of that for us which they did. I am sorry for the sketchy people you mentioned. We are an exterior property with a large area and non guests do tend to wander in at times. We do, when brought to our attention, have them leave and Security at night does also watch out for them. Orange County does have a homeless issue so we are always on the look out. The hit and run actually did not involve guests but rather were 2 Hooter's patrons, I do hope they are able to find the person or persons involved. Unfortunately our camera's did not pick up who vandalized the cars that Friday night. One of our Employees car was also effected. Please rest assured that we are taking the appropriate measures to address the problem and prevent any future occurrences. Here at La Quinta Inns & Suites, we continuously strive to meet your needs and expectations.  We appreciate the time you took to share your concerns, and it is our hope that you will give us the opportunity to better serve you in the future.

Summary: At least two cars were vandalized overnight. My car was keyed front to back. Management acknowledge it when I called since more people received the same treatment. No responsibility from them as expected.
Manager Response: My apologies Pierre that you were one of the cars vandalized that Friday night.  We have never had an issue with our guests cars before and it saddens me that this did occurred.  I am sorry for the incident and can understand your concerns.  We have reached out to our security guard company as well to make sure they are aware and alert so as to not have this happen again.  We have also checked our cameras and continue to do so for any clue as to who could be responsible.

Summary: Entire facility is worn down and in need of upkeep & maintenance.  Room was okay and basically clean but also old and worn.  The a/c unit was so loud every time it kicked on it woke me up. It wasn't a cheap hotel and I definitely expect more from a Wyndham.
Manager Response: Hi Kelly D.  Thank you for giving us the chance to know about your visit with us.  We are pleased that you came to stay with us.  We see that you had issues with the property and apologize.  We are one of the older properties for La Quinta in the Orange County area and look forward to a renovation coming now that we are with Wyndham.  I am sorry for the AC troubles you had.  I did bring this up to my Chief Engineer's attention so that we address the AC in that room.  We will do better in our property upkeep and look forward to your return if your travels bring you this way again.

Summary: We were put in a room next to smokers area we were not told this upon arrival. No one was there when we arrived or would have went to switch room Right away.  All night we were kept up by talking. We have asthma and had an attack because of the smoke. I lost my voice, had a sore throat as well. This information should be disclosed as it is a health issue. Also, had to eat out of bowls as there were no plates put out. The OJ machine was broken they had a cheap Summy Delight replacement instead of OJ.When I reported problem staff seemed unapologetic and indifferent about my concerns.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. We’re saddened to hear smoke entered your room due to being close to the smoking area. I reminded our staff to use judgement when placing guests in that area. Our guests who inquire about the smoking area should be placed in that area for convenience but non-smoking guests should be placed away from there. I also spoke to our breakfast attendants to ensure they are letting us know when we are running out of items so we can order more before we are completely out. We’re sorry we failed to have the proper plates and OJ during your stay with us. Thanks again for taking the time to give us your feedback as it is important for us to improve.

Summary Heading: Not again unless it is fixed up
Summary: Carpet is filthy!  Maids do a great job  with what they are given to work with.  The property is quite old and in desperate need of some maintenance, paint and carpet are way overdue.  We found the beds comfortable, a/c worked fine.  Did have to switch rooms at check in because the first smelled like pets.  There should be "pet"rooms just like smoking rooms
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. Our maids do a great job but we understand our property is older and in need of a renovation. We’re waiting to hear when we’ll be getting one but in the meantime we’ve been working on updating the exterior as well as our guest rooms in-house. We just ordered carpet for 25 rooms and we’ll see if it’s possible to designate rooms for pets. We’re sorry your carpet was not clean. I reminded our room attendants to report dirty carpets so they can be shampooed before the room gets rented. Thanks again for taking the time to give us your feedback.

Summary Heading: In desperate need of some deep cleaning and an investment in renovations
Summary: I've stayed at a few different La Quinta's and the Costa Mesa Orange County is no close to what I've come to expect in terms of quality and cleanliness. I had a total of 9 rooms reserved for a youth basketball team and their families, all were in the same condition. All rooms facing the freeway were extremely loud. The seals at the doors and windows were non-existent. The floors in the rooms were filthy and likely need replaced rather than cleaned.  I had to return to the front desk 10 times over 3 days to get my key cards reprogrammed or replaced. My concerns to the employees at the front desk were shrugged off. Wyndham should do a visit to ensure that this location meets its standards. If it does, than maybe I need to ensure I no longer stay with the La Quinta or Wyndham
Manager Response: We’re sorry to have disappointed you and the other team member’s families. We do have an older property and are waiting to hear back on when we will be getting a renovation. In the meantime, we’ve been painting the exterior of the building as well as updating our guest rooms in-house. We’re waiting for a bid to be approved to get our parking lot repaired and we just ordered 10k in carpet and will do so every quarter. I reported the noise to our maintenance team so they can check the door and window seals and replace if needed. The key cards are very sensitive and will deactivate if placed near a cell phone or anything with a magnet. We’re sorry our staff failed to inform your group of the sensitivity so it could have been prevented. I spoke to our staff and reminded the room attendants to report maintenance items so they can be addressed before our rooms get rented. I also spoke to the front desk staff in regards to making sure all of our guests needs are being met. Thanks for taking the time to give us your feedback as it will help us improve.

Summary Heading: Close to beaches, therefore Good value
Summary: For a value priced hotel, the accommodations were better than expected.  Deya, was friendly and efficient.  She assigned me my room and informed me of where to park and best way to get to room (this was necessary as it was quite a maze finding my room).  Robert, the manager, assisted me to my room, as I am a handicapped senior.  The maintenance staff were friendly, as they tried to fix a problem which contributed to my having to change rooms due to the television not functioning properly.  They should replace some of the carpets in the hotel, add more items to the breakfast (scrambled eggs, bacon, etc), and extend breakfast hours, and should fix or replace the cable company, otherwise, it is close to beaches, reasonably priced,     had good staff, which makes it a good place to

Property needs renovating, rooms smells like cigarettes, and not all have ventilation fans.  Front desk was slow to respond to a non-working door key and did noisy ground work at very early morning hours. Bed was VERY hard.

The rioom is nice if you can put up with the incompetence of the Front Desk and special rules of La Quinta should you choose to book through another agency. Never in my life had I had friends waiting in the lobby on a room that booked and paid for. This hotel would not let them enter unless I personally was in attendence. This is ridiculous. I have traveled all over the world for 20+ years and have made reservations for friends and family and never was I told that I had to be there in person to check them in. After 3 1/2 hours of phone calls and emails, my friends were allowed to enter the room after me signing an authorization.

I both called and wrote an E-mail to the 'main office' management, explaining about by rotten treatment and terrible experience I had at their Costa Mesa La Quinta property, and I was ignored.  Obviously, they don't care.  By all that is right they owe me a refund for over a week of the rates I paid; however, one 'guest' in this case means nothing to them.  They don't care; they are self-serving and rude.  They have no ethics, conscience, or morality.  I recommend never staying at a LaQuinta or any Wyndham property ever.  Life is full of choices every day. . . . Choose other than Wyndham.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to give us a review. We’re very sorry to hear your concerns have not been addressed and you were given bad service during your stay with us. I shared your comments with our staff and reminded them, what we do can make or break our guests stay. We’re sorry we disappointed you and failed to address any inconveniences while you were still in-house. Thanks again for your feedback.

Summary: Noisy room due to being next freeway, outdated needed a fresh coat of paint exterior and interior, poor quality breakfast ding area was unkept and no hot food except waffles will not stay here again there are better hotels in the area
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry your room was too noisy due to the freeway. I reported it to our maintenance team to ensure the window and door seals are in good condition. We have an older property, so we’ve been working on repairing our walkways and parking lot as well as painting the exterior of the building and up-dating our guestrooms. We will ensure the room you were in is next on our list. Thanks again for taking the time to give us a review.

Summary Heading: Was expecting more and got way less!
Summary: For your average LaQuinta, this review would be good!  This was not at all what we expected.  The rooms rugs were filthy, people smoke outside the rooms and you can smell and hear them talking outside the rooms, because it has outside entrances.  The management wouldn't even cleanup a spilled bag of dry dog food that someone left on the floor after being told multiple times. Spend a few bucks more and go somewhere else. I forgot to mention loud noise of highway and sounds like a helicopter taking of early in the morning.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback but saddened to hear you were not satisfied with your stay. Having a clean, quiet and odor free room is important and we’re sorry we failed to address the dirty carpet before you checked in. I reminded our room attendants to report maintenance items so they can be addressed before our guests check in. I reported the noise to make sure the window and door seals are in good condition.  I also shared your comments with our front desk staff and reminded them the importance of advising guests of our designated smoking area. I also reminded them to take quick action when our guests report items needing attention. We’re sorry we failed to clean up the spilled dog food quickly. Thanks again for taking the time to give us a review.

Summary Heading: Noise wasn't the worst part, odor, service not impressive either
Summary: Room 146 is in poor condition with horrible smell of urine and torn carpet at the entry.  I love the fact you accept dogs and I realize people staying with dogs need to step up their game and be more considerate and responsible, but when they aren't the hotel needs to be cleaned and sanitized.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to give us your feedback. We’re sorry to hear your room had a bad odor and you did not receive great service from our staff. I reported the bad odor and torn carpet to our maintenance team to ensure it’s addressed before the room gets rented again. I also reminded our room attendants to report maintenance items. We also love being able to accommodate our guests that travel with their pets and you are absolutely correct regarding our staff needing to ensure our grounds stay clean and free of debris. I reminded them to do their rounds throughout the day and to ensure all public areas are cleaned and sanitized. Thanks again for your review.

Summary: Good stop over.  Front desk refused to put a refrigerator in room unless i paid 10 dollars extra per day. Explained i needed it for my medicine. Said he would move me but it would cost ten extra dollars because it was a discount price.I got the triple AAA auto rate...go figure...get a discount...lose room priveliges
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  My apologies that we did not have a room with a microwave and Fridge for you when you checked in.  Unfortunately in looking at your reservation you had not booked a room with a M/F which do cost $10 to $20 more than the regular rooms.  We do only have a few rooms with the M/F and those do tend to sell out faster and earlier than the other rooms that do not have them.  If you do need to store medication we do have a Fridge at the desk that we store for our guests.  Please rest assured it was not the discount but the room type you selected.  We do offer AAA discount also for the rooms with M/F.  Thank you again for your review and hope this explains a little bit more so that next time we can get you in the right room type that will fit your needs. Hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: good place to save a few bucks
Summary: nice staff ,needs new carpet & updated bathroom BRING FLIP FLOPS you do not want to be barefoot in the place  !! loved the photo ops on the Harry potter staircase tower , great workout room and close to the beach
Manager Response: Thanks for you review Sightseer.  It was nice to hear that our staff provided you with good service and you enjoyed our gym.  We did get new machines a few months ago.  I am glad you liked them.  We have a great location.  Besides the beaches Newport and Huntington we are near many venues.  We have many restaurants in the area, Shopping malls, movie theaters, and Disneyland.  We are one of the older properties in the OC area and will do better in maintaining the property.  Thank you again for your review.

Summary: I travel a lot. I have been in lots of hotels, including many motel 6's, red roof inns, and la quintas when I pay on my own dime. Hiltons and Westins when work pays haha. Anyway, this hotel stands out in my memory as literally the worst hotel I have ever been at.  1. The room was filthy. There were foot prints on my bed sheets (yes...foot prints) There was blood in the shower. (yes, blood!) I think it would have been impossible for the carpet to be any more disgusting. And besides all that, everything else was dirty too.  2.The *loudest* freeway noise I have ever heard.   3. Lots of shady people hanging out. Do not come here if you are a single woman.  4. In case the freeway noise wasn't loud enough, there is a hooters across the parking lot which makes things even more noisy,
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry to have disappointed you during your stay with us. I shared your comments with our staff and reminded them to stay vigilant to ensure only our guests are on property. I also spoke to our room attendants regarding room cleanliness. Our guests should always get a clean, fresh comfortable room and we’re sorry we dropped the ball when preparing your room. The room attendant that cleaned your room will be retrained on our cleaning process.  I reported the noise to our maintenance team to make sure the window and door seals are in good condition. Thanks again for taking the time to give us a review.

Summary: This property is very old.   It shares a parking lot with Hooters. It is situated next to the 405 freeway.   With a canal on one side, a freeway on the other. Rooms are very out dated.   Carpet is old. Breakfast was waffles, cereal, breads, juice, coffee, banana or apple.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. We do have an older property so we’ve been working on painting the exterior of the building as well as updating our guestrooms in-house until we get a renovation. I reported the carpet so our maintenance team can inspect it and replace if needed. Thanks again for taking the time to give us your feedback.

Summary: The only good thing about this room was the beds were comfortable. The carpets were horribly stained and torn away from the entrance door.  The entrance door had about an inch of daylight showing under it, thus bug entered at will, killed a few over a 5 day stay. The shower handle was not secured and came off in my hand the first time I tried to use it (maintenance came right away and silicone it back on), and the bathtub filled with water with every shower due to a slow drain. They were diligent about telling us not to vape in the parking lot next to our car, yet the room stunk to high heaven of pot/cigarette smoke. They cleaned our room and gave fresh towels ONCE in 5 days!We have stayed at many LaQuintas in our travels as we usually have our pets with us (although not this
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry to hear of the room conditions you mentioned. Having a clean, fresh, odor free room is important and I’m sorry we failed to prepare your room to our standards. I reported the door seal, slow shower drain, carpet and odor to our maintenance team so it can be addressed before the room gets rented again. I also spoke to our room attendants and reminded them of the importance of making sure they are stocking their rooms with the proper amenities. Thanks again for taking the time to give us a review.

Summary Heading: Hot is older but is being kept up.
Summary: The rooms facing the 405 Freeway are a little noisy.  I was in a room not facing the freeway so not as noisy. The rooms and bathrooms are clean but beginning to show its age.  Parking lis limited for the number of rooms.  One night I didn't get back till 10;30 and had to park in a neibhboring business.  This LQ does not have eggs or a meat for breakfast.  One morning there were less than 1/2 a dozen little muffins. The ling for wafles was about 6 deep. Check-in and check-out were quick. q

Booked this hotel as it was closer to our desired location and it is our preferred brand.  We won't make that mistake again,   would rather drive from farther away.   Hotel was run down, noisy,  stains on the carpets,  carpet pulling away from the walls especially near the door.  We like La Quinta generally but they should consider ending this location.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Terudd.  My apologies for the condition you found of the hotel and the inconvenience it caused during your stay with us.  I have shared your comments with our team and we will do better in reporting our carpets issues and in getting them cleaned more often.  I am sorry that your room had these issues and will work with our staff to make sure this does not repeat itself.  I thank you for letting us know how your stay was so we can improve our guests experiences.

Summary: The hotel used to be good. Now it is a rundown hotel with Zero maintenance. The rooms after changing rooms 2x were still smelling like I had finished smoking in the room, the floor in the room and bathroom looked dirty, the beds were so small and terrible. Breakfast did not have even syrup. Elevator door had a problem and it closed on me and my infant, when I reported to a staff member she was rude about it. Really noisy area and the hotel has not been taken care at all! It does not even deserve a 2 star rating.
Manager Response: Danielle,   Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at La Quinta Inn by Wyndham Costa Mesa Orange County. I am sorry that your experience did not meet your expectations; please allow me to express my sincerest apologies.   Your feedback is very important to us, and I am saddened to hear that you had a bad experience when staying with us. Please rest assured that we are taking the appropriate measures to address the problem and prevent any future occurrences. Here at La Quinta Inns & Suites, we continuously strive to meet your needs and expectations. We will do better in the upkeep of the hotel and making sure the rooms are not smoked in. We did have an error in our delivery but we did go get the syrup needed for that day. We should have had it and we apologize for the inconvenience it may have caused.    We appreciate the time you took to share your concerns, and it is our hope that you will give us the opportunity to better serve you in the future.

Summary: We stayed one night and it was worth the quick stay. No issues checking in or out and conveniently located. The room was cozy. It’s next to a Hooters restaurant so that was helpful. Parking was plentiful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Jet.  I was great to hear that everything you needed was good and that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We just got on to a new system so it was good to know that our staff is getting out arrival and departures done smoothly.  Thank you again and we look forward to your return.

Summary Heading: does not live up to la quinta name
Summary: I have stayed a La Quinta brand hotels in the past.  This one did not live up to the name.  It appeared as if La Quinta bought a no name motel and slapped the la quinta logo on it.  Makes me second guess staying at La Quinta again. Signs for ice machine pointed to pipe in the wall, peeling paint, room rug stained, and room smelled like dirty socks. AC not connected, did that myself, rust on nearly all metal parts.  walls so thin I could hear every time the next room opened the squeaky bathroom door, yes mine squeaked too.  Breakfast, no fridge, milk in pitcher on counter, cream cheese packs in a bowl no ice.  yogurt in a bath of ice water (rather than in bowl over ice), no meat.  only hard boiled eggs (not in a fridge).

Very deceiving rooms were not clean kept shoes on entire time and the first room smelled like cat  urine. Staff was friendly and breakfast was good. Toilet was broken beds are comfy just dirty and I wouldn’t stay again
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re glad to hear you enjoyed our beds and breakfast but very sorry your room had a pet odor, dirty carpet and a broken toilet. I spoke to our room attendants and reminded them the importance of reporting maintenance items so they can be addressed before our guests check in. I also spoke with our maintenance team to ensure they are checking the entire room when completing work orders. Thanks again for taking the time to give us a review.

Summary: This is a reasonably priced property in a pricey area.  It's not new or sleek, but the property is clean and reasonably well maintained. Staff was friendly and patient with our very large group. Breakfast was the usual fare but was fresh and ready on time.  Rooms were clean.

this place was filthy and unsafe, the property is surly in needed of major renovation room was filthy noisy. noise came from freeway traffic and drunks in parking lot.  Homelessness and trash just near the front door of the room was present.  i was glad to leave this property and cancel future reservation
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry to hear there were people on our property that were not guests and that your room was too noisy. We don’t allow anyone on our property that is not staying here. I reminded our staff to stay vigilant and report anyone who’s not supposed to be here so we can address it right away. I also spoke to our room attendants in regards to reporting maintenance items. We will check the door and window seals in the room you were in to ensure they are in good condition. Thanks again for taking the time to give us a review.

Summary: Stayed overnight here after driving up from San Diego for a whale watching tour. Hotel was next to a Hooters, and nearby highways and restaurants. The room was likely painted and partially renovated in last year or so and had new mattresses. The room did not have a refrigerator or microwave. The room was clean, but had a very odd, burn-like smell. (Room 119.) If we was staying more than overnight, I would have asked to change rooms.

The king suite was amazing. Very clean and the bathroom was nice with the sink separated from the toilet and shower to accommodate the 4 guests. The breakfast was good. The only bad thing was the noise from the highway. It should be expected but it was not pleasant.

We love how pet friendly your hotel is. We loved the breakfast. Super clean property. Friendly staff. And its conveniently located close to Disneyland. The beds were on the smaller size in the double room. But overall its good for the price

Rooms were clean, staff was friendly. Some patrons pretty questionable, and the outside of the hotel needs work, looks weathered. Pool needed to be cleaned too. The staff was friendly when checking in too.

Very dirty, musty smell in room is strong, guests smoking dope all around and homeless on the property. I do not recommend. This is a motel not a hotel in any sense. Right next to a Hooters which could be problematic.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to give us a review. It saddens us to hear your room had a bad odor and you did not like our property. We do not allow anyone on our property that is not a guest and we are a 100% non-smoking hotel. We will make sure to be more vigilant to ensure we do not have anyone hanging out on our property that is not a guest. Thanks again for your review.

Summary Heading: wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone
Summary: old small rooms and very small space no microwave or refrigerator even tho our booking showed there was, upon check in we were told they were all sold out so we had no choice. We paid about the same as any other hotels in that area but got a terrible room. They don't clean their sheets, room service didnt change our sheets upon request either. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY AND STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE. Bathroom exhaust had a lot of noise and so did the AC unit. I woke up multiple times cause of it.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry to hear your room wasn’t prepared properly and the maintenance items you mentioned were not addressed before you checked in. I reported the loud exhaust and AC unit and will make sure our team repairs them before the room gets rented again. We only have microwaves and refrigerators in some of our rooms. We’re sorry you were given wrong information on the room type you booked. We will check to ensure all information is correct on all of our booking channels. Thanks again for your review.

Summary: WE always stay at LQ as our small dog is a primary reason. Most LQ stays are great! This one does not seem to check re dogs as the others do. At breakfast, crammed with people and not enough spaces to eat anything- PLUS allowing dogs in when eating is enough to call the health department and close it down- NO, the dog was not a service dog and the person with it seemed NOT to be a guest- same condition as the dog. This location does provide a dog area with bags however the clientele who do not pick up after their pets needs to be advised on check-in as do the other LQ. Seems front staff are a bit apathetic- possibly the new owners -Wyndham?? We will continue to stay at LQ  but not this one.

See below, my stay was very good, room was great, quiet, very good sleeping.   Would recommend this hotel to everyone, as is a great value.   No other hotels anywhere in the area can compare, staff is excellent, knowledgeable, friendly, and efficient.
Manager Response: Thanks for your great review and kind feedback. We’re very happy to hear you love our property and would recommend us to your friends and family! I thanked our staff for taking such good care of you when you stay with us. We’ll see you again the next time you’re in town. Thanks again for your review.

Summary: Use this location for our employee travels.  Rough start getting process dialed in for smooth overall stay.  Some lack of flexibility for long term business opportunity.  Overall, location, staff and price are worth the extra effort for our employees ease of travel.

I booked this on a moments notice, after booking and reading the reviews I call LQ to cancel, however I could not since it was a same day res. When we arrived at 130a.m. the computers were down, the front desk rep was very nice and tried as hard to check us in quickly, and upgrading us to a suite. The room was clean and neat, stocked with normal hotel amenities, carpet for a pet friendly hotel was clean and NO foul odors, it is close to a freeway and you could hear cars and traffic but nothing that would disturb a sound sleeper, I always carry ear plugs when I travel (common sense for a seasoned traveler) I am glad we did not have the chance to cancel and that I could write a review after seeing all the negative stuff that was said. Lastly the breakfast was a standard LQ

First room carpet was wet and moldy, second room was very noisy too close to freeway,thir t room was ok, Breakfast is a minimum served on time, clean, but I can say staff is very helpful and hotel needs to be cleaned
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry it took 3 rooms until you found one that was suitable. I reminded our room attendants to report bad odors and other maintenance items so they can be addressed before the room gets rented. I’m sorry we failed to catch and report the carpet and mold smell. We will ensure it’s addressed before our next guests check. We will also check the room that was too noisy to make sure the door and window seals are in good condition.  We’re glad our staff was helpful. Thanks again for your review.

Summary: Hotel was OK--need to have my points show on my membership though--room was clean and hotel in general was clean--front staff was nice and handled process very smooth and quickly--breakfast was also done nicely as hot and fresh selections
Manager Response: Thank you Odyssey for your review.  It was great to hear that you had a good stay.  I was pleased to hear that our staff was friendly and delivered great service.  Please contact rewards to make sure your points get awarded to your account.  Thanks again.

Summary: The staff was above average but room smelt like cigarette and chemicals plus total room and hotel is need of renovation. So it is good for  one night but bing an oxygen mask and plan to bath at another establishment
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry your room had a bad odor and in need of renovation. I spoke to our room attendants and reminded them to report bad odors and other maintenance items so they can be addressed before our guests check in. We will make sure this room is next on our list for updating and insure the smoke smell is removed before renting the room again. Thanks again for taking the time to give us a review.

Summary: I am an elite La Quinta member and have been staying at their properties for a few years. First of all, all La Quintas say they are pet friendly, but somehow I’ve had issues with two locations and it had to do with my dogs. This particular property is NOT pet friendly. They have no waste bags, there is dog feces, food, and trash scattered all over the parking lot. My dog used the bathroom in the room because she’s a puppy and all I had were hotel towels. I used them once and then after that I went and bought cleaning supplies. But because a towel with dog feces and my trash was outside of my room, I’m not welcomed back. This morning when I tried to extend my stay, Michelle the general manager told me with a smile on her face that I am no longer welcomed there. Because

Hotel is convenience access to HWY405. Close to Southcoast Mall.Great value for money. Not the greatest but good enough.Breakfast is decent.Hotel is aging but clean. Room clean. King size bed is a plus and very comfortable.I wish they have small refrigerator and Microwave in every room, it is standard in most other hotel.Only 1 ice maker machine on 2nd floor, should have one  in each floor
Manager Response: Hi Huy.  It is great to hear from you.  You are right we are centrally located to many venues in the area and with the freeway to many more.  We are near the beaches, mall, shopping centers, restaurants, Disneyland and theaters.  I was pleased that you had a good nights rest in our beds and that you enjoyed the breakfast.  Sorry about our rooms not all having microwaves and refrigerators.  We do have a few but no they are not in all our rooms.  La Quinta Inns & Suites do have them in all the rooms but the Inns  are a select few.  I believe once we renovate that may be the case with us too.  Thank you again for sharing your time with us and welcome you back soon.

Summary Heading: Hope you get a cheap room rate.
Summary: This hotel is very dated, so don't expect to charge your phone and dry your hair at the same time. Only go because it has the cheapest room rate, and be prepared for freeway noise all night. Breakfast was available and coffee was plentiful.

Staff was nice and the area was convenient. The room was dirty though, the smell was to much and the bathroom had hair. Overall great for people with pets and need something last minute. If you don't like dog smell it might not be for you.

The room smelled a lot like cigarettes and the front desk couldn't give us a different room and the microwave didn't work. I was disappointed because we usually use la quinta when we need to visit our friends and family. ....................
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re very sorry to hear your room smelled like smoke and we didn’t have another room to move you to. I spoke to our room attendants and reminded them to report bad odors and other maintenance items so they can be addressed before our guests check in. We’re sorry we failed to make sure the microwave was working correctly and for not reporting the smell. Thanks again for your review as it will help us improve. We hope to see you again.

Summary: We have stayed at this particular LQ Inn many times and it’s always been okay; i.e., rooms are large and comfortable, the location is really good for freeway access (it’s right off the 405 freeway), and the included breakfast is adequate with hot items (oatmeal, waffles, bagels/toast) as well as the usual cold items (cereals, muffins, yoghurt, boiled eggs, etc.).  But this time the quality of service was considerably below what we have come to expect, in several ways.  The biggest issue was the soiled bed sheets:  When we pulled back the top sheet to go to bed around 10pm on our first night, we saw many dirt/oil/mud stains on the bottom sheet; in fact,  it appeared a dog had run through mud and then jumped on and run on top of the sheet!  We requested new sheets, and when they
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry to hear your last stay wasn’t up to standards as your previous stays. I shared your comments with our staff and we will ensure not to repeat the same mistakes you’ve mentioned. We’re sorry you had to change your own sheets when you first checked in. The room attendant that cleaned your room will be retrained on our cleaning process and how to properly report maintenance items. We replace long term guest’s sheets every 3 days but we will change them daily if requested or if the water conservation card is placed on the bed. We service all of our guest rooms daily and I’m sorry we failed to service your room on one of the days you were here with us. We do not offer coffee 24 hours in the lobby anymore due to the upgrade we made on our machine and brand. Our breakfast coffee is now freshly brewed and only served during breakfast hours. We provide a coffee maker with regular and decaf coffee in all of our guestrooms. We hope you give us another chance to show you our improvements the next time you visit our area. Thanks again for taking the time to give us your feedback.

Summary Heading: Worst La Quinta I Have Ever Stayed In!
Summary: I booked and traveled to the Costa Mesa La Quinta on 11/13 for a two night stay. Upon checking in around 9:30PM, there was a guy being arrested for a fatal hit and run, inside the lobby. Not a great first impression. I got in my room and immediately noticed there was a very musty smell, as the property is old and not remodeled. I was very tired and decided to go to bed. I got in bed and felt something at my feet. I found someones old sock in my bed. Rather than call the front desk and complain, I slept on top of the sheets.The next morning I went in the bathroom and saw that someone had wet toilet tissue and used the ceiling for target practice. When I went down for breakfast,  I walked outside my room and there was a older disheveled man standing in the stairwell smoking a
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to give us your feedback. We’re very sorry to hear of the items you mentioned. The room attendant that prepared your room will be retrained on our cleaning process to ensure she is not overlooking anything and reporting maintenance items. We do not allow our guests to smoke near our rooms and do not allow marijuana use on our property. The only place we allow smoking on our property is in the smoking section. I spoke to our breakfast attendant and morning agent regarding the breakfast area. Trash should be picked up immediately and there should never be a shortage on food. We will make sure to have a second person helping in breakfast on busy days. Thanks again for your review.

Summary: Traveling with an 84 yr old and 6 yr old for medical appointments.~ Not enough adequate handicap parking~ Dirty room with hair in tub.~ Loud next to SoCal freeway. ~No warm breakfast like other La Quinta facilities. ~Seemed to have transient families and local party kids living there.Nothing more than an over rated Motel 6. As a long term La Quinta Member, not what i expected, and defiantly not happy to have paid for the visit. No thank you!
Manager Response: Thank you Alison for your review.  I do hope you got those medical appointments taken care of while out in the area.  My apologies for the issues you had with the parking and the freeway noise.  Being and exterior property it is difficult to get a parking spot right by your room.  We do have 7 handicap parking spots on the property.  I am sorry that they were all taken those right by your room.  We do have a different breakfast selection compared to that of the La Quinta Inns & Suites.  They have a warm breakfast where as we are La Quinta Inns have the breakfast we offer.  Waffles, 2 toast, 2 bagels, 3 muffins, 3 cereals,  Fruit, Coffee, milk, coco, tea, Oatmeal, Orange Juice and Apple Juice, Yogurt and hard boiled eggs.  We have shared your comments with our housekeeping team and will make sure we do better in cleaning our bathrooms. Thank you again for sharing with us.

Summary: To whom it may concern. I appreciate La Quinta inn, but this room was not up to the standards of what i always expect. The room was a non-smoking room. Room smelled pretty bad, sheets were still wet and the bathroom was clogged. It was an unpleasant stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. We’re very sorry your room had a bad odor and wasn’t up the standards you’re use to receiving at our properties. I spoke to our staff and reminded our room attendants to report bad odors and other maintenance items so they can be addressed before our guests check in. The room attendant that cleaned your room will also be retrained on our cleaning process to ensure she is cleaning her rooms to our high standards. Thanks again for your review. We hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: Not up to La Quinta's usual standards
Summary: There's not much to say.  I generally enjoy staying at La Quinta properties.  The one in Costa Mesa, California needs to be razed to the ground, the rubble hauled away, and burned - lest the debris find its way back into the construction supply chain.  The hotel is run down.  The rooms are small, dirty, and just plain grim.  The mold in the bathrooms is out of control. Stains on the ceiling suggest some troublesome / hidden damage.  But the most annoying thing is that the exterior doors don't seal in any meaningful way. It's situated between Harbor Blvd and the 405 (a freeway). And, because the doors have gaps all around,  the traffic noise is relentless - and it filters in unabated.   Unfortunately, it's also on the budget end of the hotel / motel spectrum.  This particular
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry to hear you did not like our property and of the items you mentioned. Our room attendants are usually very good at reporting maintenance items so they can be addressed before our guests check in. We’re sorry your room had a bad smell and mold in the bathroom. It’s been reported and will be taken care of before the room gets rented again. We will also check the door seals to ensure they are in good condition to help drown out outside noise. We understand our breakfast area is a bit small, so we are hoping to expand it once we get a renovation.  Thanks again for taking the time to give us a review.

Summary: This property is really showing it's age ! The exterior is run down ! Needs paint,pot holes in the parking lot. Chunks missing out of side walks and filthy. The room needs to be updated paint, lamps, carpet was really dirty!! Bathroom was dirty corners were disgusting! Called front desk and informed them of the room condition. I was told that they would let housekeeping know. I never heard anything back !?
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to give us your feedback. We’re very sorry to hear your bathroom was not cleaned properly and we failed to send housekeeping back to address it. I spoke to our front desk staff and reminded them the importance of communication and follow up. I will inspect the room with our head housekeeper and maintenance team to ensure everything is working correctly and cleaned to our standards. We do have an older building and have been working on updating our guestrooms and painting the exterior of the building. We are aware of the parking lot and are waiting for approval to get it repaired. Thanks again for taking the time to give us your review.

Summary: Convenient for Constellation Room where we were attending a show. We were even able to walk back afterwards (once the temperature had dipped overnight!). Reception friendly/helpful when we checked in. Room was comfortable. Only really had time to sleep there during our stay so can't really say more.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re happy to hear you got a good night’s sleep after enjoying an evening at the Observatory! We are within walking distance, so there is no need to pay for parking or a ride. We hope to see you again the next time you visit our area. Thanks again for your review.

Summary: If you are frugal like us....this was perfect!!  We had games in Huntington Beach and Irvine...this was the perfect in between spot...also got to hit sunset beach and crystal cove from this location.  Clean and convenient!
Manager Response: Appreciate your review Jenifer.  We are a great location for the beaches and are pleased you thought the same.  We do hope you did well in your games and enjoyed the weather.  I was happy to hear that the rooms were cleaned to your liking and that we were a convenient hotel to stay at.  Thank you for choosing us and do hope to be your choice once again.

Summary: This place is not up to the usual La Quinta standards we're used to.  The whole place was sad with ground-in dirt everywhere.  The carpet in our room was in desperate need of a steam clean.  The whole outside was in need of a power wash.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   We are very sorry to hear of your negative experience while staying with us.  We appreciate the constructive critique, as we are continuously striving to improve our guest experience.  It is only through your feedback that improvements are considered and made.  Our hope is that you will give us a chance to better serve you in the future.  We very much appreciate your business and thank you for staying with us.    Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary: It started out with a significant problem with the room. The carpet was soaked with cleaning fluid. Unfortunately, my dog walked in before I could catch it. Front desk got a little snarky with me in the room change. No one helped me move my stuff.  Loud pool party with a subsequent domestic violence incident in the room next door. The parking lot is all chopped up and uneven - don't plan on rolling any suitcases across it.  I saw something in another review about the free-for-all breakfast. Very tight space, lots of kids, pushing and shoving.  Part of me thinks I should have known better - The 405 on one side, Hooters on the other. But the inside did not make up for it.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re very sorry to hear you were given a room with wet carpet that wasn’t fully dry from the shampooing. I reminded our staff to ensure carpets are dry before we rent the room out. I also spoke to our security team to ensure they are keeping noise levels down in our public areas. We are aware of the parking lot and are waiting for approval to have it repaired.  We are also planning to expand our breakfast area once we get our renovation. Thanks again for taking the time to give us a review.

Summary Heading: la quinta costa mesa a good property
Summary: this property has a great location and a helpful staff.  the rooms are typical of the chain as far as appointments.  the property could use a facelift and more attention to detail in rooms.  we stay here two to three times per year and the rooms are inconsistent.  some good and some not so good.  the best part is their beds and pillows and are very comfortable.  the bathroom towels are of excellent  quality and size. biggest complaint is the musty smell in some of their rooms.  carpets could use more frequent cleaning and little things like bathroom doors which wont latch and the microwave fridge option updated.  minor issues.  in the la quinta I've stayed at properties which were well below par and others which were near perfect.  Salt lake airport and flagstaff AZ locations

0 stars for this “hotel”! We stay at several LQ properties in Utah and the is the very worst experience our family has ever had staying at a hotel. Our room had no working outlets, an awful musty smell, mold in the bathroom, stained carpet and my wife woke up with a rash on her face from the pillow. We were very disappointed with breakfast it was a free for all, rude guests that were making 6-7 waffles at a time. Small area for such a large number of rooms. The pool was dirty as well. We will never stay there again and will tell people to stay away at all costs. I feel like we deserve our money back. We had planned on staying for 4 days, instead we checked out and never looked back.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to give us your feedback. We’re very sorry to hear we disappointed you and your family. Having a clean, fresh comfortable room with everything working is important and I’m sorry we dropped the ball when preparing your room. I spoke to our room attendants and reminded them to report maintenance items so they can be addressed before our guests check in. I also spoke to our breakfast attendants and we will put an extra person on busy days. We are hoping to expand our seating area when we get our renovation. Thanks again for your review.

Summary Heading: Stayed for the night to see a nearby parade in another city close by
Summary: Best part easy check in front desk personnel was nice and accommodating. Least part is the room assigned was at the end part of the property ,seems isolated and not comfortable to stay there,not enough lights for  visitors to stay in.

It was our first trip to the beach in a while. Pool was very nice. Great location, so close to the beach and the block! Family had a great time and would definitely book again on our next trip out there.

Summary Heading: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE IN EVERY WAY EVERY DAY I WAS THERE
Summary: Previously, I had stayed at this hotel, and my experience was fine.  This time, when I went back, I needed a place for a few weeks, and every single day was impossible to live with.  So summarize, the WiFi was being redone for the hotel, and every day my life and my room were infringed on so that they could work in that room.  Half the time I was told they would be working in the room, so I had to vacate, and then they never did enter the room, and I had to put everything back in the closet after being unable to use my room that day.  One day the electricity was out.  Not their fault, because it was for the general area, but still, it made the accommodations unusable.  When I checked in, the room was infested with fleas.  I had had my dog groomed a couple of days before, and he

Summary Heading: Worst La Quinta Property We Have Ever Stayed In
Summary: The property looks like a dirty prison, the rooms smelled musty, the carpet under the air conditioner was wet, we did not have hot water for a full day and night (and I was there for a family wedding) and the rooms were not thoroughly clean.  The staff was friendly and helpful, though!
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re very sorry to hear we disappointed you and your family during your stay with us. Having a clean, fresh, odor free room is important and I’m sorry this wasn’t the case. I reminded our staff to report bad odors and other maintenance items so they can be addressed before our guests check in. Thanks again for taking the time to tell us about your stay.

Summary Heading: Reasonably price for a hotel that allows dogs
Summary: This the second time I have stayed at this hotel while visiting my son. The hotel and rooms are "so-so" but I am fine with it since this hotel allows dogs with no additional cost. Plus, your stay includes a breakfast with "make-it-yourself" waffles, hot oatmeal, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, toast, bagels, coffee, tea and juice. It's not  awesome but gets your stay started. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Please la quinta upgrade the rooms!
Summary: Average is being kind, needed to switch locations from Anaheim la quinta to Costa mesa, what a difference a stay makes. Front desk was amazing they get 5 stars. The room though"( I'd put pixers of the roach on the wall next to the fridge we paid $6 more a night for, but couldn't stand looking at it was hoping it ran before I got the phone out, thank God it did. I didn't want to complain to the good people up front, please remodel. I enjoy staying at La Quinta in any city. This one I may think twice about.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re very sorry to hear there was a roach in your room. I reported it to our pest control company so they can treat it before being rented again. We’re glad our front desk staff was amazing. Thanks again for your review.

Summary: This LaQuinta used to be acceptable accommodations, but not now. Our room wasn't vacuumed prior to check in.  Following day our room wasn't made up, although the trash and towels had been removed, the bed wasn't made. Vacuumed yes, but the carpet is worn and dirty. The manager on duty got us towels and coffee. Four more nights, our room was never cleaned properly, always missing towels and/or coffee, hair on the bathroom floor wasn't ours. Even the common areas appeared neglected. Stay there again? Probably not. It's a shame.
Manager Response: My apologies Michael for the experience you had here last week.  I did have an issue with a housekeeper that had gotten a second job over night and have been trying to accommodate her and it is just not working out.  I am so sorry that this affected you and your stay.  I have shared your comments with my team and have let them know that we have to do better. And we will.  I appreciate you letting us know how we can improve and can assure you that the next time you stay with us will not be like the last.  Thank you again.

Summary Heading: Worst La Quinta Inn I have been to!
Summary: We regularly stay in La Quinta Inns when we travel with our dog. We have been across the country twice, staying in locations from Ventura CA to Dallas TX. They are usually very nice, though the level of "niceness" does vary from location to location.    Stayed Saturday April 7, 2018 for one night. We had a family function in Huntington Beach that night  and since I had points to use, and the stay would be "free" (well, was $6.50) we figured that it would be better to stay a night rather than drive 100 miles late on a Saturday night.   I should have made a U-Turn the second I realized that this La Quinta Inn shared a parking lot with a Hooters. But it was just for one night...  Was given room 253. We walked into the room and was instantly hit with the strong smell of cigarette
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments and feedback. We’re very sorry to have disappointed you and your family. Having a clean comfortable room and feeling safe is very important and I’m truly sorry this wasn’t the case. We would like to speak with you regarding a resolution for the inconveniences you experienced. Would you mind contacting us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com so we may discuss with you personally? Thanks again for your review. We hope to hear from you soon.

Summary: I've stayed here many times in the past but my last stay on Friday April 6th 2018 was horrible.  At about 1am there was a group of men arguing outside my room on the second floor.  I peeked out my window and saw four men drinking and being loud and obnoxious and seemed to be arguing for 20 minutes.  I called front desk and they told they were sending a security guard.  After 10 minutes I called agin because the problem was not solved.  Front desk told me that the security guard walked by and said no one was outside.  I told front desk that security never came by because I could still see and here the ruckus outside my window.  I told her I was going to call the local PD, she asked me not to call PD.  She sent security who told them to keep it down.  It took the hotel an hour to
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re very sorry to hear there were guests making noise at 1am and it took over an hour for our security team to respond. I spoke to our staff and security team and reminded them of the importance of keeping our property quiet especially during late hours. If we get a noise complaint, we give the guest one warning before we ask them to check out. I’m sorry this wasn’t the case during your stay but we will make sure this does not happen again. Thanks again for your review. We hope to see you again.

Summary: Room was dirty, mold in the bathroom, very loud (right next to the freeway and the hotel rooms are all outside). Breakfast was not good and they ended it early our last day. I will not stay here again.
Manager Response: Heidi,  Thanks for your review and for the opportunity to respond to your concerns. We are extremely disappointed to hear about the issues you encountered with your room, noise, and breakfast. We are so sorry this occurred during your visit and have shared your comments with our management staff to ensure the issues are corrected immediately.  We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and hope you will stay with us again in the future.    Sincerely,	 Diana - LQ Customer Care

Summary Heading: La Quinta takes another step down
Summary: My wife and I have frequented La Quinta hotels for 30 years, and up until the last 4 years they held a "standard of quality" that could be relied upon.  Lately, during our travels we are encountering badly maintained and "tired" hotels, average staff, and in one case (documented in another review from a couple of years ago), a nightmare stay.  At this hotel in Costa Mesa we paid for a top-notch suite, and found this La Quinta is in the bottom tier, very tired, many coats of paint, you could see daylight all the way around the entrance door, the bathroom was so small you almost had to back into it and choose either the toilet or shower, and the bed had a rubber mat under the sheet (which made us wonder who they rent rooms to on a regular basis!).  The carpet was so old it was
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments and feedback. We’re thankful to have you as a loyal guest but sorry to hear of the inconsistency you’ve been experiencing. Your comments are concerning to us and we would like to better understand what happened during your stay. Would you mind contacting us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com so we may discuss with you personally? Thanks again for your review. We hope to hear from you soon.

Summary: LaQuinta Costa Mesa treated my son and myself courteously and professionally. Room was as clean and neat. The front desk courteous and professional. /the location suited my needs. I have stayed here before and will stay there again in the future.
Manager Response: Thanks for your nice comments and feedback. We’re glad to hear you and your son enjoy staying at our property and always receive great service! Thanks again for your review. We’ll see you next time!

Summary Heading: GOOD HOTEL.  GOOD PLACE TO STAY.  EXCELLENT VALUE.
Summary: I always feel like Lal Quinta does a Very Good job of providing a nice room with all the amenities one wants and needs.  I first stayed in a La Quinta in Tucson, AZ, back in 1980.  I've liked them the best, and used them the most frequently ever since.  They are truly dog friendly.  I always travel with my best pal, Romeo, my 13 year old, 15 pound Black Miniature Poodle.  He is an absolute gentleman.  They always give Romeo a big welcome when we come into the lobby.  The bed is comfortable, the room is roomy and nice.  Good size fridge.  Microwave.  Coffee maker.  TV.  Free Internet.  Big, nice bathroom.  Excellent HV/AC unit.  Everything works fine.  The crew at the front desk, any time of day or night is friendly, smiling, accommodating, and excellent.  The only reason I
Manager Response: Thanks for your nice comments. We’re very happy to hear you’ve been staying with our brand since 1980 and we’re thankful to have you as our guest! Not many hotels are pet friendly nowadays and we’re glad to accommodate you and your pal, Romeo. We will check the door seals in the room you were in to ensure they are in good condition for our next guests. Thanks again for your feedback!

Summary Heading: All these negative reviews must be written for a reason...
Summary: The fact that this place considers themselves a "hotel" is a disservice to all of the hotels within a 500ft square mile radius of Orange County. It is a motel, at best.  Cockroaches, black mold, dirt/leaves blowing under the door with the door shut, obvious smells of smoke in the rooms, paper thin walls... I can keep going if you'd like. Traveler beware, you're better off trying your luck at a Hostel from an Eli Roth movie than staying at this absolutely disgusting "hotel".  I stayed here because I was in the OC for a week in a class for my work, and upon checking out, saw a charge on my credit card for $300+. I called to speak with a staff member about this, and told them at the time I was checking in all that was told to me from the front desk clerk was that my credit card
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re very sorry to hear you did not like our property and your comments are concerning to us. Would you mind contacting us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com so we may discuss with you personally? We hope to hear from you soon.

Summary: Stayed here for Disney, also a big music conference going on, rooms were good cheap and clean.. a big place and yet it was packed each night, breakfast included as well, plenty of car parking and easy access to the free way and to disneyland.
Manager Response: Thanks for your score and nice comments. We’re very happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and our location was just right for your needs. We hope to see you again the next time you’re in our area. Thanks again for your review!

Summary: I've stayed here twice.  The rooms facing the 405 are little bit nicer, and more newly renovated.    The rooms facing south coast dr are older, and have a bad smell.  I probably won't stay here again because the quality of the room on my second stay was really bad.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and feedback. We’re sorry to hear the room you were in on your second stay had a bad odor. I reminded our room attendants to report bad odors and maintenance items so they can be addressed before our guests check in. Thanks again for your review.

Summary Heading: DISGUSTING! Don't stay here! BUGS, URINE, SPIDERS, DIRTY!
Summary: Our stay at La Quinta was awful! The room reeked of smoke and urine. There were spiders and roaches, no coffee in lobby ever except in the mornings until it ran out. Their only “hot” breakfast was waffles. Juice was watery. No newspapers in lobby.
