Summary Heading: Good hotel for traveling with pets
Summary: needed a hotel that would allow pets.  Room was good size and the bedding was comfortable and clean. Bathroom looked like is was recently refurbished and the air conditioning worked fine.  Had room on first floor next to the office.  Can hear freeway traffic so ran the air conditioning fan and that masked the noise sufficiently.  Overall, good value and much better than I expected based upon the reviews I read.  Will definitely stay here again when I travel to the Irvine area with my pet.

The hotel was located near a highway so was a little bit noisy, Also it's scary at night. The breakfast buffet was limited and doesn't suit everybody taste. There is a bus station near the hotel which was so helpful.

I felt like I was not safe here. The rooms smell horrible. The outside is dirty and aged. This hotel needs a complete overhaul. It is right off the freeway and seems to attract an unsavory group of guests. I will never stay at this property again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  Your opinion and satisfaction is very important to us and I am very sorry we were unable to meet your expectations.  Rest assured that your comments are taken to heart and we will do everything we can to improve. Thank you for sharing with us.

Summary: Horrible, worst stay ever. Could not get a wink of sleep due to loud noises all night long. There were two men sleeping on the bench at the end of the floor near elevator. No security in sight. When I reported the noise problem, the clerk offered no apology, offer to make a room change or anything else. I will NEVER stay here again!!!
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay. We’re sorry about the experiences you’ve mentioned, and your comments are concerning to us. We take service quite seriously, and we’d like to better understand what happened during your stay. Would you mind contacting us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com so we may discuss with you personally? We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: This hotel is located next to the 405 and a Hooters restaurant. The noise from the freeway is significant, no matter where your room is located. If you are sensitive to noise, make sure and take earplugs and get a room facing Hooters. My initial room was facing the freeway and even with earplugs I could not sleep so I asked to be moved to a new room and was able to do that. Even with that change, I could hear the freeway noise, but I could sleep. The room was clean but showed definite signs of wear. There was a frig and microwave in the room, which I wasn't expecting. On the other side of the freeway there is an In n Out Burger (So Cal institution, a must have for your OC visit) and a Chik Fil A for quick meals if you're okay with fast food. If you're a health food person, make

I have stayed at many La Quinta hotels as I have pets. Mainly the experiences have been good but I have to say this La Quinta is in terrible shape. It is run down and next to the 405 freeway which what was expected but what is inexcusable was that the grounds were very dirty with overflowing trash cans and cigarette butts everywhere. The breakfast was the worst I have ever had at a La Quinta and mainly consisted of boiled eggs and machine generated coffee. I was more than happy to drive away early the next morning, but not before I was yelled at by another "guest" from the balcony. As a single woman travelling alone I would not stay here again. Did I mention it was next door to a Hooters?!
Manager Response: We appreciate you sharing your comments, and we’re sorry we disappointed you during your stay with us. Being able to have a comfortable room that meets your expectations is important. We’ve definitely got some training opportunities and your feedback will help us correct these issues with our team.

Summary Heading: Nice staff but hotel is next to a noisy major highway and Hooters
Summary: Stayed at the hotel for seven nights in Sept 2016 while visiting my daughter in nearby Tustin.  Pros: Nice welcoming staff who always had a smile and kind greeting. Standard free hotel buffet with a lot of carbs/starches (waffles, bagels, toast, muffins) and bananas that were barely ripe at my first breakfast and then awfully black/splotchy by my last breakfast. Free strong wifi. Room pretty clean. Bath/shower water heated quickly and was plentiful. Paid washer/dryer available on each floor near the staircase. Pool that was empty every time I passed it. Plenty of free parking. Couldn't hear neighbors. Easy highway access and walkable to Ikea. Plenty of shopping nearby that is an easy drive away.  Cons: Next to a major highway, it was my full view leaving the room every day. The
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry the hotel did not meet your expectations. We’ll share your comments with our staff so that we may improve our operation and prevent similar situations from happening to other travelers. We appreciate you sharing your feedback with our team.

Summary: Moldy, health hazard. Hotel needs to be demolished and rebuilt. Staff was very nice...Manager did not hesitate to refund me two days of my three day stay...after I showed him the pictures of the rooms with the health issues.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry the hotel did not meet your expectations. We’ll share your comments with our staff so that we may improve our operation and prevent similar situations from happening to other travelers. We appreciate you sharing your feedback with our team.

Summary Heading: Issues with plumbing and mildew smell
Summary: I reported the issues to the front desk 3 times, but there was no solution to the water not draining fast enough during showers. The plumbing was a major issue because the water pooled around my ankles during showers. That just seemed really gross to me.
Manager Response: We appreciate you sharing your comments, and we’re sorry we didn’t follow up with your shower during your stay. Being able to have a comfortable room that meets your expectations is important. We’ve definitely got some training opportunities and your feedback will help us correct these issues with our team.

Summary: A very nice place to stay for whatever purpose. Clean, friendly staff, good breakfast, centrally located in Orange County, and there is a Hooters restaurant close by. The area is very quiet and the beds are very comfortable. Swimming pool on site, dog friendly.

Summary Heading: Just a bad place to stay
Summary: Very unfriendly staff. the front desk people acts like you were bothering them by staying there. The breakfast was hard boil eggs. you can't call it a meal. the coffee was like water down used over grounds.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry the hotel did not meet your expectations. We’ll share your comments with our staff so that we may improve our operation and prevent similar situations from happening to other travelers. We appreciate you sharing your feedback with our team.

Summary: Rooms facing freeway are very noisy and noise policy after 10PM.  People in all rooms surrounding us were up talking and laughing all night.  Walls very thin.  Parking sucks on weekends as hotel is next to Hooters and Hooters customers are not prohibited from using hotel parking spaces.  We had to park at far end of Hooters lot on Saturday night and walk a distance to our room.

Excellent front office staff. Very professional, courteous, and quick to serve.  Very good breakfast. The room size is small. Limited variety. Well taken care. It is well kept room and service. Room and bathroom is small. Clean and tidy. Good bed. Good internet speed If there is good deal in future, will make stay again.
Manager Response: Feedback as yours is what we strive for.  We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay and that you will return and be again with La Quinta.  We appreciate your business and look forward to continue to improve were we can to continue growing.

Summary Heading: Too Close to the San Diego Freeway
Summary: I wasn't really comfortable at this motel.  I was forced to park quite a distance from my room.  There was only one elevator I could use, which was also quite a distance from my room.  The walkways were not clean.  The balcony I had to walk on to get to my room was right next to the very busy San Diego Freeway.  I could hear traffic noise during the night which disrupted my sleep.  I thought even the approach to the motel, over a bridge near Hooters Restaurant was a bit downscale.  I don't think I will ever stay at this motel again.  There are too many other places to spend the night in Orange County, and I would be willing to pay more money to get a better night's rest.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry the hotel did not meet your expectations. We’ll share your comments with our staff so that we may improve our operation and prevent similar situations from happening to other travelers. We appreciate you sharing your feedback with our team.

Summary: I always stay at La Quinta because I travel with a pet. If I would have known how close to the I-405 San Diego Fwy this hotel was, I wouldn't have stayed there. If you stay here, don't stay on the side of the hotel facing the fwy. Fwy noise all night long. Got about 2 hrs of sleep.

I have been staying at this hotel for over 8 years every time I go to So California.  This was my worst experience to date.  The shower had too much mold growing in it to have been deep cleaned anytime recently.  The toilet leaked and when we advised the front desk, no one did anything to fix it. Breakfast was still good.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am very happy that you were pleased with the breakfast. However, I am sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with the room in general. This is definitely not the kind of experience we want our guests to have. I'm sorry about the issues you encountered.  Providing a clean, comfortable room to our guest is important to us. I will make sure your comments are shared with the team, so we can use this for further training purposes.  I hope you will give us another chance.

Summary: Conveniently located right off the express. But on that note it was a little noisy.  Just a little disappointed there were no restaurants close by other than Hooters (really not a fan of that). Also, missed having a fridge in the room.

Summary Heading: Good intent & checkin staff however poor execution
Summary: Difficult checkin & reservation experience that lead to no reservation at all for 2 of 10+ dates I chose on two separate stays at different properties. For a seasoned business traveler and staff that is a pain I would avoid just pay the extra $20-50 and stay at a big box chain.  The last stay was bad enough hygiene or lack there of  a “stain” (still not sure what it was but lets just call it a disturbing experience that was the first thing I saw and of course was their last room) right in the middle of the nice white comforter. That was for the kids sake GROSS.   I returned the completed customer satisfaction survey that took more time that hit my email this morning. I detailed in a positive manner my experience and the fact that was strike two for La Quinta followed by the
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay. We’re sorry about the experiences you’ve mentioned, and your comments are concerning to us. We take service and cleanliness quite seriously, and we’d like to better understand what happened during your stay. Would you mind contacting us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com so we may discuss with you personally? We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: Room was clean and the bed and pillows were very comfortable.  The staff was really friendly and very accommodating.  John Wayne/Santa Ana airport is less than 10 minutes away.  It could use some updating, but I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Costa Mesa Aera Trip! Stay in La Quinta Inn
Summary: Best Hotel to stay in Orange County / Costa Mesa Area, price, location is very good. You have a Hooters restaurant just beside the Hotel that  helps if yo want to have lunch or dinner fast. Just beside the Highway so you gan get anywhere also very fast.

Needs to be torn down and rebuilt. The walkways are in need of a powerwash....walking up to the room they are stained and filthy. Rooms are not much better. Old nasty paint, dirty walls. Rooms smell. They do have smoking rooms here and whoever is smoking must be close as the smoke comes in your room, which already smelled stale anyway.  DArk paint on the walls of the room just make it look all the more dank in there. Hard bed with old flare pillows and scratchy sheets. Breakfast in the morning was a joke. Waffles were the best thing. The normal hotel Waffles. A few sad bagels, an apple and bananna, some yogurt. Parking lot is a pot marked, hole filled mess. This isn't even a step up from a Motel 6. You might as well stay in one of those scary no name hotels. Really, just do not
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay. We’re sorry about the experiences you’ve mentioned, and your comments are concerning to us. We take service and cleanliness quite seriously, and we’d like to better understand what happened during your stay. Would you mind contacting us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com so we may discuss with you personally? We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: I stay at La Quinta's frequently and found it a safe choice. Just checked in a three night reservation. I was lucky to have a room at the back of the hotel away from the freeway. The photos do not show the true state of the rooms. Carpets appear not to have been cleaned in years, walls need cleaning, desk leg is broken, no tissue in the bathroom, tiny ants crawling on the walls by the door, air conditioner cannot be adjusted and the rooms smell so musty I don't know if I can handle fulfilling my reservation. This is not the standard of the La Quinta I know. I would not recommend this hotel until the rooms are given a good clean.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback about our La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry the hotel did not meet your expectations. We’ll share your comments with our staff so that we may improve our operation and prevent similar situations from happening to other travelers. We appreciate you sharing your feedback with our team. We hope you’ll once again choose La Quinta Inn and Suites for your lodging needs.

Summary: This location was right next too the freeway. The room door had no weather stripping to keep the noise down. There was also no padding on their mattresses which made sleeping near impossible. The customer service was very good and the free breakfast included Belgian waffles.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We’re sorry the hotel did not meet your expectations. We’ll share your comments with our staff so that we may improve our operation and prevent similar situations from happening to other travelers. We appreciate you sharing your feedback with our team.

Summary: No wi-fi access in room. There was mold on shower tiles. Carpet has old musty smell, needs updating. Someone had thrown up in ice machine, when staff was informed, there was no urgency to clean it or inform others.
Manager Response: We’ve received your comments regarding your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry for the issues you encountered and appreciate you taking the time to write of your experience. We’ve definitely got some training opportunities and your feedback will help us correct these issues with our team.

Summary Heading: Comfortable but in need of renovation
Summary: The place is clean but there is a lot of rust, fractures in the walls, old windows, cracks in the tubs and oxidation on the showerheads. The carpets are in need of cleaning however you can tell they are maintained to the best of their ability. Staff is courteous and location is just off the freeway with dining next door (Hooters). It is a decent place to lay your head for the night.

The hotel room, check in and out were fine. The noise from the Freeway was bad. Location was very good and it was nice to have a Hooters next door for dinner. I will book a room on the other side of property to get away from the freeway noise.

The room was DISGUSTING!  I checked in at 11 PM intending to stay for 5 nights, but packed the car at 5 AM the next morning and checked out to find another hotel! One bed had hair on the pillow, stains on the sheets, and a twig!
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback regarding your recent stay. We're very concerned about the issues you've mentioned. We are very sorry for the issues you have experienced. I would like to chat with you further. Can you please reach out to me at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com? Thanks again for your review. and we're looking forward to chatting with you soon!

Summary: In my opinion the only thing your paying for is the fact you are a 15 minute drive from the beach, other then that everything else was poor, the pictures for this location do not show justice its MUCH worse. yuck

I enjoy staying at this hotel. its in a good neighborhood with lots of food places and Target right by it. Not an expensive hotel. You get what you pay for. It doesn't have fancy upgrades, but the staff is nice and the rooms are clean. I would definitely stay there again.

We arrived at 11:30 for noon check in and they told us to come back to check if its ready at 1:30. This was very inconvenient with a 1 year old in tow. Also the carpets, microwave and bathtub were absolutely disgusting! So was the crib that was provided. It was very noisy late at night and early in the morning. You can definitely hear the people in rooms adjacent to yours.

the hotel looked like the pictures on the website. the manager and front desk staff was excellent. Being right next door to Hooters was great. everything was great, the rooms, the area, location, we all liked the place very much and we look forward to staying here next time we are in town. thanks La Quinta inn for being there for us and having good maid service and for giving us military great rates. thanks very much

What a great place to stay. The staff was incredibly friendly and went above and beyond to handle and concerns we had. The hotel was clean and well kept. We were I. A great location. Literally minutes from Huntington Beach and Anaheim. Even with a room close to the pool it was still a peaceful stay. The breakfast offered was great. Would boom again in a heart  beat

Summary Heading: Very Close to Calvary Chapel Costa Mesa
Summary: We stayed at the La Quinta during the pastor's conference at Calvary Chapel Costa Mesa. It is a 5 minute drive to the church; which is awesome. It is an average hotel, but for the price and location it is great. The ocean is around 20 minutes south of the hotel and we enjoyed that too. There are a whole lot of restaurants near by.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive post.  You are correct we are just down the street from The Calvary Chapel as well as the South Coast Plaza Mall.  Many food places and parks too.  Not too far from the Airport as well.  I understand the Chapel has a variety of events throughout the year and hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Good stay except that the wifi never did work and staff only told us to call tech support. If you need to have wifi provided by the hotel then don't stay here. Otherwise nice place and bed was comfortable!

We were highly impressed with the hotel and all of the staff and warmly welcomed! My husband was sincerely thanked for his service in the Navy also. Excellent room, fabulous military discount,awesome!

As a frequent user of La Quinta we thought we would use points and save a little money.  It was only for one night.  How bad could it be. Well....  It is definitely an older property.  The rooms had been refurbished at some time but looked like they have had a lot of use since their remodel.   Neither the tub nor the sink drained well.  If you don't want the freeway noise be sure to request a room on the back side of the hotel.  No guarantee you won't have the noise of folks next door nor of those walking down the outside corridors however.  The breakfast was good.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback about our La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry the hotel did not meet your expectations. We’ll share your comments with our staff so that we may improve our operation and prevent similar situations from happening to other travelers. We appreciate you sharing your feedback with our team. We hope you’ll once again choose La Quinta Inn and Suites for your lodging needs.

Summary: I was expecting little more from this hotel, it just looked like another motel 6 with a premium price. Nothing beyond that. (and I like motel 6 for the money I pay). That night I was needing a place to stay so badly that I didn't care how much I was being charged.

Overall it's a good hotel. It does get crowed sometimes and hard to get a reservation in certain times of the summer months. The staff are very nice and helpful. The room service is great as well. If you ask them for anything extra in your room, they will give it to you. Location is good, it's in the middle of everything. The beach is close by. Lots of places to eat nearby as well. Parking is a pain sometimes when they are filled up.

Summary Heading: Cheap, yes-- But Spend More Money Elsewhere
Summary: This motel is in need of some renovations and maintenance.  We've never stayed anywhere quite as uncomfortable as this place.  The two stars are for their efforts to quiet some partying neighbors, for the breakfast (waffles, oatmeal, cereal, fruit, bagels, yogurt, juices, coffee), and for the free wi-fi.  We stayed on the second level facing the 405 and heard traffic all night but that was the least of our concerns.  The carpets are pretty stained and obviously old, the room smells musty, the bathroom walls had splatters and smears on them (yeah, THOSE kind of splatters and smears), the TV remote didn't work, housekeeping left one bed untouched twice, they never left enough towels, and the a/c unit was acting funny (cooling fine but kept turning on and off every minute or two).
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay at our La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry about the experiences you’ve mentioned, and your comments are concerning to us. We take service and cleanliness quite seriously, and we’d like to better understand what happened during your stay. Would you mind contacting us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com so we may discuss with you personally? We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: We booked this hotel for 5 nights.  We went out for a day.  Before we left, I specifically talked to front desk to make sure they clean the room, since we left at 2pm.  When we came back at 8pm, the room was not cleaned.  I asked the room to be cleaned at that time, but the person at the front desk saying he is the only person around, and no one can clean the room.  The is the worst hotel I have ever stayed.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback about our La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry the hotel did not meet your expectations. We’ll share your comments with our staff so that we may improve our operation and prevent similar situations from happening to other travelers. We appreciate you sharing your feedback with our team. We hope you’ll once again choose La Quinta Inn and Suites for your lodging needs.

Summary: This was the nastiest place I have ever stayed. Everything from the carpet to the bedding was disgusting. Find another place to stay! It was poorly maintained and looked like something you would see at the Haunted House at Disneyland.
Manager Response: We’ve received your comments regarding your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry for the issues you encountered and appreciate you taking the time to write of your experience. We’ve definitely got some training opportunities and your feedback will help us correct these issues with our team.

Summary: We choose this hotel because we didn't want to spend a fortune and were out of other viable options for the night. The rate was reasonable. The location wasn't too bad, although there were some police in the parking lot dealing with some sort of situation when we arrived.   The room was well worn, smelled of smoke, and there was a ponytail holder on the bathroom floor when we arrived. Otherwise the room appeared to be clean. The beds were extremely soft, as in sit on mattress and sink down nearly to boxspring.  We woule not stay at the this hotel again.

The initial room given to us (106) smelled like smoke.  Then they moved us to room 130.  I didn't notice that they gave us 1 key.  So about 11 pm someone is trying to get into our room.  We have 2 young girls freaking out and scared to go to sleep.  We called the front desk and they inactivated our key.  At check out I mentioned the incident.  All I got was, I'm sorry that happened."  REALLY?  I haven't stayed at LaQuinta in a few years.  That sealed the deal for me.  I think it was my last stay.  I still can't believe the entire situation.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry about the issues you experienced during your stay with us. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Would you please contact us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com? We’re looking forward to hearing from you!

Summary Heading: Decent value but time for updating.
Summary: I am a fan of La Quinta properties generally. Have 'Elite' status. This location needs updating. Also more housekeeping staff as I have arrived a few times around 4pm and room was not ready. Lots of 'worker' guests that smoke as well. Make sure to smell your room before comitting to it. Need to run a/c fan all night long to drown out very nearby i405 traffic. Hooters right next door if you are hungry. Hopefully the rates stay reasonable until they refresh the rooms otherwise I will try someplace else. Lots of other choices nearby.

Really not worth the rate. Ok if you are desperate. But I stay in La Quintas as often as I can and this was by far the worst one. Bed options are limited, plumbing backs up in showers. Mold starting in on bathroom walls. Rooms smell musty.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry about the issues you experienced during your stay with us. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Would you please contact us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com? We’re looking forward to hearing from you!

Summary: I like La Quinta in general and often stay because the rates are reasonable and rooms are usually clean, the beds are comfortable and they allow pets (we often travel with our two small dogs).  I have never been disappointed in a La Quinta before.  In addition, they offer a breakfast, (some locations offer more variety than others).  However, this particular property is in need of work.  My room was not as clean as it should have been -- mold in the bathtub and toilet area, horribly stained carpet throughout the room (I did not want to walk barefoot on it), and stains on the bedspread.  This hotel is also right next door to a Hooters restaurant, and rooms on that side of the hotel experience noise until the restaurant closes.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay at our La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry about the experiences you’ve mentioned, and your comments are concerning to us. We take cleanliness quite seriously, and we’d like to better understand what happened during your stay. Would you mind contacting us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com so we may discuss with you personally? We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: The service was excellent , the staff was very helpful, the room was clean and well stocked,and the breakfast was good and fresh and well stocked. The King bed was very comfortable,and the room was very clean.

I was very disappointed in the accommodations, rooms were dirty, bath was in need of new fixtures and cleaning. For the price I expected a cleaner well kept room. They advertised this La Quinta as being recently up dated. If this was an up dated room, I would hate to see what it looked like before. I will not stay at this La Quinta again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay at our La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry about the experiences you’ve mentioned, and your comments are concerning to us. We take cleanliness quite seriously, and we’d like to better understand what happened during your stay. Would you mind contacting us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com so we may discuss with you personally? We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: Staff was good. Carpets were filthy.  There is some transient activity in the area that affected my sense of security.  My previous stays at different La Quinta locations provided clean rooms with good carpet.
Manager Response: We’ve received your comments regarding your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry for the issues you encountered and appreciate you taking the time to write of your experience. We’ve definitely got some training opportunities and your feedback will help us correct these issues with our team.

Summary Heading: A bit sketchy at first glance, but OK in the end
Summary: First off, it is a little tough finding this place. There is just one turn in right into the Hooters parking lot. The building looks a little run down with sketchy looking people. I didn't realize that there were no interior hallways to access rooms.  Windows are single pane so you hear all the freeway noise. We had a room looking over the pool, so late night gatherings are also a nuisance. Luckily the folks gathered ended their shenanigans around 11pm.  Area in general is nice- hotel is close to a lot of fun things and good places to eat. Also close to freeway. I also liked the fact that breakfast was included and our room had a fridge and microwave which came in handy.

I have had positive experiences at every La Quinta I have stayed at except this one.  There is a manager, Vinny, who was horrible to me.  I hardly ever right a negative review but this manager and this property are way below par.  Location is right up against the 405 freeway and right next to a Hooters.  Super loud, crappy breakfast, bad service from Vinny.  The rooms are decent.  Not pretty but functional.  Parking is really bad, I had to park at Hooters.  The best thing about this last stay is that my car did not get broken into.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry about the issues you experienced during your stay with us. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Would you please contact us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com? We’re looking forward to hearing from you!

Summary: The hotel is less than 100 feet from the 405 freeway and the rooms are outside access meaning maximum traffic noise.  Bathtub knobs different types and from the 60's. Staff thanked me for my service and were pleasant.  Internet service was fast enough at 16Mbits.  For the price you get what you pay for.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We sincerely regret the disturbance.  Our location can mean extra street activity on weekends, as much as we try to contain it.  On your next visit, we would be happy to assign one of our quieter rooms upon request.  We hope to see you soon.  Thanks, LQ Customer Care

Summary: we were here for activities at the fairgrounds. Its close and located near food and Starbucks and lots of shopping. Its also very close to the freeway and hooters which make it noisy. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are old but clean and have desk and comfortable chair to work and pets are welcom

Excellent room for the value, location and easy access to freeway, places to eat, shop and gas. I travel alone with 2 small dogs, I feel very safe and secure. I especially like the access the pet area very convenient and always supplied with doggy bags.

Summary Heading: Wonderful staff and great nights sleep
Summary: My adventure began on check.  The staff was really nice and accommodating.  We asked for a few things to be adjusted and with in an hour we were called in the room to make sure our stay was okay.  They were on top of any request asked and to double check if we were happy...amazing!   Special thanks to Matt at the front desk!

This Hotel is in a great location although it needs some serious TLC...It doesn't look like LaQuinta has put any money in this property for a while.  My room was clean and tidy, although the carpet looked so old I didn't dare walk on it barefoot, it had to have 20 years of stains, wear and tear etc...All in all though, if you're looking for an inexpensive place to sleep, this property will do...Aloha

The outside of this property is deplorable. Disgustingly filthy. No attempt is being made to maintain the property. The carpeting in the room makes your skin crawl. The bed was moderately comfortable in comparison. "Breakfast" is the worst coffee in the world, stale cereal with warm milk. The eating area is terribly depressing. The management asks for your opinion as if it cares. There's no way they don't know exactly how little money they've spent on upkeep.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know what you observed. I apologize for the poor impression that was made.  You have noted the deficiencies during your stay and I will make sure that these items are address with our Maintenance Manager.  I would like to thank you for staying with us and hope you will give us another opportunity to be of service.  Please do not hesitate to contact me personally should you like to discuss this issue.  LQCustomerCare@lqreviews.com  Sincerely, LQ Customer Care

Summary: Hotel was in poor condition (paint on the walls and railing were pealing), unpleasant odors in passageways. There were many smokers on all floors. We had difficulty with key-cards and getting our reservations correct and straightened out. The single entrance was difficult to find and the sign was not lit.
Manager Response: We’ve received your comments regarding your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry for the issues you encountered and appreciate you taking the time to write of your experience. We’ve definitely got some training opportunities and your feedback will help us correct these issues with our team.

Summary: room was good for me and my 2 small dogs . Bathroom was clean,shower was good. Hot water was a little slow to come out, wasted water.Bed good, cable good,wifi good. I missed a micro wave to warm up my starbucks coffee in the morning. Good facilities to walk my dogs. All in all good and the price and location great.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful remarks, which I have shared with our staff.  We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Thanks, LQ Customer Care

Summary: I phoned before my stay to assure that there was an airport shuttle, and was told "yes".  But I found, upon airport arrival, that the shuttle operated only between 10 am and 6 pm, so I had to take a $20 taxi ride each way, adding $40 to my stay.  My reservation made no mention of shuttle limitation.    This is NOT, as advertised, an airport hotel!! It is at least 15 miles from the airport.    The motel is in a horrible scary area and in a generally deplorably-maintained state and perched virtually ON the freeway.     The only visible nearby restaurant was a Hooters next door = awful!
Manager Response: We’ve received your comments regarding your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry for the issues you encountered and appreciate you taking the time to write of your experience. We’ve definitely got some training opportunities and your feedback will help us correct these issues with our team.

Summary Heading: Decent room, for a stay in the area.
Summary: The room was in decent shape, bathroom, shower, sink all worked well. TV, HVAC also operated well. Did find a couple of bottle caps from the previous guest left on the floor. The breakfast provided was pretty plain, and the selections were minimal. As I was attending a function in the immediate area, the hotel was the suggested place to stay, and was convenient.

Very old and run down.  Needs to be refurbished, painted and carpets replaced.  Very loud traffic noise and odor coming from the interstate.  About a 15 minute drive from John Wayne airport.  The shuttle only operates from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry about the issues you experienced during your stay with us. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Would you please contact us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com? We’re looking forward to hearing from you!

Summary Heading: A Different La Quinta Inn Experience
Summary: My room was located above the pool. The Wifi/Internet service did not work. I reported my concerns to the Front Desk and they mentioned that the property is having challenges with the Wifi in that area. This La Quinta Inn is located on the busy 405 Freeway. Be aware that you will not have peace and quiet when you sleep because the traffic from the cars is very loud, In addition, you will encounter people at all hours of the night and day. I encountered a homeless woman with her personal belongings in garbage bags sitting on the stairs asking for money as well as other guests who appeared to be under the influence of alcohol or drugs.   Housekeeping was good because they were on time and always provided clean towels along with cleaning and making the bed.   Overall, you get what
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback about our La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re sorry the hotel didn’t meet your expectations. We’ll share your comments with our staff so that we may improve our operation and prevent similar situations from happening to other travelers. We appreciate you sharing your feedback with our team. We hope you’ll once again Choose La Quinta Inns and Suites for your lodging needs.

Summary: when I visit orange county, i always stay La Quinta Inn John Wayne Orange County Airport. It is a little bit old but I can get everything what I need. fridge, microwave... Big point is easy access to fwy405. breakfast is a lot of selection and can bring to the room.  HOOTERS restaurant is on site.

Great bang for your buck!  I stayed at the LaQuinta John Wayne Orange County Airport.  It was conveniently located near the Fair Ground where I was attending an exhibition.  They had a great complimentary breakfast, and, best of all, there was no charge to bring my furry friend, since pups are welcome!

Easy and Quick access to I-405 freeway. Ikea nearby and many outlining cities are minutes away. Hooters is right next door for all day and late night food.  Pets friendly hotel.  Swimming pool in secure area of court yard
Manager Response: Thanks for your recommendation! If there is anything we can do to assist in the future, please don’t hesitate to reach out to our team here at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa!

Summary: Great price but not the best quality. A little old and not much amenities like other LQ hotels I've stayed at. If you need an affordable hotel this is the place. Great staff and service with basic amenities (gym, pool, complimentary breakfast, Wi-Fi, and free parking). Perfect for pets with no additional fees :).Overall great value.

Summary Heading: Frankly, It was "Vinny" the desk clerk who caused my "Excellent" rating.
Summary: I wasn't having the best day.  I hurt my back loading luggage in our car in the morning.  It was a long drive, the last hour or so of which I was forced to contend with the sun constantly peeking around the visor straight into my eyeballs.  And then the GPS lady who lives in our dashboard was late making some calls, and I had missed a few turns.  Consequently I arrived at LaQuinta in a crappy/crabby mood, almost wishing someone would say something that would give me an adequate excuse to vent the pent up ire in my head.  Vinny the desk clerk, however, disappointed.  He had our reservation right at hand, and quickly and efficiently got us checked in.  He then proceeded to answer my questions before I could even ask them!  When he discovered we had an early flight and were

Overall the stay was bad.  Rooms need deep cleaning and the morning breakfast had moldy bagels. Also, the heater was very noisy.  The grounds were not lit well with a lot of dark corners.  The hotel also needs bigger signs to direct you to the single elevator. I would not recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review regarding your last stay. I’m truly sorry for the inconveniences you experienced. We take uncleanliness issues very seriously. Your comments have been shared with our staff and we will insure these types of situations do not occur in the future.  I would like to address your concerns directly. Please contact us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

Summary: Bathroom clean.  Room had filthy carpet, smelled like animals, furniture old and beaten down, also dirty and smelly.  Asked for sheets to cover all the furniture.  Towels were scratchy.  Was happy I brought my own sheet, blanket and pillows.
Manager Response: We've read your review of our La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We're concerned about the issues you're mentioning about room conditions. We'd like to chat with you further about your situation so we can ensure what you've experienced doesn't happen again. Would you mind reaching out to us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com so we can talk to you further? Thanks for your feedback, and we're hoping to hear from you soon!

Summary: Hotel with nice, friendly front desk personell. Room was a little dated, in need of paint, and electrical outlets. Room was well equipped with Frig, Microwave, flat screen TV. Breakfast was more than adequate.

We needed a midpoint stop on this journey and chose this hotel. Previously we had stayed at La Qunta at Santa Ana and were not thrilled with that one so tried another in the area.  The hotel room was clean but the carpets needed a good shampoo. The bed was comfortable as are all La Quinta beds - at least the places where we have stayed.  Checkin and checkout were efficient and the breakfast was basic with waffles available for something hot.  Next door was a Hooters and we dined there which saved driving around looking for a restaurant.

Best place to stay in Costa Mesa for leissure, business & shopping.  The Price and the Location are the Best.  Breakfast id very simple, juice, cofee, tea, yogurt and bagels.  Staff are very polite and helpfull.

The staff was very friendly, but the grounds were dirty, there was odors and the room is just fair. I would not recommend this hotel.  The location was fair, at the time of arrival from the Orange County Airport, the shuttle was down. They did however pay for the cab ride to the hotel.

Summary Heading: Great pick for the price if you have a pet!
Summary: We always stay at La Quinta due to their pet policies, even when not traveling with a pet.   The breakfast is adequate.  Rooms are reasonably clean for the age of the building.  All open to common outside walkways, like older motels.   Noise is an issue, since this location is directly next to busy freeway.  With the door & windows closed much noise is filtered out.   A good value, overall.

I usually love LaQuinta but this one they should be ashamed to even attach their name to it. Strike One:  On arrival, I'm given a third floor room.  I haul all my bags up the stairs (I don't mind stairs.  They are a good workout) and find that the key doesn't work.  I called the front desk from my cell phone and explain that the key won't open the door and I'm told that I'll have to come down to the lobby for a new key.  I tried to explain that I didn't want to leave all my bags outside and I didn't want to haul them all back down the stairs and then back up.  The guy says there is nothing he can do since he is alone.  I took everything back down and drove over to the front desk.  No apologies.  I told him I wanted a room on the main floor and on the other side of the building
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback regarding your stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We’re very concerned about the issues you’ve mentioned and are sorry we dropped the ball as we did during your stay. You should expect a room that is clean and well taken care of, and we failed you here. We’re very sorry and we’d like to chat with you further about your specific situation. Would you reach out to us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com. Thanks again for your review, and we’re looking forward to chatting with you soon!

Summary: I gave them 4 years to get their act together, but NO! That time for 4 days, the elevator was being fixed in the morning! Never happened, we left and it was still broken. But, time heals all wounds!  Well, I spend a lot of time on the road and mostly at "nice" La Quinta's around the country. I have removed this for any future visit. 9 PM, we return from a very busy day to find that housekeeping had not cleaned the room, made the bed or left coffee or cups!! I called the desk, when they finally answered, the young lady coped an attitude. Sorry, I'll talk to someone tomorrow! What about service, I could get coffee in the morning in the lobby!! As an elite, with their rewards system, this is a total failure. Traveler beware
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We're sorry about all of the issues you experienced during your stay with us, and would like the opportunity to address your concerns directly. Would you please contact us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com. We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Summary: The room had bugs in it and smelled awful. We were woken up to the smell of smoke at 5 in the morning. The outlet between our beds was shooting sparks out of it and nearly caught on fire by the time we left the room. What an inconvenient experience.
Manager Response: We've read your review of our La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We're concerned about the issues you encountered during your stay. We'd like to chat with you further about your situation so we can ensure what you've experienced doesn't happen again. Would you mind reaching out to us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com so we can talk to you further? Thanks for your feedback, and we're hoping to hear from you soon!

Summary Heading: Ugh Not a fan anymore. What happened, La Quinta????
Summary: Ugh. I have no idea what happened to this property. I remember staying here a few times over the past few years (home renovations, moving in between homes, etc) - and even recommended this hotel to family/friends who were visiting the area, as well as clients when I worked previously as a travel agent (no longer).  I'm here in my hotel room right now at the La Quinta writing this review.   While the check in experience is great - and my front desk clerk was very friendly and warm, the rooms itself... ugh. The first room I was checked into - I noticed a smoky smell to it (which is odd, considering the hotel is supposedly non-smoking) - what further gave my suspicion some credibility was that the room had one of those black box air purifier machines (had some weird ozone setting
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We're very concerned about the issues you encountered during your stay. You should expect a room that is clean and well taken care of, and we failed you here. We're very sorry and would like to chat with you further. Would you please reach out to us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com. Thanks again for your review, and we're looking forward to speaking with you.

Summary: The rooms are comfortable and a free breakfast is always a plus, but there is a lot of noise at this property.  It is close to the freeway and there quite a few guests seem to stay up late and make noise.

Rudest, most uncaring and obnoxious people on the planet. Totally unresponsive to noise and housekeeping issues and just absolutely cruel and ruthless. Totally ruined our Christmas except that we found a better value and far superior property in every way from a competitor company (Extended Stay). Better in absolutely every conceivable way.
Manager Response: Thank you for your resent review regarding your last stay. I’m truly sorry for the inconveniences you experienced. We take noise and uncleanliness issues very seriously. Your comments have been shared with our staff and we will insure these types of situations do not occur in the future.  I would like to address your concerns directly. Please contact us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

Summary: This facility is definitely dated, I'd say the last time it was refurbished would have to be the mid-80s, but having said that, my room was clean and looked well maintained. The price was very reasonable and the location was just what I wanted, to be near the airport. I will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Very dirty and clean at all
Summary: Bad scary experience door didn't close all the way a lot of foot traffic through the night loud next to highway maybe because door didn't shut all the way wad supposed to stay for three nights but checked out next day and went somewhere else for remaining part of trip

This was the worst hotel experience my family has ever experienced. The rooms where dirty, smelly and disgusting. On our last trip we were moved between a multitude of room due to the smell of smoke in the room. The final room's bathroom had mildew and mold on the shower walls. Had it not been the middle of the night when we checked in, I would have left the hotel completely.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We're sorry about all of the issues you experienced during your stay with us, and would like the opportunity to address your concerns directly. Would you please contact us at lq0541gm@laquinta.com. We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Summary: I've stayed at many LaQuinta's. I like LaQuinta. But THIS one? Literally a roadside highway motel seated next to a Hooters Restaurant. In my room, you could hear (and see) the highway. I had to cover my ears to fall asleep around midnight or so after my long flight. It took awhile to fall asleep. The room was clean but smelled musty. The phones didn't work. And I was actually glad to be in a room near the front of the hotel (staring at and hearing the highway) because the back of the hotel was dark and rather shady looking. I checked out after one night. And made them refund me for the price of 2 nights which they strangely charged upfront. I have NEVER heard of a LaQuinta charging the entire price upfront before checking out without notifying the customer. So watch your bank
Manager Response: We've read your review regarding your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We appreciate you sharing your comments, and we're sorry for the experiences you encountered during your stay. Would you mind contacting us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com. So we may discuss with you personally. We hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: Quiet rooms on east side away from the freeway.  My room was clean and comfortable.  Excellent service.  Location excellent and close to all.  Traveling with my dog.  Dog friendly, no charges.  Bonus free and excellent internet, convenient ice machines, washers and dryers.

I've been in many La Quintas and this is a real disappointment compared to what I've been used. La Quinta is not a luxury hotel but this is one is not even an Hotel, nor an Inn... is a Motel!  Ok, it's clean. Room was clean, not smelling bad. A/C was working but it's not a cozy place, I've been told before choosing that "hotel" that it was having microwave and fridge. Nope, none of that was there.  The staff is there to... receive payment I guess, you cannot count on them. I tried to ask information about restaurants near them and I got a "Not sure" as answer, funny they have 1 Hooters exactly near the "hotel". At the end I had to call a pizza chain to have delivered a pizza.   Place is well insulated, you won't feel hot thanks to the AC, you won't listen the Highway noise but
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We're sorry the hotel didn't meet your expectations. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns directly. Would you please contact us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com. Thanks for your feedback, and we're hoping to hear from you soon!

Summary: This La Quinta is just a step above a Motel 6 or Howard Johnson. Room smelled musty, Parking was at a minimum really poor and it was very noise. When I complained to the front desk the young lady didn't even give a hoot! I would not recommend this facility as I have stayed at a lot of La Quintas in this region
Manager Response: We've received your comments regarding your recent stay at the La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We're sorry for the issues you encountered during your stay and appreciate you taking the time to write of your experiences. We've definitely got some training opportunities at this hotel and your feedback will help us correct our issues with our team.

Summary: Not up to La Quinta usual standards.  Initially put in a room in which neither the TV or phone were in working order - took an hour to get me relocated.  This location is an old facility, and sits right next to the freeway.  My room faced Hooters Restaurant.  Not a peaceful location, yet I'd asked for a quiet room.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback regarding your stay at the La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We're very concerned about the issues you've mentioned and are sorry we did not meet your expectations. Would you mind contacting us at lq0541gm@laquinta.com. So we may discuss with you personally. We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: No Phone work in the room No internet connection No temperature switch work No clean at all  No kindness please do not stay this motel ... i have had a terrible experience ever price was ok but everything is sucks
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We apologize for all of the issues you experienced during your stay. We would like to address your concerns directly. Would you please contact us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com. We're looking forward to hearing from you!!!

Summary: Worked out nice for my family and I for our softball trip.  Rooms our clean and people are friendly.  We have paid a lot more for a lot less.  Hotel is centrally located to most of the fields we play at.

Summary Heading: Reasonable place to stay near near OC Airport
Summary: This was not a top notch motel, but they didn't charge me for one either.  I would recommend it if you're staying the night before a trip leaving from John Wayne Airport.  A bit too much highway noise.  But convenient and moderately priced.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff and pet friendly hotel!!
Summary: This is a great hotel and I recommend La Quinta for everyone on a short trip - 3 to 4 days.  The staff is very friendly and helpful. Booking and checking in were easy and timely.  This hotel is also pet friendly. You can bring up to 2 pets for free.

Summary Heading: Even on a Budget I'd look Elsewhere
Summary: For a quick two-night stay with no family I thought this would be a good choice. While staff was super friendly (esp Ashley at the front desk), the rooms were old, Spartan and needing upgrade.  Biggest issue was the 405. About 50 feet from my room with, as one can imagine with 8 lanes of traffic heading north, a LOT of noise.  Room blocked some, cooler unit blocked more noise but still NOT conducive to great sleep.  And when I opened the door to walk a long way to the simple but tasty typical lower end hotel breakfast, the noise hit like a wall of sound.  I selected this for its "free airport shuttle" and then, later found out the shuttle only ran 8-5 so did me no good with an 8 pm incoming flight.  For the cost of a cab added to the hotel costs I could have stayed much more
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at the La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We are sorry about the issues you encountered during your stay and would like the opportunity to address your concerns directly. Would you please contact us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com. We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Summary: The location is excellent, rooms are very nice, and the staff is professional and courteous.  Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.  I have stayed here several times and have always had a positive experience.  It is close to John Wayne airport, several highways and lots of restaurants to choose from.

Summary Heading: NOT FANCY, BUT EXCELLENT FOR WHAT WE NEEDED
Summary: This hotel may be a little worn, but it was excellent for what we wanted: a good night's sleep before a plane trip, a place to leave our car, and shuttle service to Orange County Airport.    Thanks, David and Diane from Southern California

to noisy during at night. wouldn't be able to get some sleep. Even at night. there were people outside the parking lot chatting all night. need to have security to surveillance the property. not a good place for visiting
Manager Response: We've read your review regarding your recent stay at the La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We're concerned about the issues you encountered during your stay. We'd like to chat with you further about your situation so we can ensure what you've experienced does not happen again. Would you mind reaching out to us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com so we can talk further? Thank you for your feedback, and we're hoping to hear from you soon!

Summary: Poor customer service and staff did not care about a room not being satisfactory. Rooms by freeway very noisy! Grounds dirty and unkempt. Room baseboards dirty and bad smell on carpet in room. I do not recommend
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on your recent stay with the La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We apologize for the issues you experienced during your stay. We';ll share your comments with our staff so that we can improve our operation. Would you mind reaching out to us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com so we can talk further? We look forward to speaking with you soon!

Summary: Disgusting and a Health Hazard.  We came to watch our granddaughter play in a softball tournament and had to change motels - SAD!!  Me and my husband have stayed at numerous LaQuinta hotels across the nation and have never come across anything like this.  Electrical plugs didn't work (dead cell phones in the morning), killed 2 spiders in our room, carpet was mildewy, toilet ran all night, standing water outside the door.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We're very concerned about the issues you mentioned. You should expect a room that is clean and well taken care of, and we failed you here. We are very sorry and would like to chat with your further about your specific situation. Would you reach out to us at lq0541gm@lqreviews.com. Thanks again for your review, and we're looking forward to chatting with you soon!

Summary: Both the evening staff were extremely Rude. It seems as though the staff have not customer service training. The rooms at the back are adjacent to a Major street. So noisy for a comfortable night sleep.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback about La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa. We're sorry the hotel did not meet your expectations. We'll share your comments with our staff so that we may improve our operation. We appreciate you sharing your feedback with our team. We hope you'll once again choose La Quinta Inns & Suites for your lodging needs.

Summary: The charge for a handicap room was approx 30% higher than the quoted price for a non-handicap room. This was the first time I had encountered this. The room showed it's age and needs some major refurbishing,

Summary Heading: Aging La Quinta with Hooters as neighbor...
Summary: The La Quinta Inn John Wayne Orange County Airport is, sadly, an aging and worn-out motel, without much personality.. both in its architecture and rooms, as well as its staff.  As a La Qunita Returns Elite Member, I was not exactly made felt 'welcome' by the staff. With shrugging shoulders they told me that, due to being weekend-booked solid, they would not be able to give me any room upgrade.   There was only one working ice machine for all 3 floors of this fairly large motel. The rooms, despite having fresh carpets and beds, as well as TV, had an old and stainy bath.   WiFi was very unstable and weak, this did not change after I had reported it to the front desk. The general attitude of the staff there was 'I don't really care' .. sadly.  The neighbor of the motel is a

We attended a family wedding in Newport Beach. We stayed here as the rate was $200 less. The accomodations were very good. Clean and efficient. BUSY Hotel, but all worked well. Beds were comfortable. Room was clean. Entrance to Hotel is confusing. Need to enter over a canel bridge at HOOTERS Restruant.

This place is a dive. the toilet paper roll is barley hanging on. Black mold. Tweekers. Need I go on? I feared for my life when I walked the dog.  This La Quinta is in dire need of a FACE LIFT! Motel 6 across the freeway looked cleaner.

Wondering just how much sleep I'm going to lose this week being perched on the side of the I-405 This place is so tired, there's only so much lipstick that you can put on a pig. Nice easy drive into Newport Beach for dinner and comfortable beds. Just too noisy for a good night's sleep

Summary Heading: An innn that is past it's prime
Summary: Like most properties in this block of hotels, this property has not been kept up and is seriously overpriced for the quality you get.  The rooms smelled of mold, were poorly noise insulated (your right under the landing pattern for John Wayne International Airport) making for a difficult time to fall asleep on hard beads with worn out pillows.

Considering the amount of bad reviews, I was expecting a serious sh**hole, but it was actually pretty decent. Room was big, clean, the pool was not disgusting. Biggest complaint is the breakfast, that changes hours in different days ans sometimes ends earlier than schedulled. I couldn't get it in any of the 3 days I've stayed there.

Summary Heading: Clean, but needs a little TLC
Summary: I stayed here while visiting family over the Labor Day weekend.  Their price was very reasonable for a holiday weekend, and they accept pets.  I was happy with the cleanliness and the comfort of the bed, but the place does need some TLC.  The bathroom door really needed replacing, the vending/ice machines were out of order, and the carpets need cleaning.

The staff was not train on handling or caring for customers need. They have their own agenda and i do not belief that they represent La Quita values.  There was upper covering the Holiday weekend and personal left to cover the weekend were very unpleasant to work with.

The hotel looks old and needs some TLC. It is next to a Hooters, I did not like that. If you don't mind homeless people joining you in the breakfast area scarfing down food and charging their phones next to the food, then enjoy. Not for me.

I find it interesting that the majority of the positive reviews of this place were written by people with only one review on their profile.  I find that highly suspicious.  I stayed here the night of 8/31/15.  I was horrified by my experience.  While I was checking in, a hotel guest came into the lobby, very upset.  She asked that the manager to please have maintenance  fix her clogged bathtub that she'd been asking to be fixed for six days.  When I opened the door to the room, I was met with a disgusting odor.  It was enough to make me choke.  As I was being picked up at this location the next morning, and I had no way of reaching my driver, I had no choice but to stay.  I noticed the dirty carpet as I walked to the bathroom.  There was something that looked like blood

If anyone is looking for safe,nice, clean, well maintained place to sleep, this is the one. The room rate in Orange County is hard to beat, and access to the highways is great too. Don't expect king type breakfast, but you won't be hungry either.

Stayed at this hotel many times   I would recommend to anyone.    Clean rooms   friendly service and knowledgable staff.    A wonderful experience for the cost.   Close to all the wonderful things to do in Southern California.

Summary Heading: Nice & Clean Hotel in a great area to stay
Summary: La Quinta Inn is a very simple but classic Hotel to stay in the Costa Mesa area, you have great shopping malls near, the beach is also near and being right behind the highway is very easy to get in and out.

The front office staff is terrible and racist.  My tv didn't work. The bathroom door inside my room wouldn't open.  Asked to switch rooms but was told that my race wasn't wanted here and told me to check out.

My wife and I are spending our last night at this hotel as I type.  Let’s start with the pluses. It is located centrally to where we wanted to visit along the beach cities of Orange and Los Angeles Counties.  The room was ok with comfortable beds.  That’s it for the pluses. The hotel is beyond poorly maintained.  None of the three ice makers emit ice.  The soda machines either do not work or contain soda.  The landscape was kept but not particularly attractive.  The exterior was dirty and appears to not have been swept or cleaned in months if even this year.  The same cigarette butts were in the same place for our stay (four days).  I doubt if management walks the grounds on a regular basis or has the personnel and/or funds to correct or clean any deficiencies they might

I stayed at LaQunita as it has a good reputation around the country and I was recently at a fantastic one in Silverthorne Colorado.  I paid a few bucks more than Motel 6 would have cost and figured this would be a cut above.  I was sooooo wrong!   This motel was horrible.  The exterior was totally run down, the other guests were very sketchy looking, the place was a dump.  The room renovated so the furnishings were nice but the still a motel six type room with an old bathroom.  A property like this really downgrades the reputation of this hotel chain, in my opinion.  Do not stay at this place.

Stayed one night, paid to much for the quality of the room. Everything was clean, just very outdated.  Bathroom was especially "old". Wifi worked well, limited TV channels but very close to freeway, gas, food.

Summary Heading: La Quinta Inn John Wayne Orange County Airport
Summary: The beds were comfy and room was average, not too bad. Property itself is a little worn and the staff seemed overworked at times. The ice machine did not work the entire 5 days of my stay but after speaking with Rob at the front desk at check out he did say that they were in a period of transition as there was no General Manager at all. Close to the freeway.

Summary Heading: dirty, old, noisy, disappointing, not worth the price
Summary: when you see the pictures in internet you think this is a good hotel, reality is different. the room was dirty, black feet from the dirty carpet, all ice machines broken, roomkeys do not work, the pool seems a challenge for your immune system, rusty dirty sunbeds, definetively not worth the price, very disappointing, can´t recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: La Quinta John Wayne Orange County Airport
Summary: The room was clean.  There are lack of elevators (only one available).  There are limited accesses to the 3rd floors(only two stairs that can reach the 3rd floor).  The amenities can be better, a small refrigerator and a microwave would be nice.

Summary Heading: At least there weren't a ton of bugs
Summary: Well, there was a fruit fly infestation in the bathroom. By far, the worse hotel we have ever stayed at in terms of cleanliness and service. It did not appear to have been vacuumed, there was still dirt and dog hair all over the floor. The bathtub was black and brown with dirt like it had not been scrubbed. There was black mold coming from the inside ledge of the bathroom sink. No WiFi. The mattresses were severely sagging. It was "non-smoking" but smelled terrible and all of our belongings still smelled like smoke after returning home. It was not well done breakfast either. All of the ice machines were broken except for one. The washer and dryer were outside in the hall way on the third floor so it was a bit loud for us since anyone could do their laundry at any hour. I think I

Third year in a row that I have stayed here, place is getting tired and it shows especially in the bathroom. bed was ok, TV and wifi worked well. breakfast was good too... just the cleanliness of the bathrooms was a real issue..

The first night we arrived they did not have our correct room that we had booked available because the maids had filled our room we were supposed to stay in with mattresses. The next day we were moved into the correct room and it smelt like urine and mildew. The room was clean but the fan in the bath room didn't work. When we went to the pool the pool towels had bugs all over them. We checked out early and moved to a different hotel. We would never stay there again.

Staff was great.  Room had odor.  Bed a little soft for us.  Breakfast is always great at LaQuinta's.  AC worked better than any we have had which is a big plus!  Easy access to 405 freeway.  We would stay again, but get in earlier to let them know about any odors.

The room was good overall AC worked great and the beds were amazingly comfortable. The Friendly staff helped make our stay enjoyable. My only complaint though was the bathroom the carpet molding was torn and the toilet kept running & the shower curtain was moldy

the outside is old and so is the rooms. I have stayed in other La Quinta's that were much better. The bathroom is old and a little dirty. The carpet is very old and the whole building needs to be upgraded. I do like how La Quinta allows pets and was very happy with another La Quinta we have stayed at.

The floors in this room were wet and dirty feeling! Everything had this sticky dirty feel to it. The shower felt and sounded like it was going to go through the floor. The outside look like a dump very slum like feel to it!

If this was the 1st LQ we ever stayed at we would never stay at another. Below LQ standards it smelt and looked like a Motel 6. There was mold and water damage in the room, dirty and wet towels left in our room, shampoo was half gone and topped up with water. Not all lights worked. No mini fridge or microwave in room. Breakfast area very small and crowded. No healthy options available to eat. The best part of our stay was the bed. But would never stay at this location again.

We stay at LaQuinta about 8 times per year.  This is not one of their best.  Not as clean both in the rooms and the grounds.  Ice machines on 2 floors did not work.  Breakfast was OK.  Staff at counter helpful.  Great to have free WIFI.

hotel has mold on the walls and the carpet is stained and very dirty. do not stay here. we had to check out 4 days early. i would not recommend this hotel to anyone. the location is terrible and not safe. people were smoking pot outside

We have stayed at many La Quinta Inns.  This one was below the standards we are used to from LQ.  It was okay but very shop worn.  The breakfast area was tiny and crowded.  The bed was very comfortable, though.

I was lured to this location by its many good reviews.  What a mistake!  I selected that I would like to pay cash on booking.com's website.  When I arrived, they had to authorize the full room charge to my credit card.  The 500.00 cash I had in my pocket did not matter.  Once I entered my room, well needless to say, I was very disappointed.  Take a look at the pictures and I won't need to say a word.  At the rate I payed, it should have been at least a little nicer.  No, it should have been a lot nicer.  This property is not worth any money you might spend in Costa Mesa let alone California.  Stay away!

The photos I reviewed were exactly what I experienced also. I was needing a place that I could house my dogs so I knew it would be difficult last minute so I grabbed this hotel.  I had just stayed down in oceanside la quinta and had such a great experience that I thought this hotel would be like that one.   NOPE!!! New lamps/furniture on old outdated room.  Carpet was stained and bathroom floor outdated also.  Was afraid to walk barefoot inside the room.  There was an icecream left inside freezer from a previous occupant. When I went to plug in my phone behind nightstand I saw the unclean baseboards filled with dust bunnies.  GROSS!!! The next morning went to the lobby to see what was for breakfast and encountered a lady that was filling her bottle bottle up from the apple juice

Summary Heading: Rooms are great, exterior is dated
Summary: Very comfortable stay, the bed & linens wonderful and the air conditioner worked well.  The bathtub had seen better days, but the shower worked perfectly and tub drained well.  I was pleased that there was a nice long strip of grass to walk my dog on as well.

I stay at LQ motels when I travel and this motel was just as it should be COMFORTABLE....I loved the stay. The atmosphere was very comfortable and my grandkids really enjoyed our stay at this motel. I would most certainly recommend this motel to any one who visit this town. My grandkids and I were in the area for our family trip to Disneyland...

I have stayed at this hotel twice. The first time, the front desk assigned another couple to the room I was staying in and walked in on us while we were in the room. Now the second time there is blood stains on the carpet and lights that do not work. By far the worst hotel service and accommodation Ive ever experienced.

This is a very dated establishment.  A fresh coat of paint was applied within the rooms.  The outside of the building could stand a face lift.  The receptionist was very professional, friendly, & courteous.  Checking in was a breeze.  We stayed in room 120 next to the pool.  Our room was mostly clean.  The bed was comfortable.  It had a small desk (in order to type up Trip Advisor reviews on!). Average size chest of drawers and a small coffee maker. The bathroom was somewhat clean.  The shower/tub was very old and need to be replaced.  The shower drain contained built up soap and hair, which, of course, slowed the water drain process.  Kind of gross.  Continental Breakfast is also provided (which was nice). This establishment is approximately 20 minutes from Disneyland.

Summary Heading: It was the best of hotels, it was the worst of hotels
Summary: Sometimes you can put lipstick on a pig and the pig actually becomes kind of attractive.  However, it does not change the fundamental animal.  Here, this La Quinta is a worn out motel that has certain touches of renovation but not enough.  My room (148) greeted me at its doorway with the huge stench of tobacco.  The air conditioner was not fully responsive to controls.  The bathroom door did not open freely.  The room looked every bit its age.  However, in the middle of this room was an outstanding bed, worthy of a 4-star hotel.  The work station in my room was good.  In balancing the good and bad, I would rate this hotel medium, but most parts of this sum will be regarded in polarized experiences.

The air condition did not work at all. Strong cat pee smell in the room. We had to sleep with the door and window open, so my husband slept on the floor in front of the door.  We were told the hotel was at full capacity so were not able to give us another room. Couldn't provide a fan. Unable to sleep from the fwy noise all night.

It's a shame this experience wasn't better, I did my research months in advance and they just let me down. Had purchased a room with 2 queen beds and the hotel overbook & put us in a handicap room at more money, even though it wasn't our fault.

Good for a single man on business trip...good value...the staff was great and the location is hard to beat...I did not try the breakfast as the it was crowded....I would recommend as a place to stay for business travel

Summary Heading: Do Not stay at this location
Summary: this hotel is in horrible shape and I am regretful that La Quinta has this hotel with their name on it. For the price, it is not worth it. You'd be better off spending less on a well maintained motel 6. the carpet is beyond dirty, your feet will be black if you walk barefoot on the carpet. Mold in the shower, rusty metal in the restroom.

Summary Heading: experience at La Quinta, Costa Mesa
Summary: Lady at the desk gave us excellent customer service and we paid a very good rate for this La Quinta.  We would recommend this particular hotel to anyone traveling to Costa Mesa.  The service the lady in the breakfast room gave was very good as well.  She even showed guests how to make the waffles in the machine.  When the breakfast ran out this lady was always replenishing the food items as well.  When we needed another room in the L.A. area the Lady at the front desk was very helpful in getting us a room in another La Quinta as the Costa Mesa one was already booked up for the 12th of June, so we went to San Bernardino to stay.

The first room we had the tv didn't work. We asked for assistance they said they would send someone, after an hour wait no one arrived, my son went to the front desk and they said again they would send someone.  Again we waited and nothing. He went down there again for them to say no one was available. Now I'm pissed. So they moved us to another room and the refrigerator had spider webs and bugs.  We go to another room and it's a disabled room and there is not bath tub for my kids. I was so ready to pack my stuff and just leave, but my kids were tired and my son begged to just stay. The customer service stinks, not once did I hear an apology for this inconvenience.

Not a bad place to stay. The rooms were Clean bright. Nice samsung HD tv's with a nice channel selection.  The beds were nice and comfy with pillow top.  Soft.  The shower was hot and plenty of pressure. The pool looked great but didn't use it. The air was very cold. The traffic noise wasn't a problem. I would stay again.

Very close to the interstate although it goes quieter at night. Very small breakfast area, overcrowding really bad at busy time. Carpets not very nice, stained. Staff appear helpful but nothing gets done.

this is not on par with other la quintas. it's old and everything feels sticky. it really needs to be upgraded. it is located right off the 405 so thats nice and if your in to hot chicks it's next door to a hooters, but other than that i would look for other hotels in the area, there are lots.
