I made reservations for an ADA room months in advance. My confirmation shows ADA room. We didn't get one, totally unacceptable. We were traveling with 2 handicapped people. All the clerk could say is "oh we must have overbooked"...like its no big deal that for 3 days these people couldn't shower or use the bathroom.

Summary Heading: Great hotel at that price and location
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel on two different occasions now.  The first stay wasn't as great, they didn't seem to have our reservations saved at all so we had to wait over an hour and a half just to check in.  They initially put us in a smoking room, even though our original reservation requested non-smoking, and so we had to wait some more to change rooms.  I complained because my time in California was precious since it was a short trip, and they gave us one night free, so I felt satisfied after that.   The second stay was just last week and it was wonderful.   I had double checked a couple days in advanced that they did in fact have our reservation, and we were able to check into a nice room right away.   For the price, I don't feel like I could have done any better.  The

Summary Heading: Okay place to stay for a reasonable rate
Summary: Kind of close to Huntington Beach and Newport Beach areas. The hotel is average--not fancy or luxurious but simple and clean with good bedding. The hotel is located right next to a Hooters and the highway; there's constant noise from the highway all day and all night. Also the smell of smoking can enter the bathroom even in nonsmoking rooms.

Summary Heading: Worst Hotel Stay I Ever Stayed At
Summary: Rating a 1 star is being nice.   The minute I walked in the door I should have turned right around and went to another place, ANY place would have been better than this place. When I first walked in I got attitude from a girl that seemed to not like her job and she gave me attitude because I was 40 minutes early prior to check in time. I advised her no problem I can wait 40 minutes to check in so I left to get lunch and then came back an hour later. After checking in with a different girl and getting into our room I noticed we did not have a fridge. When I made my reservation it said there's a fridge and microwave, free parking, free wifi, free breakfast, etc. I made sure any room at any hotel I reserved had a fridge so I could keep things cold for my children. When I called the

Summary Heading: Ok, if your budget is tight
Summary: Their beds are comfortable, but other than that, their bathrooms are out dated & service wasn't great. I told front desk our bath tub wasn't draining & they never sent anyone to take a look. Their only washing machine did not work, so we ended up w soaking wet clothes we had to take to a laundromat. If you can't afford something nicer, this is ok.

comfortable beds, and above par breakfast. I like the comfort of accommodations - and coffee. There are several restaurants nearby for dinner options. The parking is easy and free. WiFi worked when I needed it.

Don't stay at this place. You'll be hurting in the morning. It smells, the bed is poor, the carpet is dirty and sleeping outside in your car is preferred. Go to a gym and shower and you'll feel better than staying in rm 232.

very disappointing I expected much more form La Quinta since I have stayed at other locations and they have been well above my expectation. Please fix this little issues and that will make this hotel an excellent place to stay.

i couldnt sleept becouse constanting hitting of  wall from the next door room. you casn hear all kind of noises.and staff hotel dont care about it.  if you make an special request they dont care, even if youre an elite level from la quinta.

I checked in on a Friday, April, 2015 . (One king bedroom)The room was clean til I walked into the bathroom. It was just old and run down. I ask for a new room.. Front desk quickly gave me another room. Room was clean but the tub was missing the wash mat that sticks inside the tub. The whole bottom tub had that ring from where the mat use to be and all the dark scratches from it use to being there. . Just looked dirty.. Next morning , we got up to get hot breakfast ( was a good selection and hot waffles) walked back to our room with both hands full , both our key cards did not work. Had to put my hot breakfast down to walk to the front desk to get my key cards working.....     Afternoon, decided to take the iron board out to iron my clothes... iron board legs were broken...

We need pet friendly and close to John Wayne Airport to pick up our family the next day. It was perfect for that. But it needs a facelift. The beds were fairly comfortable but the other guests talked outside our room by the pool until pretty late. It was not a restful night. The staff was helpful and considerate.I didn't really want to touch anything.

I recently stayed at this hotel and the service was bad,room was not upkeept,found a drug baggie right next to where my kids slept, i had a begal toasted and ready to eat and just before i took a bite another guest stopped me and showed me that it had mold.......ive reported all this and the manager still did not do anything to take care of my issues....do not stay here

The hotel was okay.  I've stayed at better LQs.  It's next to a Hooters which had some competition going on which I didn't want to see or hear.  They were very loud patrons/workers in the parking lot late into the evening which made trying to rest in our room difficult, and not great for my young kids to observe.  hotel staff would not move us. But, it was in a convenient location, the breakfast was average and the rooms were okay, even though the nonsmoking room smelled like smoke.

Saggy matresses, dirty corridors, semi permenant residents who all smoke nite and day. Dog area not maintained. Do not stay here. They areadvertise recently remodeled that is only the looby and breakfast, Which are nice.

Hotel is nice, room were clean, and bathroom clean.  Good WiFi connection.  You can hear the freeway noise if you on the side of the hotel facing the freeway.  Rooms are large.  Breakfast wasn't bad as you could have waffles, cereal and yogurt.  Parking is limited if they are full.  There is airport pickup but only between 10 am and 6 pm.

Summary Heading: Dirty , Noisy, Trashy, but Good Service
Summary: I had thought I made a reservation at the Santa Ana LaQuinta but I had made a mistake. I have stayed at that La Quinta several times and it is just fine for a mid-range hotel. It turned out to be the biggest hotel reservation mistake I have ever made. If you have kids, especially little ones, DO NOT STAY HERE. Dirty, noisy, trashy. Carpets in rooms dirty. Rooms in bad condition, need a remodel. Outside needs a pressure washer and some paint and a garbage can. Change the filter on the AC.   Noisiest room I have ever stayed in in my 50 plus year old life. Freeway noise is terrible. Stayed on a Friday night - a big party on the fourth floor facing our room with people inside and outside on the balcony. LOUD. When some lady walked by our room at 2:30 am and yelled "BAD#@@" that was

This motel is right next to a VERY noisy freeway AND.. a Hooter's.. so if you LIKE Hooters then by all means, come on in.  The motel is .. well, on the inside it's clean and tidy.. on the outside it looks like a dive and some of the walkways were sticky with soda...but for the rest, then again it's dark as I write this. When I got to my room my cards did not work. After returning to the desk TWICE I was more than a little angry. Even after the desk clerk (who is delightful by the way) came up here to check on the door, the door still only works about 50% of the time, sticking and not opening even with the green light. Unacceptable!!!!  The walls are paper thin, I heard someone talking outside my door and I thought the window was open - it's not. The bathroom tub has weird spots

Summary Heading: Not as bad as the reviews would have you believe
Summary: I read the bad reviews and expected the worst. What I found was a perfectly adequate La Quinta. Maybe on the more run down side of things, but my room was fine. No smells, no stains, no mildew, maid service every day.   Yeah the parking lot attracted a varied crowd, there were definitely people smoking pot out there and I think there are people that live in that hotel as their home but it wasn't a big deal.

Hotel really needs to be upgraded.  Bathrooms had mold in tub and did not appear to be cleaned.  The beds are very small - they seem to be smaller than a full size bed.  Room size was adequate to get an extra blow up on the floor.  Front desk staff checked us into a King bed room when there were 4 of us all standing in front of her.  Our reservation was for 2 beds.  Best part of the hotel is that there's a restaurant next door.  Would not recommend this hotel and it has made me not trust the La Quinta brand.

Ice machines and elevators broken;  No crib for my grandson after promised there would be one.  Pool was freezing cold.  Staff sitting on stairs and smoking right outside of rooms.  No waffles or juice bbreakfast very limited and parking was limited.

We stay here often when traveling to the Huntington/Newport beaches. It's close to a lot of grocery stores and a quick drive to the beaches/beach towns. Staff is friendly and rooms are clean. Great value!

I stayed here for a few nights as part of a large group. We had read the negative reviews here and were quite concerned prior to arrival. My room was ok, it smelled like old motel, which brought back memories of family trips when I was a kid. The bathroom in my room was pretty gross with mildew and long hairs on the floor that never got cleaned during my stay.   But let me tell you, among my colleagues in my group were there stories to tell! Several had to ask for a new room upon check in because they could not take the stench in the assigned room, which varied from old smoking room to moldy to just disgusting old room smell. Several people told of wierd stains on the carpets - blood? paint? something else? The pool was so dirty that you would never let your kids even near it,

Worst experience in a hotel.  the mold threw me overboard as our son has asthma!!!  They had no extra rollaway beds and the rooms stunk like sweat.  Would never stay at this La Quinta ever again.  It needs a sever overhaul.  They allow pets and rooms were plain and dirty feeling.

La Quinta is the place to stay when you're looking for comfort and affodability.  Their knowledgeable and friendly staff have always made our stays special.  This is why we look for the nearest La Quinta when travelling.  It truly is our home away from home.  All of this and breakfast included.

I spent a cold night with a not properly  functioning heating unit which was partially remedied on the second night. The front desk staff did try to help as best she could. I paid for the first night and used points for the second. I should get a reinstatement of my points

Arrived VERY late 2 AM, room was waiting, received an email letting me know my room would be ready, my preferred area was held for me. I was able to slrep in to 8:30 Am without interruption. Staff were polite, professional and caring

Walked into room and turned around and left. Stunk of cigarettes. Filthy floor. Dirty bed. Moldy bathroom. Freeway traffic was loud. Front desk staff was nice and umderstanding. Gave me full refund. That's the only thing nice I can say.

Summary Heading: It's fine for a budget hotel close to airport ...
Summary: It's clean ( mostly ) beds are comfortable  , close to the highway so can be a little noisy , cigarette butts outside ... They allow pets and have a lawn to poop them ... There is a Hooters next door if you like that sort of thing ... Room service comes from a local restaurant and is quite good and inexpensive !  So if you don't want to leave your pet alone just order in :)  Would I be back , sure ... it was fine ...

Not the standard I expect of a La Quinta.  More like a Motel 6.  Building is old and the rooms are not well kept or clean.  I should have know by the price.  You get what you pay for!  Just did not expect this from a La Quinta.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with pets
Summary: This is a great hotel when traveling with pets. We did have a mishap with the maid taking some of our things from the room, thinking we had left she took my dogs shampoo & conditioner which was very important to us seeing how he has allergies but Maria (front office) went above & beyond ordering new ones online to be delivered next day (it's not sold in Ca.) but luckily Maria (the maid) found the ones we had. I like to think it was a simple mistake Maria (front office) was wonderful in taking care of the matter. I look forward to bringing my dogs back.

My 1st impression when I arrived at La Quinta Inn John Wayne Airport was the worst I ever had. the hotel is a creep area, with a decadent Hooters just beside it. I had an issue with my room and the keys. The front desk gave me the key and said my room was 235. I went there and tried to open it 4 times. It was not working and I was returning all the times to the reception to say the key didnt work and probably it was a problem with it. The front desk attendat keep saying I was not using the key in the right way and asked me 3 times to come back to the room 235 and try to open again. I was feeling like a dumb because i knew it was not working at all. After I insisting on the problem, finally he decided to come till the rooom (by the way, it was a long walk from front desk to the

Even though I have stayed at this hotel over 100 days for business in the last year, I will not be back. 80-85 year old Security Guard 80-85  chain smoking with "guests" in front of their room. No housekeeping for 2 of my 5 night  stay. Managerment does not care.

we like La Quinta, but this is a terrible representation of the chain.  Dirty room, carpet that was so disgusting I could not fathom putting my bare feet on it,  and the smell,  better yet stink in the room, one night, and we were out of there first thing in the morning.  I never felt safe with the sketchy clientele, and the workers could have cared less.  Added to that, they decided to hose down the grimy third floor walkways at 8:30 in the morning, the water, soap and scum, poured off the balcony, and we had to wait in our room for about 20 minutes in order to not get soaked.

I booked this hotel through Expedia and t got a great rate. My room was on the 3rd floor close to an elevator. Thy include a continental breakfast. It was peaceful and quite. The rooms have flat screen HD televisions and there's also a desk in the room.

Summary Heading: Worst experience at a L Q
Summary: After three years decided to try this hotel after a bad experience of being in a non smoking room that smelled of smoke.  As a frequent L Q member, I could not get the room i asked for, staff was unknowledgable, did not answer the phone and the ice machines (2) did not work. Guest in room next door had frequent visitors knocking on door through the night. figure that one out.

Poor service and hotel conditions: dog food on the floor from previous customer was never cleaned during all my 4-nights' stay, rude staff when asked repeatedly for thorough cleaning, poor food variety, etc.

Summary Heading: CAR THEFT WARNING AT LA QUINTA
Summary: My overall stay at La Quinta was satisfactory until my car was robbed on my last night there. I am sad to say that my car was violated and 2 of my luggages with my personal belongings have been removed from my car without my consent. When I approached the hotel staff, they were not understanding, helpful, or empathetic. If the parking lot is unsafe, I do not feel safe staying at the hotel. Please be aware of safety issue when staying at La Quinta in Costa Mesa.

The website says that it is renovated.  That means that they painted the interiors (and did a lousy job too).  The clientele is sketchy.  You don't want to stay here with kids.  Maintenance is lacking.  Most of the ice machines were broken the night that we arrived.  The desk clerk is miserable.  Really.  Find another job that you don't hate dude.  This place is cheap for a reason.

I stayed here for 7 nights, I wanted a less expensive room as i only needed a place to sleep. At first glance, it's not what you would want on a trip to OC. But I surely got my money's worth, (saved about $ 300) the room was clean, the bed was fine, etc. I normally don't eat breakfast in these chain motels, but this wasn't bad at all. The coffee was much better than most places, and the other items were the kind no one could screw up. ie fresh fruit, toast, sealed yogurt , cream cheese, jelly and cereal.  The clientele isn't what you'd meet at the Waldorf, but they were pleasant families, couples, and lower level business people. (not on a plush expense account) BTY, the staff more than made up for the location and or any negative feelings about the place.   WiFi was spotty or

This hotel is good.  Needs to improve little things like making sure the electrical outlets work, and improving the Wi-Fi coverage.  It is a good hotel for business purposes.  The food is minimum continental breakfast.

Summary Heading: There is nothing good to say about this property
Summary: We booked two rooms at this hotel.  My sister in law requested a handicap room and she got a regular room with a bathtub that they claimed was a handicap room.  She also had to call housekeeping to return and clean out the refrigerator.  Our room had holes in the walls, the rugs were filthy. Horrible hotel.

Summary Heading: A place for sleep in tight budget
Summary: Room is old, bed & fruniture are old too. Carpet might need to change. One of my room light is not working. WiFi is working sometime but slow. We are at quiet room as our room on 2nd floor and facing swimming pool. This is what you pay and what you get.

Summary Heading: Disappointed in La Quinta. 2 star hotel, at most.
Summary: I've stayed at La Quinta before and found them to generally be clean and relatively nice. This hotel was not. The rooms were dirty and a little run down. Whole there appeared to have been some effort to renovate, it was superficial. The grounds were unkept, adjacent to Hooters, and there were unsavory characters hanging around the property. The breakfast was tasty, but the space crowded and cramped, made worse by a waffle iron that didn't function. Although I slept well in the bed, the primary redeeming quality of this hotel is its proximity to the airport.

By far the best customer service I have seen in a while.  The front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  Hotel is older, but great value for the money.  Close to the beaches and attractions.  Carpet in the rooms need to be replaced, not sure a good cleaning would do the trick.  Room was clean, bed was comfy, breakfast was plentiful (more fruit would have been nice).  WiFi coverage needs to be much better!  Hotel definately needs to be updated, but again..great value for the money

hotel needs a lot of help.rooms not very clean a/c unit being held togeather with duck tape low water pressure.reservation person his name was Ervin was very rude on the phone and in person.we have stayed at this hotel very often in the past and it gets worse with each visit.when complaints are made the excuse given is we are understaffed.unacceptable.

Rooms have gone from good to shaby conditions. Room was not cleaned by housekeeping, no clean linens supplied and staff was rude and did not seem concerned when I asked why our room was not cleaned and we needed towels. We've been going there for the last 6 years...never again

Summary Heading: Poor Service and Moldy Shower tiles
Summary: Check-in was not good, had requested a ground floor room and got stuck on the third floor 5 rooms from the elevator.  This is after staying at this property for years and a Elite Rewards member, was not offered an upgrade for a different type of room on the ground floor, I was not offered anything except a "oh well" attitude.  The wifi was so slow (staying for business)  I had to get up at 6:00 am and check out just to go to McDonald's to do business on my iPad (free wifi and fast).  When I walked into take a shower and saw black mold in the grout of the tile in the shower area, OMG.  Normally this is an OK place to stay, not real high end.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Inexpensive in an expensive area, good deals with adjacent restaurant.  Helpful staff.  Really run down room with peeling enamel in bath, leaking faucets and very noisy guests in parking lot outside.  Right next to 405 Freeway but you get used to it.  You get what you pay for.

Came here for a conference for the weekend and brought my family along.  I'm a frequent traveler and go to many different hotels a month on business for the last 9 years.  I can safely say that this is the WORST hotel I've ever been to.  NEVER, NEVER EVER go here!  I looked at all the reviews of this location and gritted my teeth since I was on a tight budget this month but I was praying that it wasn't as bad as the others wrote but they were very kind as to the review of this place!   I'm writing this at 5am in the morning after someone was yelling and screaming at the top of their lungs next door and woke me up.  As my wife always says, there would have to be a bomb to go off before waking me up which tells you how loud they truly were. First, the person at the desk was

Rooms had a bad odor. Dirty carpet. Wi/Fi very poor - did not work at all in the first two rooms I tried. Extremely noisy from 405 highway, even on the back side of the hotel. Unclean, old and a bad experience.

After reading the negative reviews, I still decided to stay based on the fact that the website stated that the properly was newly renovated. In my opinion, the renovation occurred a number of years ago, the carpet and tile were badly stained, the air-conditioner did not work, the bathroom sink didn't drain properly, the beds was very soft and lumpy and the bathroom towels were very thin. Also the room lacked some of the standard amenities, a clock and literature describing the local restaurants and sites. Unfortunately, you are unable to look up anything on the website, due to the poor internet speed. This was my first time staying at a La Quinta and will probably be my last.

The room was fine, no problems with that.  The only problem was that we requested a microwave and refrigerator for the room, as we were going to be staying three nights.  We requested these items two months in advance when we made the reservations, figuring that that would be plenty of lead time to ask.  In the details about the property it says that a microwave and refrigerator could be furnished on request.  Great, that's what we wanted.  At check in we find out that, no, there won't be any microwave or refrigerator in the room because they are all gone.  Two months lead time and staying for three nights and that wasn't enough time for them to make sure we had the items requested.  If they are not going to honor requests like this then maybe they should consider removing it

I like this location because it is close to John Wayne Airport in Orange County and just off of the 405 which makes it easy to navigate around LA. They have one treadmill in the fitness room and a couple of other machines. What I like about La Quinta is that no matter where I go it is very familiar and I really only care that the room is clean. I spend so little time in the room I am just looking for comfort. Did have an issue with the TV not working and the wifi was really slow. But I got a nice note from the manager apologizing for the inconvenience and letting me know they are working on the wifi.

This is the most filthy hotel we have ever stay at.  We even compared this with Motel 6.  I cannot believe that a hotel like this is actually a La Quinta Hotel.  I can remember when La Quinta was a very nice hotel chain with clean rooms.  NOT ANY MORE.  Take a look at the bathroom air vent...about 1/2 inch of dust and dirt on it.  There were also urine stains on the bathroom floor, bathroom door, even the side of the tub.  We have a service dog so we always check the room with our "black light" to see if there are doggie spots there to prevent any blames on our dog for those existing spots.  With the black light you can see all kinds of urine stains on the carpet and the bathroom floor, etc.  Do they have any quality control at all at this hotel?

I'm a big fan of LaQuinta Inns but unfortunately this particular one is not as nice as others I've stayed, it was my birthday and I had others getting rooms here as well as the location was perfect for where we were going out to celebrate, myself and one of my friends both had issues with our rooms, first mine wasn't what I reserved, then the tv had issues, had to send two different people to get it working (not  a major issue) then there was the bathroom which my friend who had little kids in her room who she needed to bathe, the bath tubs had not been cleaned very well as there was what appeared to be black mold, in my friends they had put a rubber mat down as to"hide" it. I believe my friend did get credited for her stay, however, we couldn't even get moved to another room, I

Room dirty, urine and toilet paper in toilet. Long hair in shower surface. No soap or shampoo.  One small hand towel that looked used.  One bath towel. Carpet not vaccumed.  This was the worst room I have every stayed in.

Leaves major holes for improvement!  I was disappointed that my personal safety was jeopardized by sending to a room occupied by someone else. Then not escorting to the next room didn't make me to comfortable.  Not being able to state if I would have arm with a refrig the next day.

Summary Heading: VERY NOISY HOTEL, DIRTY HALLWAYS AND DISHONEST STAFF
Summary: I usually stay at Hilton hotels, but on this occasion, I wanted to save some money, and decided to give La Quinta Inn a try. Oh was I so disappointed. Half of the hotels faces HWY 405, which is extremely noisy 24 hrs a day. Hallways are very dirty, rooms are old, and the saddest part, if you forget something, you will never get it back.   Please avoid this place, pay a little extra and stay safe.

Good place to stay for any type of occasion.  Room was comfortable and clean.  Good WiFi reception, close to freeway, easy to find and Hooters next door.  Harbor blvd offers other dining options.  Staff friendly and accommodating.  Would stay again.

I was fooled into thinking I was paying a great price for this place.  Room had an oder.  Breakfast was sub-par.  Bed/pillows too soft.  If this is supposed to be a budget hotel, it needs to start chrging a budget rate. Not worth more than $50.

Summary Heading: pass on by and be a winner
Summary: this is a real let down for La Quinta Inn corp brand  No sleep from the highway traffic by 5:00 AM  arrived in room at 8;00 PM  lowed window air conditioner, you hear every little noise  through paper thin walls from ice machines to people talking  A spartan room compared to a super 8   Beds were said, you do not want to sleep here do you could not wait to leave

Summary Heading: Pay a little more me stay somewhere else
Summary: At first glance the room looks like it isn't that bad, however, after staying here for a few days I wish I would've stayed somewhere else. As an elite rewards member I was not given the usual perks.... No snack or water. The room decent but the floors are horrible. The carpet is a dark hunter green and it looks fine to the naked eye but after one night of walking around barefoot my feet were black. The noise coming from Hooters on a Friday and Saturday night is ridiculous. I had requested a side away from the 405 based on other reviews but the freeway wasn't loud at all. I would have rather been on that side. The side farthest from the Hooters has the area for pets. I found a flea on my dog the 2nd night there. The wifi is terrible. I could only get it to connect one time in my

Dirty exterior. Improved interior. Front desk with a teenage group of greeters. Had to ask for the usual bottled water. Absolutely substandard WiFi connection with no help from the front desk. Used to be a great value. I'd pay more and avoid this place.

So far, I'm quite happy. Staff is friendly. Room is nice. Larger than the previous 3 rooms in the past few nights, from Monterey to Camarillo. I used to work in the hotel industry so I know what to expect. I don't expect people to give me a name when I check in. If ya get offered one, great. That means your attitude wasn't the typical hotel guest one. Best part, 20 mins from great food at the Pizza Lounge, restaurants, shopping at the Huntington Beach Pier. And a Hooters next door if ya want a quick bite to eat. Also a plus is a major freeway with easy access to it.

We stayed here for the night before our fishing trip at Newport. The room was clean, the beds are comfortable. There are plenty of parking space. We parked just infront of our room which was so convenient because we dont have to walk and carry our fishing gear. The AC, the TV  and the lights are upgraded. Their website said they just renovated the place  and that's a good thing. There is a Hooter's by the side if you want food and drinks late at night and you can just walk back to your room after.   We got our room (2 queen beds) for a really cheap price and we definitely got a great deal. They have free breakfast which we didn't enjoy because we have to leave early. The staff at the front desk are nice and friendly. The only downside was the internet was slow but I guess there

This was an awful stay, hookers hanging out in the parking lot, uniformed employees going into bushes while undoing their belts. NEVER AGAIN! Our room was not cleaned and they told us it would take at least 30 minutes to find someone to do it, did not offer us clean towels. Breakfast was disappointing.

Ok for the price.   Staff was accomodating and changed rooms when bed was lumpy.  Price charged reflects some lack of up keep on facility.  Hotel was clean.  Staff was friendly.  Breakfast was good.  Road noise on West side of hotel is a bit high.

Excellent value for $ paid; continental breakfast; easy parking; WiFi; 5 Minutes from John Wayne Airport; Shuttle ride offered; next to 405; Hooters across parking lot; Subway like restaurant across S. Coast Drive walking distance open 7AM-3PM; convenient to area attractions; good location.

Staff was unfriendly, and unhelpful. Don't ask for a highchair cause they look at you like your crazy (I guess people with kids don't stay there) and if your room doesn't have a "do not disturb" sign, don't bother asking cause they will tell you "they're out" so just do what we did and write your own on a piece of folded paper.

THE STAFF:  Upon check in the front desk agent did not tell us her name or any of the hotel's amenities. I had to call and ask for breakfast times and a few other things. While on the phone I asked her if she knew of any bars that would be open around the area, she immediately said no and then "oh wait hooters is still open". (Hooters is right next door, if i wanted to go there I wouldn't have asked for bars around the area) Every time she picked up the phone she would only say "front desk" and was very short which doesn’t come off friendly at all. Most of the staff is like this. When I would pass by the front desk I was never acknowledge by anyone. The agents would look up to see who was there and back down back to whatever was more important on the computer or drinking their

Rooms are dingy, and smell like pee.  The bath tub has pubic hair in it, and the sink leaked.  The "Continental Breakfast" was a joke (cereal & bagels isn't breakfast)  The only good thing about this hotel was the service.

The entire property is shabby and poorly maintained.  My white dogs got dirty just walking in the parking area.  We requested a fridge and microwave as I require a special diet and were unable to get them, and the girl on the front desk had no clue what the words bland diet even meant.  The mattress, although comfy enough, had collapsed so that I bruised my leg on the wire edge.  Not a place I will ever return to and I am severely disappointed in La Quinta as they have long bee my favorite place to stay

Summary Heading: West Coast Sales Manager Lock N Climb
Summary: Over all very nice, friedly and professional staff.  Clean property. Excellent wifi connection. Nice flat screen TV. Missed not having hot eggs at the continental breakfast. Comfortable bed. Wife was very happy to be able to get some extra pillows.

We were by the pool and found the parking to be very limited.  Sometimes had to park our car at the opposite end of the facility.  Room was fairly clean.  Service was excellent.  We were on the end by the 405 and it was somewhat noisy from the highway and the pool activity.

Pros: -The staff was friendly and attentive. We accidentally booked the wrong check-in date, but Sarah managed to help us out.  Cons: -The ice and vending machines on the 1st and 2nd floor were broken. -The only working washer and dryer is located on the 3rd floor. -At certain times of the day, it is very hard to maneuver through traffic around the area.

Efficiently Run Operation translated into to an enjoyable extended stay. Staff are Friendly and Competent. Great  bedroom service and a good hearty breakfast provided. Good location , close to major attractions, freeways and shopping.

Summary Heading: Disgustingly Dirty Outdoor Areas. TRooms need updating.
Summary: Place was so dirty I felt really felt uncomfortable undressing. The outdoor areas are really filthy. The room appears very dated their were receipts sitting on table from 3 days prior to my arrival. Doesn't anyone clean this place?? Rug had very noticeable stains. Paint was peeling in bathroom.

Room was noisy,  could hear all the freeway noise.  Room smelled very bad, not sure if it was stale smoke or something else.  Management offered to come spray with air freshener but I have allergies so that would not work.  I had several friends staying there and they had same problem and were offered the same solution.  Carpet was filthy and stained. One elevator for entire hotel and of course I was no where near it.  When I booked room I requested to be near elevator or on first floor.  I ended up on second floor way away from elevator.

Clogged shower head dirty AC cracked paint poor breakfast selection stinky room what else can I say, smelled like smoke everywhere you want but the most annoying was it smelled like smoke in my room always. I would find other accommodations, I don't think I'll be back. And it's right next to the highway. That wouldn't have bothered me so much except for all the other problems I encountered. The staff to take care of the Clogged shower head and the dirty AC however I think it should not have been that way to begin with

Grounds were filthy ...trash and cigarette butts everywhere.  The whole hotel smelled like an ash tray.  As a king time patron of this LaQuinta, I was shocked shocked how much the quality of this hotel has went down since my last visit.

This is a poor hotel, terrible stay, unhappy with the fees that paid for the hotel.  I would not come again.  I would not recommend anyone to stay here.  A lot of improvements are need for this hotel.  I would not come back for La Quinta again.

Never again.  The place is old, dirty, plumbing leaks, wifi doesn't work in rooms.  Not worth the price at any price. ljljljljlkjljlkjlkjlkjlkjlkjljlkjlkjlkjlkjljljljljljljljljlkjljljlkjlkjlkjljljljlkjljljlk

Converted motel style facility conveniently located off freeway. Not as large as rooms in other LaQuinta locations but was satisfactory.  Bed was very comfy. They welcome pets so we took the dog and hit the dogbeach 10 minute drive from hotel. The breakfast was the weakest link with very limited selections, unlike other LaQuinta's I've stayed at.  The food stations are in a small room, not very accessible for disabled folks.

Safe clean quiet convenient well-priced hotel in Orange County, CA.  Convenient (1 hour) to North County San Diego, good access to Legoland and San Diego Zoo Animal Park and much cheaper than equivalent San Diego County hotels.

Would not stay here again.  Air conditioning did not work well, mold under bath mat, previous guests hair in bathtub and on floor of bath room.  Bed comfortable and quiet but because of above and previous LaQuinta stays which have been great, would not stay here again.

Our experience was great from check in to check out the staff were very friendly the room was clean and we were on the back side of the hotel which was very quiet while in the pool we could hear the freeway traffic, so ask to be put in the back..

If you like to smoke this is your place.  Smoking seems to be allowed everywhere except in the rooms.  Very dirty surroundings because of this.  Right next door is Hooters and you get a 20% for staying here, but we weren't told this by the front desk.

Took a business trip to Costa Mesa for business. This hotel was conveniently located by the highway. The room was clean, the pool was nice, the people at the desk were very courteous. I would stay at this hotel again.

The rooms are old and run down.  The interior walls need a new coat of paint.  The carpet is warn out.  The hairdryer was torn off the wall and missing.  Not worthy of a 2-3 star rating or worth the $100/per night that they charge.

Hotel has been through the La Quinta renovations that they have done over the last few years. The hotel was nice, with a quality bed. The room was clean and was better in appearance than the exterior of the hotel. With that, the hotel is older and the outside looks it. But again, the hotel has renovated the inside quite nicely. I had a room away from the highway and never heard anything. The bathroom is renovated as much as they can for an older hotel. It was clean, water pressure was moderate, water was warm-to-hot. The rate was among the cheapest in the area, but I'd say this hotel exceeded the other hotels I looked at for this price. Employees were professional and nice. Located close to I-405 for easy access to the places I needed to go. Several eating places within walking

Summary Heading: Not the Best La Quinta, but comfortable
Summary: It was a busy weekend with lots of kids in tournaments.  The hotel is open with doors facing noisy parking lots (motel style).  The beds/pillows were comfortable.  The AC worked fine; the white noise of the fan drowned out most of the outside noise.  The breakfast was average: nothing extra/special.  The breakfast area was too small for all the people.  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Great location, but hit or miss experience
Summary: We just stayed there - my 14 year old son and myself.  3 days.  Tues/Weds/Thurs nights. I had a wonderful experience making the reservation.  I had called the hotel late at night and got a very friendly front desk person/Samantha.  She was so helpful in answering all the questions the La Quinta website couldn't answer for me (nor any other travel website.)  She also got us a nice room. The room was supposed to be ready at 3pm - but we ended up waiting until almost 4pm to get into the room because housekeeping was slow due to "people checking out late."  While I understand there are delays sometimes - the head housekeeper was at the front desk "milling around" the entire time my son/I were waiting patiently in the lobby.  I can't imagine why she didn't go up and help get our room

This hotel was centrally located with lots of shops and restaurants nearby.  Ikea was right across the street.  It is a very dog friendly hotel and I had not qualms about leaving my pets in the room for an hour to go to dinner.

Clean room, good bed, adequate bath. Free WiFi (always a plus) and a nice continental breakfast offering to get your day started.  Best part, we can bring our dogs. For us, this is the selling point. It's also close to the Huntington Dog Beach, which is why we bring the dogs. Only downside is the rooms aren't exactly soundproof.  We could hear people talking, cars coming and going, and doors slamming. And I was anxious every time our dogs barked at those noises, for fear of disturbing other guests.  But again, for the money, it's a great deal for us when we need a getaway weekend at the beach.

This is a fantastic place to stay if you want to be within a pretty short drive to the beach, and you have pets.  Its very clean,  they have a good free breakfast, and the staff is very friendly.  It is NOT a resort, I would not choose to stay here if I didn't have the dogs.  However, I have no complaints, its spotless and well located.

The rooms smelled like cigarettes!!! We requested for a NON SMOKING room because we have young children.   We stayed there for 2 nights in 2 different rooms and they both smelled really bad of cigarettes. The air quality in these rooms made is sick! We literally saw people standing right at the doors smoking. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Summary Heading: Great Location 7 minutes from Newport and Huntington
Summary: Great Location 7 minutes from Newport Beach and Huntington Beach  It is next to the expressway but that does not bother me plenty of white noise to keep the dogies quiet    Plenty of Restaurants and Stores in the area as you drive towards Newport

Like they say, "If it ain't broke, don't fix it. Whenever we have business anywhere near Costa Mesa, we stay here. Period. Enuf said. Great value. Friendly, helpful sincere staff. Motivated housekeepers. Convenient to Orange County. Helpful and kind maintenance staff. Folks here are sincerely glad to see you and want you back.

Of I could rate this lower I would! My room smelled of feces and when I asked for the "problem to be solved" the customer service was very poor. I am very, very disappointed! I would take my money elsewhere. Customer service should be #1. How on earth is this place not shut down? With all of the bad reviews, I'm shocked this place is still open! Shame on management, this place isn't fit for human beings.

Ehhh, might stay again, might not.  It's right next to the highway, but traffic wasn't too loud. Breakfast was good, coffee wasn't. Breakfast didn't have enough seats/tables for all the guests the first morning we were there.  Get there early if you want to sit down.  A plumbing issue wasn't resolved promptly; I had to call twice about it.  The beds were very comfortable and clean.  It's right across the street from Ikea, also very near the I-405.

Dead bug on the bed, smelly room, and clogged and leaking room. Did not give me another room. and Make me wait to long to see the manager to solve my problem. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. stay away from this hotel....

Large property with generous room sizes.  Located near South Coast Plaza and across the lot from Hooters.  Didn't try the breakfast this time.  I am a repeat visitor, since the rates and location are so good.  Some units have not been remodeled.  Ask for an updated room on the "back" side of the hotel- away from the Freeway and Pool

the bed, excellent! clean, quiet.  I was above the pool, yet never was it too noisy. Loved the screen saver on the TV, vision of moon over water and sounds of waves lulled me to sleep.  Staff at front was kind and efficient, welcoming atmosphere.  Highly recommend this inn and will look forward to coming again for my next visit to Costa Mesa.

Summary Heading: good for price but hair on the floor
Summary: I stay here often.  They have done a light upgrade to the rooms and the breakfast expanded.  The staff was pleasant.  However, the last two times we stayed here the bathrooms were not as clean as should be.  Hair all over the floor and the tub and tile have stains.  The price is usually a good value.  Free wi fi  Yay!

The location of this hotel was good for our family reunion. The exterior appears run-down and needs a paint job. A run-down Hooter's restaurant is adjacent to the hotel which doesn't add to the appeal of the hotel. Personnel service is OK. They don't make the extra effort to make your stay inviting. Never a "good morning, smile, or any sort of conversation." In fact, very robotic. The room was clean and nice. An A/C unit in the wall, which is loud but it drowns out the busy freeway noise in the early mornings.  In summary, this motel is OK. I might stay again simply because the price for this area was reasonable for the motel stay.

This hotel is a great value, rooms are clean and very relaxing, the speed of the wifi is not the best but i use my mobile phone anyways.  i sleep really good even though many find the freeway noise disturbing

Good access to beach and fair ground also near amusement parks  small but not much  Time spent in room. Pet walk area was clean bags supplied parking area little small ample for cars not much room  for RVs or if hauling a trailer

If wifi worked during peak hours, it is a 4 star property driven by price primarily. It has the free parking and breakfast going for it, but the free internet should be stated as "free" Internet. It is useless for Skype/FaceTime, although it was functional in the morning. Typical LQ breakfast: nothing fancy, but it is free.  BEST TIP: make sure to ask for a quieter room away from the freeway on the top floor. Walls are very thin: play to your strengths and plan for poor acoustics. I am a repeat guest here and will be back again when in the area and when money is tight. Price is tough to beat.

My mother booked this hotel without checking it out on Trip Advisor first and I was not pleased with the property.  The rooms smelled, the carpets were dirty, dust was thick on the baseboards, 2nd floor ice machine did not work.  I will say the beds were comfortable and we needed something close to a wedding venue.  I won't stay here again.

It was decent for the price range and convenient location. Check in Staff are at an Excellent level, very professional and helpful. The rooms are nice, new flat screen and able to hook up  my computer. The Wifi took some work to get on to. The room did have a strong odor of baby powder but it was not a bad sent...just a strong sent. I would stay again.

If you are looking to have WI-FI do not stay here. They say they have it but it rarely worked during a 3 day stay. Besides the WI-FI issue the hotel overall was ok for its age. Close to the things we needed to get to but would check into staying at a different LaQuinta in the area if here again.

I'm a La Quinta Gold level client, so stay at a lot of La Quintas. This one is below average. The biggest positive is the price for the geographic location, which no doubt keeps the place filled. It is directly adjacent to the busy highway and very, very noisy if you are on the freeway side, so you want to ask for the other side. The free Internet is still not fully reliable in my experience. I found some aspects of the room nice (bed, desk, TV) and other aspects poorly maintained (bathroom - all fixtures). I'd give this hotel three stars if it were not for the Internet and highway noise.

Very old - super close to freeway - needs a good coat of paint and upgrades - seems complacent with business since it's so busy - breakfast is all cold except make your own waffle - no live service on food - dining room very small - not enough chairs and tables for everyone...get what you pay for I guess?

Well breakfast was a bust Just ok but there could have some fresh apples or bananas like other La Quinta's  Wifi was terrible (do not stay here if you need wifi for business)  Do not get a room next to Hooters (they take hotel parking spots and shady characters)

we always enjoy staying at this hotel.  nice facility and amenities, friendly staff, clean rooms and in good locations. and I love the Beauty rest beds!  La Quinta is our first choice for a hotel stay, business and leisure.

The surroundings looked dirty.  Old washing machine by the elevator which was also dirty looking.  Someone was using the machine at the time I walked by looking for the elevator.  Wet clothes spilling out of the washer.  Why is the washer located in the walkway, between vending machines and elevator?  Why not have a designated washroom?  Shocked by the unkempt feel of the surroundings.  Made it feel depressing and unsafe.  Lots of highway/vehicular noise.  The pool looked dirty as well.  I have stayed in a very plush La Quinta in St. Louis.  I expected the same.  I was supposed to stay here for 3 nights.   Heard blood curdling scream in the middle of the night.  Doors slamming.  I couldn't sleep.  Doors next door sounded like my door.  It was so close.  I barricaded my door with

LaQuinta provided a clean, inexpensive place to stay close to John Wayne Airport.  The hotel provided a shuttle to and from the airport (need to call for shuttle) as well as basic amenities (including a continental breakfast).  We were also able to print our boarding passes from the hotel lobby.

It was a great value and a great location.  Our 4 day stay was very good.  Traffic on the 405 waa not a problem because alternate routes worked fine.   Recomend it for anyone looking for great value near awesome location.

Summary Heading: The worst La Quinta I have ever stayed at!
Summary: I was shocked when I first entered the room and the powerful overwhelming stench of mildew assaulted my nasal passageways. The floors were dirty, the shower was dirty, and the toilet was atrocious. I am a La Quinta Elite member and I have yet to be dissapointed by a La Quinta, until now. I guess no hotel chain is perfect. This one has some shifty looking people hanging around and is not a hotel I would soon visit again. Last, I picked this hotel because it's name implied it was near John Wayne Airport. Think again, the airport is 5 miles away down the 405, not exactly "Close by."

Summary Heading: Probably the worst La Quinta I've stayed in
Summary: If you just need a quick place to stay for the night, then it is okay. Other than that, the room smelled like mildew, it was dusty, there was a gap under the door which left room for bugs, and there were gnats in the bathroom which seems to be indicative of mold or mildew.

Car alarm went off 4 times during the night. Bathroom was not clean, not did toilet flush. Reserved  a king sized room, but was given 2 double beds because "not enough rooms were cleaned that day." This hotel is attached to a Hooters, so that was certainly the first clue.

I stay at this hotel when in Orange for a monthly business trip and the rooms are always comfortable and right for my needs.  The amenities in the room are very good and better than hotels of this value category.

Quiet room for next to freeway. Comfortable bed. Hooters next door, in and out burger close by. Easy on and off freeway. 200 words, really?? for a hotel stay??? I came , I slept, I got up and went to work.  Ate at the overpriced Hooters, but it really isn't the food you go there for, In N out burger is better

I stayed here for a month long business trip, where I would fly home for the weekends. Soooo many problems. I had issues checking in EVERY monday. Even though my office had made the reservations and supplied a card and authorization form. I was twice locked out of my room because they had mistakenly only keyed the room for one night. I had a different room every week. Each one, the carpet was oily, smell was bad, shower cleanliness was bad. It is noisy....on any side the hotel. On the plus side, the beds are comfortable. Also I left my phone charger one weekend and I called to asked them to hold it for me....surprisingly the staff was competent enough to do that. All the staff was friendly the entire visit, but with all the mistakes made I am still displeased with the lack of

It's a simple place. For the price, this place was wonderful. I stayed with my sister to go to the nearby music festival called Burgerama. The reviews I read prior made it out to be not-so-great and when I saw the Hooters directly in front I thought it might be a bit sleazy but not at all! After a one night stay I felt like I would stay again. The staff at the front desk were quick to take my calls and accommodate the fact that I got there earlier than expected. That night we came back from the concert around eleven, and hooters turned out to be the perfect place for late-night food. Overall I was very satisfied. I was worried because I missed a lot of the concert when I got there and the room was not ready by noon. But that was my own fault for not considering the check-in time

The day and evening staff were professional and very helpful. The property needs some work, especially the interiors of the rooms and common areas but my room was nice and clean. The bed in my room was great and I slept well, which is usually a problem for me. I didn't use the pool but it looked well cared for.  The location has very easy access to the 405 and is about 10 minutes from the John Wayne airport. There are several good restaurants, including In-N-Out within five minutes. If Hooters is your idea of a good place to eat, it is next door and is the only dining within walking distance.  I had no noise issues but offer the following recommendation: to minimize the noise in your room, stay on the side of the building away from the freeway and away from the pool area. I

Summary Heading: I guess you get what you pay for .
Summary: My husband and I have stayed here a couple of times. It's not bad, not great, thankfully we only ever stay here for one night when we are in the area. I agree with the other reviewers, there are some seedy people hanging around and the walkways always stink of tobacco smoke. It just feels strange and slightly uncomfortable when you walk around the hotel. The elevator is located in a dark recess, I was always wary that someone shifty would be hanging about.the doors, panhandling or looking for "new friends". Looks like they have lots of tradesmen and "single men" booking their rooms. This of course brings  with it "single ladies"  hooking up with the single men.  Disappointed to see so many canines at the hotel. Some yappy dogs kept us awake for hours. On our previous stay here

This was the third time I stayed at this hotel. I will not be back. This property has been remodeled but has a very seedy clientele. Very surprising since it is very near the airport and is in Costa Mesa. I guess it's close to the freeway and near Santa Ana. All I know is I will not stay there again. I travel the Southern California often so I will find a different place when I'm in Costa Mesa next time. The staff was Great though. I compliment the desk staff!

Most staff know me by name when I walk in, as I stay here weekly. Rooms always clean and no surprises after you check in.  Back of hotel quiet with no freeway noise. Wish prices were  same year round but is near beach communities.

I Stay here a lot for work.  I Always get a clean room with a very comfortable bed. The Only con is there is lots of noise from freeway and passer buyers outside front door. Parking very close to room always. Never have problems with TV or air conditioner. Great place for the price.

First off, let me say the staff was excellent.  Unfortunately the room was a terrible disappointment.  Carpet was filthy and a significant amount of mold was on the caulking around the tub.  When I brought this to the attention of the front desk (Chad, I believe) immediately made arrangements to clean the carpet and remove the mold. The hotel definitely is showing its age and needs a serious updating.

Summary Heading: Good clean room for a good price
Summary: I was in California for business and. Stayed here over night, The room was roughly $75. For the price the room was very clean and the best was very comfortable. It was a bit noisy with the highway right outside the window but I still slept vet well. Breakfast isn't much but a again, for the money, I felt it was a great value. I recommend .,.

Pillow top beds! Good internet, good night sleep! Only negative it's next to freeway, make sure you book ahead and request non-freeway side. Plenty of places to eat in the area, easy on easy off of freeway, 3 starbucks in the area, Target right down the street

I can always count on this hotel for price, comfort, and I feel safe there. Staff is also very helpful.  Rooms have been updated....very pretty!  Close to shopping and short drive to beach area.It's hard to think of enough words to get to 200 characters for this review :)

Summary Heading: Best John Wayne Airport deal EVER
Summary: Took tons of stress away with easy airport access and best parking deal ever. Easy check-in and check-out. Reasonable taxi service during off-shuttle hours. Even though I live closer to LAX, I get from the plane to home twice as fast from John Wayne using La Quinta.

We have just returned from a 13 night stay as a group of 25 people.  The Hotel was very clean, the breakfast were adequate and overall great value for money.  The most impressive element of our experience at the hotel was the way Chris and his team looked after our every need offering us great advice.  We would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel. Thanks again to Chris and all of his team!

I have a client who is located in a business park across the street from this hotel, so I've stayed here at least half a dozen times.  The hotel has been recently renovated and it shows.  The rooms are clean with a nice flat screen TV and a reasonably comfortable bed and nice work space.  The hotel is pet friendly and I've traveled with my dog here almost every times which is very convenient (no pet fee, either).  It's not a Four Seasons, though.  The continental breakfast is basically pre-packaged stuff.  Convenient, but not great.  The wireless internet can be spotty depending on location in the hotel.  The towels in the bathroom are VERY thin and should be replaced.  While they renovated the hotel, the tubs could use replacement.  They are old and it shows.  The water

Summary Heading: Not the best La Quinta experience
Summary: Stayed here one night with our small dog heading to San Diego. Room was large and nice. We were away from 405 so noise wasn't an issue.  Tub drained very slow and toilet needed a plunger in the AM to flush. Breakfast was the usual. Price was reasonable. Not the most friendly grounds or area for a dog. Probably will pass on this particular La Quinta in the future. Front desk was pleasant though.

Bring your dogs!  It was a great place to stay when traveling with dogs.  The staff is friendly with your pets and they have pooh bags next to a trash can to clean up after your pets.  Make sure you clean up after your pets, as it isn't any fun having to avoid the pooh on the grassy knoll for the dogs.  Some people were the typical pigs that don't clean up after their life, while most people took care of business.  Perfect for pets!

Next to freway and Hooters but the room is very quite and nice, many parking space in front and back. Room (non-smoking) , bed, sheets are clean. Samsung TV with Showtime, CNN, local station. Free internet.. Breakfast is good with DIY fresh waffle, bagels, bread, juices, yogurt, coffee. Staff is friendly. The price is reasonable. I definitely will come back

highly recommend !!! excellent polite professional staff made my experience delightful. I thought the price per value location to the areas of interest and knowledge and helpfulness of everyone was a pleasure .

We usually stay in 4-5 star rated places, but never with dogs in tow, so this is a new experience for us.  La Quinta was the only place in the area who accepted ANY size dog.  REVIEW #1 - Okay, so far...with two dogs in tow!  We have large dogs so we needed a place that accepted them. Small grassy, bushy areas for dogs to do their business.  Take them to the dog beach for their games and exercise.  Next to freeway, next to Hooter's , and next to business parks and retail strips on Harbor Blvd. in either direction - all of which I will comment on later.   No urine or animal smells in room.  Light scent of bleach, looks clean, no stains on carpet.

Summary Heading: Clean and comfortable. Great and accommodating staff
Summary: For a two star hotel it was clean and updated. The staff was amazing. There was a miscommunication about the time the airport shuttle ran. I flew in early and thought the shuttle was running. It wasn't yet but the hotel paid for a taxi to the hotel. When headed back to the airport the shuttle driver was on break. Instead of making is wait they paid for a taxi again. I got to check in at 10am on the arrival day I arrived which was wonderful. The front desk called me as soon as I got to my room to ask if everything was alright. The breakfasts are hot including waffles. The bed and sheets were soft and comfortable. The room was updated with modern decor and paint. It was a little run down but it was clean.

We stayed one night. My husband has stayed here before and it's convenient to where we were going and to the O.C. Airport. The beds are nice but the nightstand was left dirty from a spilled drink. Now it might not have been easy to notice but I saw it as soon as I wanted to put my book down. Also the bathroom light went on and off so I gave the desk a notice about it when we left. For the price it is ok but I think I'll look around before we stay here again. The breakfast is okay but I've had better. And I agree the outside could be kept up better than they do.

We booked a stay through hotels.com based on the price and pictures.  However, we didn't do our due diligence and were fooled by the pics.  It's right next to the "Hooters" in Costa Mesa.  Unfortunately, a stop at Hooters was not on our agenda.  I have heard they have good Buffalo Wings!  LOL  However, to enter the hotel parking lot, you go through the same entry as the Hooters!  LOL  The rooms have some nice bedding, carpet, and is pretty clean in the inside of the rooms.  However, the outside of the hotel was not well maintained with garbage overflowing from the bins, and cigarette butts all over the place.  The room cleaning service was great and we tipped whoever did our room well.  The front desk staff was also friendly.  The other guests were pretty noisy at night, too!

Summary Heading: Worth staying at if you can get a decent price
Summary: After reading several of the reviews, the place was a lot better than I expected.  The room was clean and the staff very helpful.  We did have to stay on the side facing the freeway.  It was a little noisy, but didn't affect our sleeping.  When the AC is running, that will drown out all other noises.  The beds were on a firm mattress but there was padding on top to make it softer. Their breakfast was very popular and crowded, but they didn't run out of food.  The TV in the room was very nice.  Not too many channels, but you can hook up a console game if you bring it.  We didn't have any problems hooking up to their wi-fi, but as others have said, it is a slow connection (around 1mb).  We didn't use it, but they had a pool which people were enjoying.  We also went to visit the

Summary Heading: Nice room, too close to the freeway!
Summary: Stayed here for a few nights while on an impromptu beach trip. Had two dogs with me and La Quinta is super dog friendly. The room was clean and surprisingly spacious. Beds were great as was t.v. Parking was adequate but not necessarily close to the room. Gym was fine. The only problem with this property is its proximity to the freeway; 10 feet and a small fence separate portions of the parking lot from high speed traffic. With the a/c on, noise was not so bad, but when outisde in the parking lot or dog walk area, the California traffic is hectic ansd jaring to be so close to. About half the rooms face this road as does the pool. Breakfast was pretty good but can be crowded as there are many rooms and people to feed in small area.

Summary Heading: Fun TV Commercials, But...Would NOT Stay Here Again
Summary: My husband and I were taking a trip to the OC to see our daughter graduate in September.  The first room we were given was defined as a "non-smoking" room, but the smell of smoke was so bad, we had to ask for a new room.  We were told that they "tend to put the smokers in the back rooms of the hotel", so they moved us to a room in the front part (why didn't they just do that in the first place?).  It was somewhat better, but still had an odor, especially when we ran the exhaust in the bathroom.  The air conditioner was very loud and everything in the room felt damp -- even the carpet and the towels.  The hairdryer was ripped out of the wall, so we asked for a hair dryer in the morning -- after an hour and a half and 2 additional requests, we finally got one from the maintenance

Room was modern and clean Area is ok if you have no transport and prepared to walk - 5 minutes and you have a choice of basic restaurants Shame the bus is only for airport transfers, other LQ's are better on this Staff were always friendly and courteous Have stayed here before and would do again

Room smelled like cigarettes when we walked in. The bathroom door handle was broken so we had to come up with a way to fix it ourselves. Bathroom tub was a bit nasty looking. Towels did not seem like they went through a proper washing. Breakfast was good. Your regular continental breakfast. Free wifi. If I was paying for it I wouldn't stay here.

After not being able to book a room at the Santa Ana La Quinta we thought we'd give this one a try, despite the negative trend of reviews.  The property is definitely older and the room was really small.  It was recently remodeled and had nice carpet but there were some key areas missed, such as a decrepit shower head with absolutely no water pressure, rusty door hinges and mold on the tile.  All in all the room wasn't so bad. I just wish I could say the same for the location.  The hotel is sandwiched between the freeway (which really wasn't that noisy), a drainage canal and a Hooters restaurant (I'll leave it to you to figure out the clientele here).  As for the staff, they were less than friendly - the woman tending to the breakfast area being almost rude.  It took them 45

Clean! Comfortable beds! Great continental Breakfast! There is some noise from the freeway, but its not bad! You can always request a room on the opposite side. Not the biggest rooms, BUT, they are clean, smell nice, and the furnishings are newer! Great place to relax with your sweetie pie!Great value for the price are well, its about $20 cheaper than your average La quinta, but you dont lose any quality of comfort!

Summary Heading: More like Motel 6 than La Quinta
Summary: My family travels a lot and we are La Quinta Returns gold members. We have stayed in many different La Quinta hotels of varying quality. This La Quinta was the worst I have ever stayed in and it made me wish we had booked at Motel 6 instead. Check-in was slow and we didn't get the express check-in we usually get with our membership. It wasn't a huge deal but after being on the road for 8 hours it sure was inconvenient.  When we headed back to our room there was no parking. Guests have to park in red zones and risk being towed.  The rooms all have outside access and no interior halls. The 405 is on the other side of a 5' wall so it is VERY noisy. It sounded like a NASCAR race all through the night. Our room was on the second floor nearest the freeway and I could have thrown a

its is a nce and confortable hotel in the heart of costamesa, close to all  where you can be close to all atratctions , restaurants and principals companies in the area same as costa mesa beaches.   is a calm and well hotel.

While not a complete disaster by any means, / I have seen worse/ this hotel is certainly only good for a short layover. The Positives, Very comfortable beds, staff is friendly, decent price, ideal location if you intend to drive on the 405 freeway northbound. Cannot comment on the breakfast offered as I never did use that service. Building is right next to a Hooters which is nice to have a bar/grill access. The negatives, my room had a lovely view of a parking lot and the 405 Freeway. While you can definitely hear the traffic outside. When in the room one can close the drapes and the A/C unit drowns out the traffic noise. Housekeeping is not proactive and absolutely has management challenges. Upon entering my room I had two remote controls in front of the TV neither of which

We had to attend a family wedding in Newport Beach, I booked this particular  LaQuinta Inn on Booking.com. the rate I paid for this LaQuinta.Inn. Well lets say thank God for Booking.com, I would never have paid a regular rate for this place if I had of known how unclean it was. Our bathroom, there was no way it had been clean, the floor and the tub. We rented two rooms and they were both the same, I was very disappointed I brought my family to this LaQuinta Inn. It sort of reminded us of a Motel 6, and I do not stay in Motels. I would never stay at a  LaQuinta Inn again. Breakfast was nothing to look forward to, save your money and add a little more to it and stay in a quality hotel. Hopefully you won't find bugs and dirt, sorry but this is exactly what I saw on our bathroom

Spacious and clean rooms with the most  comfortable mattresses I've ever slept on in a budget motel. Towels were contoured and thick. Rooms were evidently remodeled recently, and the outside of the place doesn't do the inside justice.  Breakfast was okay, but the staff were overly accommodating and helpful. There's even a Hooters next door if you're of that ilk.  Upon checkout, I did hear an old chap complaining about the freeway noise, but if he'd read TripAdvisor, he'd have known to book a room on the back side.

Summary Heading: On the Plus Side, You Can Host a Dance Party in Your Room
Summary: The outside is meh, but the rooms were massive. Everything was clean, staff was friendly. Decent value but the grounds were very 70s motel, with exposed hall ways and damp, dank spots. Overall I'd stay again, but I've seen better three star hotels.

Long story short, this is not a place you want to stay at. Details:  I booked a room with a king bed and paid $130 per night including tax. The hotel is located right next to a highway. The highway wall was 30 feet away from our room door, so it was noisy all day, all night. The staff at the check-in was not helpful at all. The room was very small, old and dark. The bed sheets had wholes in them (see attached pic), the table was old, scratched, and squeaky. The sink was rusty as well as the bath tub (see pics). The hairdryer was old and it was missing a part at the back (see pic), so my hair got into the hairdryer - not good. When we woke up in the morning, there was a big spider on the floor in the bathroom. Two hours later, there was another one there (see pics). Continental

We were very pleased overall with our stay.  The hotel was older with the doors to the rooms all facing outside (no hallway entrances), however, that was a plus as far as coming and going.  The rooms were very clean and recently remodled and quiet, we were on the freeway side. There were some loose towel racks in the bathroom and a missing hook on the bathroom door.  Our only "real" disappointment was that they did not have the waffle irons at breakfast, only frozen waffles.  The only restaurant directly next door is a Hooters and they had great food and chicken wings.

This location is close to beach, shopping, resturants, Fairgrounds,  Parking lot is a little tight. (Shared with Hooters) but can always find a space. Pool is clean and so are the rooms. Staff are delightful and welcoming. Been here on several occasions and love it.

This hotel is in a good location near John Wayne OC Airport. La Quinta Inn & Suites central reservations provided the wrong operating hours for the shuttle and I had to take a cab to the hotel. The next morning the manager apologized and fully reimbursed the cost of the hotel. That's first class customer service.

We reserved 9 rooms to stay in after our all day beach party.  When we arrived our rooms were ready to go and no issues with any of the 9 rooms (not a small task).  We utilized the pool, but were disappointed it didn't have a spa. The beds were comfortable and rooms clean and inviting.  All staff from the front desk to the security guard were friendly and hospitable.  I would recommend this hotel if you are staying in Orange County.  You get a nice stay for a decent price.

This was a great value for the price and an excellent location.  The staff was helpful and friendly to all that I observed while in the lobby or at the front desk.  Upon departure I made a reservation for my next 2 night stay..

I have found that La Quinta Inn's are a wonderful Hotel to stay whether it is business or pleasure. We now look for La Quinta's where ever we travel - And they are pet friendly too... La Quinta's far surpass the  "high end" hotels and the price and quality are wonderful.

Summary Heading: Clean & inexpensive but our room smelled of smoke.
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days I we the 4th of July weekend. The room was clean but smelled horribly of smoke. There are no plugs in the room except for the charging station on the desk that didn't work because the main plug that supplied power to the unit would not stay in the outlet. We never made it to breakfast because we were never ready by 9. We thought it lasted until 10am. It would have been nicer if it did but over all the room was clean (except for the smoke smell) & served its purpose. We were only there to shower & sleep. I would definitely stay here again. Just not in room 147.

The four of us loved our room and the breakfast saved us at least $100! Great location - close to all the amusement parks and malls!  The kids had to have WIFI so that was free too. All in all the place was the best value for the money for sure. Very helpful manager at the desk too ( blond guy).

They say just renovated but didn't have new towels, bathroomswere not up dated, the room was clean and bed is comfortable service is good, morning side breakfast is satisfying, breakfast area is always stocked and clean..... Other wise we like to stay here.

Had a last minute change in travel and booked a night in LQ off the 405.  Check in was a good indication of the lack of interest in the staff.  The place was stinky and the landings and stairs are dirty and littered with trash. The whole place needs a good pressure washing!  The room was really dusty and smelled like cat urine.  When I complained I was informed sorry we cant move you we are full.  So were the nearby properties so I bought some Ozium and sprayed the place went for a walk and it smelled cleaner.  The bathroom vent was a joke and the bottom of the shower curtain was gross. I'll avoid it next time!  On check out a small discount was made when I complained but I didnt get the sense there was going to be any change happening.

Stayed for 3 nights from June 24-26th and the worst experience I have ever had at LQ. The toilet did not flush, the tub did not drain, the door got jammed and the outside of the hotel was dirty and unkept. Being a pet friendly hotel they did not keep the area clean and did not provide waste bags for the dogs. I will not stay at this hotel again.

This is my second review of this property and I last wrote that it was a very tired property.  So I was pleased to receive a flyer from LaQuinta saying this property had been renovated.  We booked a stay of 5 days at a VERY good rate.  The "renovation" is mostly cosmetic and includes new beds and a flat screen TV.  New paint, curtains & carpet.  Most of the rest of the furniture is the same.  First we did not turn the TV on for several days and then when we did we discovered that it did not work.  I was unable to connect to the wifi with my iPad.  You could not latch the door to the bathroom and you could see daylight all around the front door, not to mention the lack of parking spaces.  We arrived downstairs the first morning for their "Bright Side" breakfast only to find no

I needed a place to stay for one night so I chose LQ based on previous experiences with other LQs. It was also in a convenient location off of Harbor Blvd and the 405. The room was clean. The people at the front desk was nice and did their job. I had a 2nd floor corner room, closest to the freeway, but it wasn't too bad. The parking lot fills up so you might have to park in the Hooter's parking lot. There is a small pool in between the buildings that gets some sun for a short period in the afternoon and a "gym" (just a few machines in one of the rooms), which I couldn't use because someone locked the door from the inside.  I was a little surprised that someone came to clean my room before 10am (check out is noon). I did not have a do not disturb sign so I just asked her to come

Summary Heading: Worst LQ I have stayed at
Summary: I have stayed at lq's all over the county but when I explain to the front desk gal at 10:45 pm that I had to park in the next door restaurants parking lot because there was NO parking on the hotels property she said well your lucky you did not have to pay for parking. Well what a %^&*$.  I have never had to pay for parking at a lq and especially at a 2 star property like this one  I just noticed tonight that they had a security guard walking the grounds.  I sure hope there is no damage to my vehicle or it gets towed.  Here is my advise spend a couple dollars more and stay elsewhere

Stayed here Friday night May 24th. Instead of driving straight to San Diego from San Jose we decided to stay the night.  For the price we pay it is worth it.  We ask for the room in the back to avoid the noise of the freeway.  The room is fine to crash for the night.  Bathroom is decent.  The only issue the bed is so lumpy I did not get the sleep I wanted so i woke up feeling exhausted.  Breakfast is so so nothing exciting to brag about. It's mainly an in and out stay.

Very friendly, great value, I would recommend this La Quinta Inn over all of the value hotels on the market at this time. I spend well over 40 nights a year on the road and this was the best experience.... will use them again soon.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel if on a budget
Summary: We traveled with my family to the beach and we stayed at this hotel for two nights. The rooms are pretty nice, the internet is good, and we had a great time in Orange County! The pool was cold and loud, because of the freeway. The breakfast was pretty good. We went to the IKEA across the street from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is traveling on a budget and want a nice room than Motel 6, Days Inn or Super 8.

Summary Heading: Give and take Ying & Yang, Pros & Cons
Summary: Pro Price this location offers the best price of all the other Lq's in the county   Con  You can tell that this hotel location is treated by the Lq corporate head quarters  like the black sheep child of the chain. In fact it's more sinister then that so  After staying hear a number of times i found out the hard way that things break at this hotel that just should not but it's not the fault of the excellent hard working staff that have been working hear for years.
