Btw they are the ones who hold this hotel together more on that later  there is an internal fight going on at this hotel from lq imported want-a-b at the top level a-type assistant or head location managers sent there by lq head quarters as a test training way station so to speak they come and throw thier weight around

I am a loyal customer of LQ inn.. this was not my best exprience.  They gave me a room which had a wierd smell.. My guess is that sombody smoked in it and they tried hard to take the smell off, but they did no good job.  Besides from that, the rest was average.

pros: clean rooms. good service. paid only $59 for a room. hooters located in the same property. very nice location.  cons: no shuttle to and from universal or disney. too close to freeway, can get a little noisy at night from traffic.  definitely recommended.

Only stayed one night.  Arrived very late.  Front desk staff was very friendly.  Room and bathroom was clean and crisp.  Beds were very comfortable.  Would stay here again.  Was the perfect location for my IKEA trip!!!

Summary Heading: A bargain, but a noisy one
Summary: I'd stayed at this hotel several years ago (as I tend to frequent La Quinta a lot), but I remembered it being a bit sub-par.  Now that I've stayed here again recently, I recall the problem from before: the noise from I-405 (if you have a south-facing room) is constant and relentless.  I tried to drown out the freeway noise with the heater-ac unit, but the unit in my room wouldn't produce any warmth, an in trying to adjust it to maximum heat, I noticed the adjustment knob device came all the way out of its fixture into my hand.  Obviously, it was in need of repair.  Nevertheless, the room was newly refurbished and the furniture was quite new.  The shower head wasn't great, and the sink had no stopper devic in the drain.  However, my AARP rate for the room was only $53 per night

Live pretty close but going to concert nearby and can't beat $60 for a room.  Can only speak for myself, but they seem to have gotten their act together cleaning-wise.  Room was great.  Spotless.  Even had signed card from maid, so it seems they've acted on the negative reviews here.    Basic yes, but had nice TV, free Internet, power port w/USB.  Newly remodeled as well.  A little shabby on the outside.  Very friendly staff at check-in.  As others have pointed out, get a room on the back side that faces away from freeway.  Still get some noise from nearby street, but not that bad.  Totally worth the money.

I called in to let them know I was checking in late. My room still wasn't ready by the time I arrived! They ended up putting me in a smoking room when I specifically said and requested NON SMOKING. Im deathly allergic to smoke. After hauling my bag up stairs and back down, I went back to get another room. I didn't know at the time but I was put in a room that WAS NOT CLEAN! I mean garbage, messy sheets, dirty towels... The only thing that went right was that they agreed to give me a full refund. I guess you get for what you pay.

I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, March 7-11. Was originally book for only 3 night but extended 1 more night. The first 3 nights the room was made up. But on the third night after a long and & tiring day I went to my room to find that it was exactly how I left it. Just so I could go ahead & sleep, I went to the front desk to ask if they had personnel to make u my room. Unfortunately, they only have them in mornings. I settled to ask for clean towels so I didn't have to ask for it early morning the following day. I made sure that the front desk on duty that night (March 10) took note of my complaint.  Up to now, I have not received any communication from management despite all the information I was made to fill up upon checking in.

Despite the name, a ways away from the airport. Lotta turns to get to it. Sorta in the middle of nowhere with little around it but a Hooters. What more do you need though <g>   Fast, friendly check in. Elevator trashed, maybe undergoing remodel. Scared us, would the room be as bad? No, bright, clean, newly remodeled. Not the biggest but sufficient. TV worked great as did internet. Bathroom fine. Typical noisy Amana A/C, not bad when running but every time the fan started it let out a loud HONK. Finally set it to constant fan and not cool where it was frequently starting & stopping. Not that hot out.   Pool area looked nice but no time. Typical motel breakfast. For what we paid, a steal in an area like LA.

Good location, reasonable rates and newly refurbished with a continental breakfast. What more do you want! The only down side is that I didn't ask for a room on the opposite side of the freeway.   Half of the hotel faces the freeway and the sound is disturbing especially late at night.

Summary Heading: Lowest cost SNA airport hotel with shuttle
Summary: This La Quinta surprised with the quality of interior amenities. Work desk, work chair, bathroom all in excellent working order. Wifi Internet fast and reliable. This hotel offers a shuttle to and from the Santa Ana = Orange County = John Wayne (= Costa Mesa = Newport Beach) airport (SNA), although limited times on demand only. Plenty of staff for checkin and checkout. Breakfast was OK, included prepeeled hard boiled eggs and Otis prepackaged muffins. The property is right next to 405 and there is a certain level of unavoidable freeway background noise, bring ear plugs if this is a concern. Heat worked well and was not noisy. Overall would come back here, especially at the bargain rate received (less than half of the Courtyard ratea mile up the Harbor). Used AAA discount.

Summary Heading: If you like filth then stay here!
Summary: This place is at the bottom range as hotels go!  It does not even qualify as a one star as rating go.    The carpets are filthy as there are trails of dirt going from the door to the bathroom.  If you have children do not even think of going to this establishment unless you are not concerned for their well-being.  Rooms are barely cleaned as there was hair from the previous occupants in both rooms that I stayed in.  The toilet backed up more than once and to top it off there was a used toothbrush left beside the nightstand on the carpet from the previous occupants.    This was all reported and I was advised that it would be resolved, however, upon returning to my room the tooth brush was in the same spot on the carpet (see picture).  It makes you wonder if they clean the rooms

Summary Heading: Great Budget Hotel for a nights sleep
Summary: Stayed here one night before departing from Orange County Airport.  Very nicely updated room, extremely CLEAN, comfy beds, great location to access airport since it's right by the highway.  The hotel grounds are in the motel style where all room doors are accessed from the outside.  Had a pool, but was too cold during my visit to be used.  Nice free breakfast too.  Still surprised at how much nicer rooms looked compared to what I was expecting when I arrived at hotel.

I highly recommend this hotel for its excellent customer service, cleanliness, comfort, and convenience!  The rates are reasonable especially if you book in advance and the rewards club pays off quickly!  If you want a good night'sleep, this is ideal!  Breakfasts are free along with wifi. There's a gym & washer/dryer access too. And dogs are allowed;-))

My room was clean and the bed very comfortable. I was able to use my laptop since the hotel offers wi- fi. The front desk staff friendly and polite . The continental breakfast was filling. Come and check it out you won't be disappointed. I'll be back.

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay; you got to have a car
Summary: The staff was nice, the room was good, with a comfortable bed and flat screen TV.  I enjoyed the simple breakfast.  The heater worked well (temp was in the 30's at night).  There's a Hooters on site if you don't have a car and Ikea across the road, which has good eats.  On the other side of I-405 are a number of fast food places (first one, In and Out Burger), on Harbor Blvd.  I needed an early shuttle to SNA on Sunday; the hotel accomodated me.  Check the shuttle times if you have an early flight

Summary Heading: Best hotel stay in a long time.
Summary: The room was clean, no bugs, no spiders, clean bathroom and quiet.  But the BEST part; the bed and the pillows were heaven.  I don't know what kind of pillows they were but, they were not your standard hotel kind;.they were the high end type.   The bed was so comfortable, I had to lift the sheets and comforter to see what the brand was.  It was a Simmons and it looked and slept  rather new like you'd find in a 4 to 5 star hotel.  Yes, the mattress was that nice!  Also, the gentleman that worked the night of December 23rd was very helpful and made our trip very comfortable. Thank you!

We needed a pet friendly place to stay near Huntington Beach, CA. We had a Good experience with check in, the room was quiet & clean, and the hotel and staff were PET Friendly. Plus the free breakfast was a good way to start the day!

I was attending a concert in the area,and La Quinta was very close to the venue,and the price was in my range.I was greeted by friendly staff,and the check in and check out went really smooth.There wasn't much noise considering how close it was to the 405 freeway.My only complaint is the parking lot lighting being insuffecient,bit other than that overall I was satisfied,and I would stay here again.

Excellent hotel with professional and helpful staff.  Rooms were clean and well maintained.  Grounds are well cared for and parking lot is clean.  Freeway noise is a problem but not so much it would ruin your stay or keep you awake.   Good location and easy to get to great shopping and restaurants.

Summary Heading: Enjoyable stay.  Great hotel great value, especially if you have pets traveling with you.
Summary: Very accommodating if you have pets.  Very light breakfast, but not a major problem.  Rooms are clean, and spacious enough for 2 people and 2 dogs.  Family of 4 might be cramped.  Friendly staff.  Laundry on-site which is convenient.  8 miles from Disneyland parking.  Food and shopping nearby.

very clean..very close to the freeway. would def stay here again. love all the food shops around. the staff is very kind and helpful. i stayed for 3 nights and my room was cleaned everyday.  its very discreet calm place to stay.

The people at the front desk could not have been friendlier and accommodating. Great price, great location. I will be staying here again. I liked how flexible they are in making changes. I had to cancel a room and add it again later and they did not increase the prices even though it was a busy weekend. Continental breakfast was also a plus.

I stayed here for two nights on a vacation. It's located by a major highway, the interstate 405. That's a positive since it's convenient but it's also a negative since you're surrounded by traffic noise. The room was clean and comfortable. The decor was dated and in need of a remodeling. The breakfast was your typical continental, no surprises. Ok for a quick stay.

This location is a little dated, but has a great staff, who will do all they can to make you stay comfortable.  I was disappointed at not having a microwave and refrigerator.  Breakfast was a little sparse, but it was an excellent value, and much better than comparably priced neighbors.

Summary Heading: This La Quinta does and has done a great job
Summary: This La Quinta was renovated between our last visit and this one and the guest rooms realy reflect the upgrade.  The staff is always ready to help and registration and exit were handled very well.  We do enjoy the complementary breakfast - starts the day off well and the round-the-clock coffee is a welcome extra.  Visitors should be sure and check how you get into the property was it can be a bit tricky - simple once one learns "how".  We've used this property several times and have always enjoyed our stay.  Good property for the price!

The stay was great and the service was great everything was quick and easy. Beside the little promblem we had when we got there was solve quick but we had the give up the 3rd floor where out family was staying no biggie. Or last night was comp and prices was great I will be staying here ever time im in LA. Had to make more then 3 trip down to the office more then once. A little problem but I don't mind. My key was not working due to left in my pocket next to my cell phone. Over all I had a great time and can't wait to go back. Love how we had drinks before the wedding and was never bother by any staff. It was only 1 in the afternoon but some placeses are jerk and we did not have any trouble.

No frills but very convenient, clean and comfortable. The beds are super comfortable which is very important to us. The bathrooms need to be updated but they are clean. We stay here whenever we are in town, why stay anywhere else when you can be comfortable at a GREAT PRICE!

I stayed on a Wednesday and Thursday night in the fall of 2012.  The hotel is sandwiched between the 405 and the commuter rail, so there is plenty of noise to contend with.  Pets are allowed, which sounds like a nice thing (I am a BIG dog person!), but then I stayed in a room that shared a wall with 2 small yappy dogs.  The extra building that they have out back (the one that ISN'T pictured on their website) is 100% concrete.  I suppose it was meant to look like a barn, but what it ended up resembling was a prison.  The first 3 floors of rooms in that building are all concrete, gray, cells.  No paint, no attempt to smooth out the walls or cement blemishes, it's just a transformed prison cell with a king size bed and TV.  Also if you are a non-smoker, do NOT stay here!  There is

Summary Heading: Excellent price, beware of Hooter's next door
Summary: Very good value, near freeways--we we're visiting UC Irvine--good location.  Rooms very clean (as in all La Quintas I've ever stayed).  Breakfast not as good as other La Quintas--no fresh waffles.  Hooter's next door can be a bit noisy--there were a bunch of motorcyclists whooping it up in the shared parking lot later in the evening...not dangerous, just loud.

Summary Heading: Great room at a great price
Summary: The location was excellent, as it was literally seconds away from the freeway, but it wasn't loud and didn't prevent me from sleeping. The room was in excellent condition, clean shower and beds, clean floor. I didn't feel scared to walk around barefoot like I have at other hotels. The price was very reasonable. Front office staff was very friendly and helpful. Free continental breakfast included waffles, cereal, bagels, fruit, yogurt, muffins, coffee, and juice.The hotel is next to a Hooters and a short drive to various restaurants. I felt the neighborhood and hotel was safe. The only complaint I have about this hotel was that the bed wasn't terribly comfortable. But I am picky when it comes to that.

We always have great service at the hotels. They are well kept, and staff always willing to help. However we do notice that the shower curtains have black mold growing on the bottom. Every time my wife and I see this we let the front know and the either get us a clean curtain or a new room

The room was clean and the beds are comfortable and clean. The tv is nice and there are alot of good tv stations to choose from. The check in and out process was fast.  The location is good close to the 405/55 freeways.

We've stayed here each September for the last 3 years.  Nice clean rooms.  Always had a king bed.  My wife teaches a seminar at a local church here.  We drive down from Bakersfield on friday night.  Church pays so it's all good. There is a nice pool and a Hooters next door.  In-N-Out Burger is just on the other side of the freeway.  The only bad things are that the rooms do not have an inside hallway and being 3 levels there is only one outside elevator that is not well lit.  I have no idea of the cost but if we were paying our selfs I would still stay here.

Even though it was the almost the least expensive hotel around, I was a bit disappointed.  The property wasn't the cleanest.  The bath tub/shower looked like it had mold growing in the tiles.  tub drain had hair in it and it drained slowly.  The carpet made me want to wear shoes at all times. This could be good for some and bad for other but, there is a Hooters restaurant in the same parking lot.    Ok, now some positive.  I only paid $62, the bed was clean and comfortable, good size room, very nice front office people, free internet, Nearly ever thing and store you could possibly be looking for is near by.  Sprouts (a grocery store)  is just south on Harbor blvd, I LOVE this store!  TV is good.  I had a downstairs room near the pool closer inwards and it was pretty quiet.  I do

Obviously when I looked at the reviews I didn't scroll down far enough.  It is so close to the 405 that I could throw a rock into the traffic. Very noisy.  When I was checking in there was this attractive woman in a silk dress and high heels who was paying for her room in cash (hmmmmmmm) and turned out to be a guy. Not a big deal, love my LGBT friends but paying cash for a room is a bit suspicious for anyone.  Continued to run into shady characters who were just loitering around and made both me and my daughter nervous. Who hangs outside a hotel in 100 degree weather?? After our concert we returned to the hotel and I showed her how to walk with your keys in between your fingers in case we were accosted. The price was low and I didn't expect a palace but I do like to feel safe

This motel gives one the best accommodations for the price in Orange County. It's next to the 405 freeway, but not intrusively so, and is close to Disneyland, the beach, John Wayne Airport, and local business destinations. Absolutely the most local bang for your lodging buck.

Summary Heading: WISH I DIDN'T HAVE TO STAY HERE EVERY TIME I TRAVEL TO O/C.
Summary: Floors were not vacuumed upon my arrival.  Looked like hair coloring on all walls of bathroom.  Dust in all corners of room.    Cigarette burn on Bathtub. Wireless cut in and out.   Beds were extremely comfortable!

Not what I'm accustomed to at LQ.  Old property structure that will remind you of a Motel 6.  Not a complete disaster, but a disappointment to say the least.   Just not up to the same standards as other LQ properties.

We were SO pleasantly surprised at La Quinta--especially after I read some no-so-favorable reviews.  The staff was very nice, the rectangular pool was clean and wonderful--perfect for some lap exercise after traveling all day.  We found the room clean, and never heard the freeway traffic.  Keep up the good work.  I plan to share my views with other travelers.

Summary Heading: La qunita facilities/services are not standardized.
Summary: Environment is gloomy and very unattractive,  No or little green areas, all concrete.  Trash containers right across from your door.  Room was clean. Breakfast was a joke.  Everything came in a box or packaged.   Access to the inn was difficult to find and not marked (across a canal and crammed between the canal and the freeway behind a tall fence)  We have stayed at the la quinta at stevenson's ranch several times and had the same expectations when we booked this. The experience was completely opposite.  We will not stay at another La Quinta without a through investigation of its grounds, appearance and services.

Summary Heading: Night-time vehicle damage & poor public hygiene
Summary: Parking Lot Damage at Night: 6/14-15 I provided the front desk staff and night-time security guard with an inquiry, and the manager with a detailed damage description, but have yet to receive a response from anyone who works for or at this hotel.  Affable Chad, of the front desk, took and delivered my written report to the hotel manager on 6/16/2012.   The adjacent night business from Hooter's Restaurant were also heard from inside of our rooms after 10:00 PM, and also loud voices and activity were heard in the hotel's parking lot during both nights.  Staff stated that they would check the surveillance camera footage, and ask other personnel, regarding the collision damage to my vehicle, which I showed to Chad.  Still waiting.  Toxics Myself and others in my group experienced

Very worn out hotel. Needs lots of repair. All rooms face out to the street.No central hallway. Very noisy with car alarms and preople outside yelling and screeming.  Next to a bar and busy 405 freeway. Save your money and go elsewhere!

This La Quinta is a nice place to stay and rates for OC are pretty good value.  I only have two complaints; 1) if you arrive late, finding a  parking space is next to impossible and 2) their breakfast is horribly lacking. For the money you pay for the rooms, it really needs to be upgraded.  Otherwise I enjoyed my stay.

Booked a four day stay at this hotel. First night, the air conditioner was blowing hot air - the front desk said the mechanic would check the next day as he had gone. Next morning, reminded the front desk to check the air. Back that night - hot air. Mechanic, of course gone. Told the front desk the next morning - no other rooms, checked out after two days. Would not give me a check out statement as I had booked through an agent.   Contacted agent. Agent contacted hotel and was told by the Asst Manager that I did not check out until two days later, and that there was no record of complaints about the air conditioner. (No wonder it never got fixed).   This hotel is right by Highway 405 - very noisy if you have to leave the windows open - even at 2AM. They have put ashtrays all

Terrible hotel - thought I was staying at the LaQuinta in Santa Ana.  Room had a smokey and chemical smell.  Dog hair on the bed coverings.  No refrigerator or microwave.  No Business Center.  Would never stay at this location again - Spent a total of 12 nights here and it was a huge mistake.  I would rather pay more and stay in a clean, quiet location.  Also, noise from Hooter's all during the night was overwhelming.  Bad choice - Do not stay here.
Nice enough hotel. Only issue was the air conditioner rapidly cycled on and off and made it difficult to sleep.

Summary Heading: Not the best I've stayed at.
Summary: Room still had stuff in the dresser and dirty towel on the back of bathroom door.  The TV flickered off when the closet or dresser was opened.  The only restuarant in walking distance is Hooters.  The bed was confortable and the A/C worked so the importent things were ok.  Would not stay there again.  Road construction in the area made it hard to find, thank you GPS.  Parking is limited.
If you are a non smoker, ask for a room as far from the pool area as possible, it seemed thats where it smells of cigarettes the most and get to breakfast early or settle for what is left.

Because of previous freeway widening and taking of land, parking may not be available in front of your room, but is plentiful on the property.  If breakfasting when the property is fully booked, arrive early and have considerable patience.

The first room I was provided had no air conditioning, and no working lights.  The two chairs from the table area were in the bathroom and the bathroom was dirty.  I was offered a 2nd room which appeared to have none of these issues.  I awoke the first morning to a huge spider hanging above my head from the ceiling.  Two others made their presence known when I entered the bathroom. There was no hot water in the shower and a piece of the peeling paint on the bathroom floor affixed itself to my foot as I exited the bathroom.    I am not a primadonna.  Yes – I have stayed at the Plaza, The Four Seasons and the Regency, but I have also stayed at Hiltons, Embassy Suites and two other LaQuintas – all with no issues.  This was a travesty, and completely unacceptable.    I do not blame

Had just left La Quinta Inn Mission Bay and headed for the beach area of Orange County. The Mission Bay hotel was fabulous so I booked a room here thinking it would be the same. What a difference it was! The hotel is right next to Hooters and the parking area was full. The room was dingy, old and had a horrible smell. The carpet was old, the bed was broken down, the bathroom door scraped the floor, the towels was so scratchy I thought they would make great loofahs! We stayed the one night and checked out. Moved into the Ayers Hotel Costa Mesa and what a  great find that was. Check out the Ayers and do not stay here unless you like the Motel 6 experience. Not all La Quintas are the same......

First time stay at this location by a loyal LQ customer. I would definitely stay here again. Clean room, comfortable bed, good breakfast with healthy choices. Only drawback is highway noise but I requested and was given a room facing away from the freeway and was not disturbed by traffic sounds.

Wanted to spend a little quality time with my girls (wife and daughters) and thought a quick trip to an LQ would do the trick. We didn't have anything planned but knew that we loved staying at a LQ whenever we could. We reserved this room not too far from home as we had to be back at church on Sunday morning and just planned on hanging out by the pool and relaxing all day. We were not disappointed. Everything was to our liking and we also had an excellent time at a local attraction. One of the best parts of the trip was during the checkout process. Yvette was great! She was also very helpful when there was a mix-up with the billing. I had reserved on the phone for a certain price per night but due to a computer issue never received a confirmation email. When I got the bill I

Property is old and out of date.  Visual signs of some attempt to update are evident but they missed the mark.  Not very clean.  Grandchildren came to visit and my 2 year old took her shoes off and was on the carpet with her socks.  After 5 minutes she crawled on the bed.  EWWWWWW, disgusting. I noticed some "working girls" mulling about and was not happy about that.  I also notice a lot of PERMANENT guests seem to camp out at places that allow pets.  No smoking allowed IN the rooms but that sure doesn't stop them from lighting up right outside your door.   I won't stay at this location again.  Was very disappointed.  The BRIGHT SIDE BREAKFAST was nothing more than packaged garbage.  It was not a great experience.  I will say the girl at the front desk was very pleasant!
Hotel was very dirty and smelled like an ashtray. AC didn't work. Carpet was so dirty my kids feet were black within 10 minutes. The staff however were extremely pleasant to deal with

i generally stay at LaQuintas when traveling with my dog.  I was on my way to San Diego and this was the perfect place to stop enroute...or so it seemed. not the best neighborhood and VERY noisy right off the 405. I checked twice to see if the window was open it was so loud...it wasn't .  I ended up turning the tv volume way up just to drown out the outside noise. you could see daylight all the way round the door, which probablly didn't help.  the tv was a newer flat screen and nice...beyond that the room was in major need of updating.
Good and Great Service, Easy access to the Hotel and Great location. bigger parking. goog attention for the personal and good breakfast

This property is really tired.  We have stayed here several times a year for the last 25 years because it is close to where we need to be.  I always request a room on the back side as the front is literally on the 405 Fwy.  I need earplugs to sleep here, but the price and the location keeps us coming back.

We stayed at La Quinta for a week between moving to Orange County and finding a new home.  Make no mistake, this is a budget hotel.  The rooms are small, no fridge, you are close enough to the 405 to have a constant whir of road noise, the breakfast is pretty boring and minimal, etc.  But the bed is seriously one of the most comfortable I've ever had in a hotel room.  Think Westin Heavenly Beds, not old, hard dumpy hotel beds.  The linens were great and the white down comforter was a pleasant surprise.  I really expected the gacky polyester bedspread that you don't dare let touch your skin.  The wifi worked well.  Sometimes it slowed way down, but for public access wifi, it could have been WAY worse.  The location is FANTASTIC for getting around.  We had to do lots of running

I have never felt as uncomfortable in any hotel, there were cigarette smokes penetrating through the walls. I requested to be moved and was informed no room is available.  Simply put, I did not have a good night sleep and I will not be coming back. I came back to my house sick.

Summary Heading: easy to access location, friendly staff
Summary: This is a simple hotel with the extra of a breakfast and wifi.  It is often too cold to use the pool but there is a pool.   It is supler close to the shopping centers and fairly easy to get to UC Irvine with a car.  The staff is really very friendly. It is possible to get rides to and from the airport. Perfect to stay with your kids.

Summary Heading: Room type request rude front desk person
Summary: Before I state my complaint I will say the hotel was fine as was the room.  We have stayed at many La Quinta's in at least 6 different states with never a problem.  But the experience with the front desk at arrival left a bad taste in my mouth.  We had requested a smoking room with 2 beds since we were travelling with our grandson.  I had made the reservation over 24 hours earlier and quarenteed the room with a credit card.  When we arrived I was informed they had no such room available that they had given that room to someone else.  There were 2 staff members at the desk.  The male was friendly courteous and helpful and found a way to accomodate us.  The female was rude and condesending telling me that a room selection was just a request not a guarantee and I would have to

Summary Heading: Good value for money with some flaws
Summary: We visited Orange county for the weekend. This La Quinta is located next to Hooters. It is not an issue but I did have some suggestions about where to have dinner from my teenagers. The hotel is located just off I-405 and access is easy once you figure out how to exit.  The room we were in was threadbare but clean. The climate control is not very refined, so it is possible you will have to get out of bed to re-adjust. There are very few electrical sockets in the room and they are so old that the plugs fall out of them.I had to unplug the alarm clock to charge my phone. The TV is new and provides a lot of stations  We had a problem with the shower faucet. It did not get fixed though I called attention to it. This is the reason for three stars for Service. Otherwise, the front

Inn is dated but was kept clean. Closest food place is Hooter's on the premises. Free breakfast had usual continental items. Front staff was very helpful and engaging during breakfast. We were concerned that the door was not self-closing. Parking was a challenge because of saturday sold out situation.

Stayed for 3 nights, Saturday, Sunday & Monday. Clean, quiet, functional rooms. Front desk called our room 30 minutes after we checked in and asked if the room was ok? Thats Classy....  Short drives to eating, shopping, entertainment all nearby. We drove our own vehicle, so we didn't take advantage of the airport shuttle. Bright Side Breakfast was different and good each day. It's free too! Hotel is right off the 405 freeway, and our room was facing the freeway across the "too cold in February to use pool,"  but the room heat/ac unit on fan only drowned out all but the loudest of traffic noises. Will stay again...Have already recommended staying here to Family and Friends staying in Orange County.
We stayed for two nights and were badly disappointed as we are a frequent La Quinta guest. The rooms were dingy, outdated and had musty odor Breakfast was not typical of La Quinta

We brought a group of students here on a college tour of Southern California.  The reviews looked decent, and the price was great.  My room was okay for that price, and I would have probably given it 3 stars.  There is a lot of freeway noise, but I can sleep through most things.However, here are some of the negatives: 1.  One of our students rooms had sheets with blood on the bed 2.  The bathroom in another room was full of dirt and hair 3.  Yet another room had hair on the towels 4.  There were many "unsavory" characters, lurking about, and the front desk didn't help out when we asked to either be moved to all the same location or have the people lurking around checked.  Didn't make my students feel safe 5.  In another room, the sheets clearly were not washed between guests

We were there for a hockey tournament and the location was good for us. The staff was very friendly. Room was clean, beds comfortable, A/C worked fine and free continental breakfast. Some freeway traffic noise but not terrible. A great value. We will come here again.

Summary Heading: For the value it is okay.
Summary: For the value it is okay.....With that being said, this was our 2nd stay at this location. We request a room at the back away from the freeway noise and it is fine. I found it very inconvenient that they don't have a fridge and microwave in the room. We requested one at booking. Which we booked a month out. Found out 2 hours before our arrival it was not happening and had to go buy an ice chest to have cold sodas in the room. The room was clean. It is an old place and could do with refurbishing in the bathrooms. This time our toilet was making a dripping sound all weekend. That was after the on duty desk clerk came up to make temp repairs. They offered to move us, but we had to do that last time and it is a hassle when you have already unpacked! The beds are extremely

Summary Heading: A little better and a little worse
Summary: We stayed here for a family function.  The function was taking place in Huntington Beach and when I found the La Quinta in Costa Mesa was only a few miles away I decided to stay here because I knew they took pets (We brought the dog).  I have stayed at La Quntas before and really like them and this was (Like the title says) a little better and a little worse. The room was much roomier than the last La Quinta I stayed in, and was very clean and comfortable.  The freeway is right next to the place and can be a little loud for some, but since it's not far from the ocean the ocean breezes make it nice. The little worse part was that the room, for some reason, did not come with a mini-fridge and a micro wave like the other places I've stayed at.  It's only a minor inconvenience, but

Last time I stayed in OC hotel was a Holiday inn, near this location. I paid $53. This was in 2002. Ten years later staying at this LQ 10 years later and paid almost the same. Great location by freeway, and a Hooters next door amongst others. If you are going to the OC beaches or OC entertainment Parks you can save big bucks and be 10 mins away!

Stayed here for one night for a quick business trip. I couldn't open the door to my hotel room, even though the green light went on when I inserted the key. I was on the 3rd floor and was dreading walking all the way to the front desk, but luckily had my cell phone and the room key jacket had the phone number on it, so I called and they sent someone to let me in.  I asked for a quiet room, and although they gave me a room away from the road, I still could hear the freeway, so perhaps this is not a great place for light sleepers. The room also smelled a bit like smoke, even though it was supposed to be non-smoking, but after I ran the AC unit for a bit, I didn't notice the smell so much.  Bedding was nice and clean, bathroom was clean with soap and shampoo (no conditioner).
We stayed there on New Year's Eve, nice, clean and reasonable price. Good conti. breakfast. Definitely will come back.

Summary Heading: Not a 5* hotel but wasn't expecting that!
Summary: My friend and I stayed here for 2 nights. Yes it is close to the freeway, but where our rooms were positioned it was not a problem at all. Have to say the first room had a minor problem, but the desk clerk handled it quickly and efficiently getting us moved to another room rather than wait for maintenance! For the price of this room I was quite satisfied. I found the beds comfortable, the room clean!!! No it is not a brand new place but totally acceptable for the rate paid. We will stay there again when we are in the area! It more than met our needs and expectations.

Summary Heading: Costa Mesa La Quinta...go somewhere else
Summary: We are locals, and we stayed at the Costa Mesa La Quinta for a couple of nights while our house was being painted. We're not going back...!!!   The place is dirty and in disrepair...cigarette buds and dog poop all over the place. The beds are uncomfortable and there is a lot of freeway noise. The next-door Hooters restaurant probably doesn't do much for the property if you're family oriented or just want a good nights sleep.   We have happily stayed at other La Quinta's over the years, but...we're not going back to this one.  You can normally find several three star hotels on hotwire.com in the Costa Mesa area going for between $50 and $55 on many nights. These are much better choices than the Costa Mesa La Quinta Inn.

We stayed 3 nights at this place.  We got a very good rate, so we weren't expecting a 4-star experience.  The only good thing I can say about it was that the room was clean.  The pool wasn't.  There was a bin by the pool that supposedly held towels, but it was empty.  However, the trash bin by the pool was chock-a-block full.  The people at the front desk knew nothing about anything.  No matter what kind of question we asked, they didn't have the answer.  The response we always got was that they didn't live around there and were just filling in.  Really?  All the front desk personnel?  The counter space in the bathroom was so small, that there was no room for cosmetics or anything else.  The elevator didn't work despite their promises that it would be fixed "tomorrow."  Tomorrow

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for a decent price
Summary: We stayed here so we would be close to John Wayne airport and not have to get up so early. Overall was pretty nice. We liked that they had a washer and dryer. This was nice so we could have all of our clothes washed when we got home and be able to relax.

Summary Heading: Cheap, and you get what you pay for.
Summary: Nice staff, close to airport & shopping...very tired hotel. Great if on a budget...free wifi and very basic breakfast. Loud highway noise all night long.

Summary Heading: New Management or Bait and Switch
Summary: We booked rooms for a wedding party in March, and were shown a room and given a price quote, for the wedding in September. When, we and some of our guest arrived and "SURPRISE" "she no longer works here", "we have no records of your quote". Rooms are not what we were shown, the pool was dirty, the pool area looks like a "butt bucket" and I have slept in the jungle and in the swamp, but I wouldn't lay by the pool.    The elevator has been out of service for three (3) days, every day the staff,says it will get fixed today. That sucks when you walk with a cane, and your rooms are on the 3rd floor.All TV service was down for 2 days, who cares about HD TV, when you can't even watch the local news.   I feel sorry for the staff, whoever owns this property is getting rich, by not making

Summary Heading: Good Price, reasonable rooms, has some issues...
Summary: 3 Stars Not so much fun! would have been 4 if the room facilities worked better, 5 if we could have enjoyed the pool.   Pros-  Friends wedding 8/25/11 in Newport Beach, we didn't want to pay NB prices so hubby, daughter and I stayed here 3 nights 4 days. Thurs- Sunday.  Reservations were easy enough on Price-line and in our budget so no complaints. Check in was simple, no credit card for incidentals, not that it matters but that's cool by me. Free breakfast (and it looked good!) but Denny's and IHOP are literally just down the street and that's what my Peach wanted for breakfast.   Room was a double bed, 3rd floor, pool/freeway side. The beds were sooooooo comfy and there were plenty of fluffy white towels and soft pillows. We were in the middle of an obnoxious heat wave and the

It's not really cheap. However, comparing to other hotels nearby, a little bit cheaper.  First time, my parents checked in and told me that the bathtub in the room is bad. But, they later changed the room for us. The building is old. The room is normal. The bed is OKay. The only good thing is the Full HDTV with HD channels in the room.   I'd say if you only want to say for a day just for going somewhere else instead of spending most of your time there. You can try it. It is not as bad as Days Inn Alamosa(there won't be a hotel worse than that one...lol) However, this la quinta is not as good as other la quinta still...Even the breakfast cant compare with the la quinta I stayed in Rapid City.

Summary Heading: Great location, great amenities.  Solid value.
Summary: Things I love about this hotel: free wifi, breakfast, location, and parking.  Great value for the area.  Just bring earplugs if a light sleeper since it’s right on the 405 ($2 at Walmart is your best friend if a lightsleeper).  Love staying here and staff is accommodating.  It was my 3rd time: I'll be back.

We stayed here at the last moment and had to find a place for one night. We had to wait an hour to check in as neither of the offered rooms were ready. They offered to store our bags so I had to struggle with 3 cases across the hotel while the attendant walked ahead of me. When I finally asked for help through a door he seemed surprised! The freeway noise was so loud we had to shout when out by the pool. We decided to forgo that swim. The room smelt stale and the bath took a few hours to drain. The beds looked clean and pretty new but the rest of the hotel was awful. They offered a free brekafast but apparently many of the guests think free means "all you can eat for the day" as I watched a number of groups load up with heaps of stuff and go back to their rooms. The staff

My husband & I stayed at this location July 22 & 23, 2011, we had come from Colorado for a business conference (at another hotel) and stayed a couple extra days for pleasure (moved from the other hotel to this hotel). I almost always stay at La Quinta's mainly for the free Internet and breakfast included.   First thing we noticed as we are walking up the stairs to our room is the near deafening sound of the 405 Freeway that we now realize we are almost on top of - okay, my fault for not paying more attention to the location when I booked it. Lesson learned.  Well, after we checked in we could not connect to the Internet, so I called the front desk and he said he would re-set the router "that usually takes care of it" .... so right away I know this is an ongoing problem. At least

Hotel sits a stones throw from 405,so naturally there will be some noise.Our room had double pane windows which shut out most noise...room smelled a little stale..but got used to it..my chief complaint was we arrived at 930 tired and sleepy....window air unit blowing cool air.....no knobs on unit and wall thermostat not working.Called down stairs explaining to young lady not working correctly,,,,kept telling my wife same thing over and over.."KNOBS" turn them....lol There are none!!! Said I'll be up in a minute..... nevershowed!!!! We slept ok that night...next day told them about problem....this time they were pretty quick to respond..different people different attitudes!!!!! Breakfast was fine, located next to Hooters, so that was fine,:-).........overall it was ok,

This was a terrific place to stay.  There was a really nice and accommodating front desk man named Tyronne who went above and beyond the call of duty.  The shower, room, and breakfast was great, and we couldn't beat the price.  Overall a great experience, especially thanks to Tyronne.
The hotel staffers are friendly. Room is clean. Location is noisy ....next to busy freeway :(

Summary Heading: Average Hotel but unexpected superior service received
Summary: I needed to stay one night in Orange County so I decided to cruise on over to the La Quinta in Costa Mesa, which is close to the John Wayne airport and the South Coast Plaza. The hotel is located right on the 405 freeway and Harbor. It's a bit noisy with all the traffic going by all the time but what else can you expect when staying next to the freeway. The rooms are as expected, not glamorous but in good shape and with enough appointments. The lobby and pool area are nice also. The room includes breakfast which has the usual stuff but I didn't have any of the offerings. Others seemed to enjoy it. The unfortunate thing was that my room was in an area where the internet router was not working very well. I couldn't get a good internet connection. I called the support desk for the

Your Basic need of shelter and running water will be met.  I unfortunately left an overnight bag behind the door and realized my oversight 2 hours after I checked out. I phoned the front desk to notify them; no bag was found but they stated the room had already been cleaned and they would need to speak to the cleaning lady. I received a follow up call 3 hours later telling me nothing was found by the cleaning personnel. All I can conclude is that the monetary tip I left for the cleaning lady must have been insulting and she felt my overnight bag was a worthy compensation. I did write a letter to the Management to alert them of my disappointment and concern. I know, one dishonorable cleaning person shouldn't taint the entire La Quinta establishment.   The irony is that we rented

Summary Heading: NOISY, rundown and not worth the cost
Summary: We stayed at the La Quinta because we had an early morning flight out of Orange County.  I wish I had noticed that the good reviews were from 2006!  First, it sits right under the 405 and the freeway noise was constant all night.  If that wasn't bad enough, we had a cricket inside our room!  The carpeting was so worn it had holes in it.  The shower tile was moldy and the water in the shower was restricted to little more than a dribble.  The breakfast was straight 7-11 prepackaged pastries, cereal (Cornflakes only), yogurt and drinks.   I expect more for $80 a night.

Summary Heading: WiFi non existent, lots of freeway noise, parking bad!
Summary: We got a great rate on our week long stay at this hotel.  We were in town for my daughter's graduation.  There were lots of activities to attend.  While on the road, it was necessary to have a WiFi connection.  The connection at this hotel was pretty much non-existent.  We contacted technical support three times and the front desk twice.  Finally, they said that we could change rooms to get a better connection.  Their staff helped us move all of our belongings to the new room.  The WiFi connection in that room was even worse.  We had to go to the lobby to use the the WiFi connection there.  We were on the freeway side of the hotel, so consequently, LOTS of freeway noise.  There was not any weather stripping on the door jams to slow the noise down.  My best ear plugs were put to

Summary Heading: Hasta La Vista (Good Riddance) La Quinta
Summary: Was traveling on business and did not plan on being in the room much so I just wanted a simple clean hotel room.  Did not find that with this La Quinta location.  Size of the room was typical for a motel.  Arrived very late at night so I just jumped straight into bed.  The bed was very hard.  Tried to take a shower the next day and the shower did not work (water only came out of the faucet, not out of the shower).  Informed the front desk and they moved me to another room.  Although my new room had a working shower it only had two water temperatures, cold and ice cold.  Free wireless internet was slow.  Room did not have convenient electrical outlets to charge electronics such as cell phones, laptops, etc.)  Continental breakfast was skimpy.  Hotel was conveniently located with

This hotel is right near the 405 so unless you love hearing cars constantly day and night, you should look for another place. We stayed for 2 nights and really expected more from Laquinta. The rooms were okay to sleep however the bathroom was disgusting. There where yellow and black stains on the tub itself and long strands of hair when we first took a look. Costa Mesa is a nice town but this is not the place to stay.

Summary Heading: Overall just a bad hotel, if can find a better place, don't stay here
Summary: The hotel is noisy, very noisy, the freeway is very close to the hotel, if you really want to stay here you need to book on the other side of the hotel.  We were lucky enough to be able to move rooms.  Once we turned out the lights and tried to sleep we realized it would be a horrible few days if we stayed in the same room, so we changed to the other side.  Other issues: The air conditioners smell like mold.  The washing machine was broken, I did landry only to find out I had to ring out every one of my clothes myself before drying them.  I started at 9pm, I did not finish until 2am!!!!!! And of course there are no maintenance staff at night.  The day staff were less than helpful, attitude problems.  There are really no places to eat near here, hope you have a car.  Ikea has a

Summary Heading: Never again. I'll pay more elsewhere for a clean place.
Summary: Needed a place to stay in Costa Mesa, near John Wayne Airport, not expensive- and wanting a clean room with a comfy bed was my minimal expectation for the money. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was unusable! The shower only had cold water with low pressure. The bottom of the bath/shower was that non-slip texture which was dark grey from not cleaning correctly- so also think it was unsanitary to use. Asked for coffee basket for in room maker, and they never showed up to deliver. I did appreciate the reviews of others and asked for the opposite side from 405 fwy- it was quiet. Walking to car I saw what appeared to be a couple drive-up drug deals going on a few doors down. No security in sight EVER. It's a place to keep your head down & walk fast.

Summary Heading: Easily the worst hotel I have been to... and I've been to some dingy places
Summary: There are three things that really upset me about this place.  First is that there are NO (as in 0) non-smoking rooms.  I don't mean there were none available, I mean they don't exist here.  I changed rooms twice due the smell.  They are happy to advertise that they have non-smoking rooms, but in reality they simply have smoking rooms with the ashtray removed and some air freshener added.  The "non-smoking" rooms don't even say non-smoking which makes it easy to sell the room however they want.  The second thing that upsets me about the place is its lack of king beds.  I stayed here with my girlfriend and booked a room with a king.  "Sorry, all out".  The beds were very uncomfortable as well.  The third thing is what many other people have mentioned.  It's next to the freeway

The hotel is about 50 yards from the freeway, so the traffic noise is terrible.  If you cannot be guaranteed a room away from the freeway, book elsewhere.  Also, it shares a parking lot with Hooters, so the Saturday night crowd is a little iffy.   Also, there is no computer with a printer so you cannot print out boarding passes.  The rooms were fine though.

We generally rely on the La Quinta brand when traveling by car. This La Quinta is run down and in generally poor condition. The first room we were offered reeked of smoke. We were given a second room, but after moving in, found that the free wired Internet in the room didn't work. Two hours of phone calls, assistance from hotel personnel, etc. and the problem was not resolved. Toilet stopped functioning well after a few hours.   The only restaurant in walking distance is a Hooters, so good only if you crave deep fried stuff. There are other restaurants in driving distance.  This is a very inexpensive hotel, so one gets what one pays for, but this is beneath the La Quinta brand and that was an unpleasant surprise.

No frills, just a clean room and   nice staff. Our first room reeked of cigarette smoke and they were very accomodating in finding us another.  Close to the freeway( real close!) and John Wayne airport as well as shopping.

Summary Heading: a great room for those who are deaf
Summary: My wife and I spent three nights here for business and visiting relatives.  The general location was great and the room was nice, but the freeway noise was like trying to sleep in the middle of the Indianapolis 500.  We used pillows to try to muffle the noise coming through the bottom of the door.  It helped a little., but not enough   The internet didn't work.  I spent a long time with tech support to figure out the cable was bad.  It worked fine after it was replaced.  WiFi would have been better.  As others have noted, there are apparently a bunch of lowlifes living at this motel.  One day there were five police cars at the motel and four "guests" were sitting on the walk with their hands handcuffed behind their backs.    I should have checked the reviews here before making

Summary Heading: Left out in the cold and then assaulted by protruding mattress springs
Summary: My young son and I wanted a special "Mommy & Me" getaway close to our favorite attractions.  We're on a budget so we checked into this La Quinta (the San Diego Location is ok, so I anticipated a similar experience in Costa Mesa.  WRONG!!!!!   The 1st room was dirty but we kept our socks on and "sucked up" our disgust.  In the morning we realized the TV wasn't working.  My son needed his cartoon fix and I needed the distraction for him so I could shower!  I called the front desk and a very nice lady offered to switch our room.  She hand delivered the new room keys and I handed her our exisitng set.   We walked down the outdoor hall in our PJ's (it's 6am).  We open the door to the new room and it  smells REALLY strong like cigarette smoke.  My little one has severe Asthma (I'm an

Summary Heading: Misadvertised as 49$ and up from Freeway; like a Motel 6 or worse.
Summary: We pulled off after a long day of driving because the giant sign along the freeway said $49 a night! The motel is inconveniently located in an industrial park area and next to a crowded Hooters, which might appeal to some. We had a problem with the fact that we had to wait 45 minutes for them to clean a room (after 4 pm), it was supposed to be a non-smoking room but reeked of smoke, there were ants in the room and in the breakfast area off the lobby (we noticed the following morning), the room was so noisy and you could hear the freeway from inside of it, not enough parking outside, lousy coffee in the room, hard to operate t.v., etc. and for all that we were charged $90. The front desk girl said in response to our query about the fifty-foot sign on the freeway;"oh, there are

Summary Heading: clean, cheap but not up to other La Quinta hotels
Summary: I booked this hotel for $50.00/night on Hotwire.  I was very concerned after finding out the location is right beside the 405 freeway.  Exterior noise is loud but I found the room to be clean and not too noisy.  We slept with the air conditioner on anyway and that helped drown out most traffic noise at night.  The beds were comfortable. We got a microwave/fridge combo added to our room.  They were old but functional.  I do believe that some people are living at this hotel.  Some of their work clothes were hung on the railings to dry.  I only found one pair of older washer/dryer available and the ice machine didn't work. The pool looked clean but my family didn't go in.  The motel is located in a business district and there weren't any shops within walking distance.  South Coast

great location, terrible hotel. It seemed that people actually lived there. elevators had graffitti all over, people were washing bags and bags of clothes. Only one ice machine worked. I had to go outside the back door to get the person working at the desk, he was detailing his car. Felt completely unsafe there. Tried to change hotels, but would have been charged an outrageous amount,  so I had to stay. That is why the hotel is cheaper than all the others. Beware.

We chose this La Quinta based on reviews here at Trip Advisor, it's proximity to the Galaxy Theater and because we get customer rewards from La Quinta. The rate for a Friday was $70.  Two staff members greeted us when we arrived and were very friendly and helpful with recommendations for dinner. They also pointed out a small rack that had pocket-sized menus for many of the local restaurants.  Our room (#355) was on the end of the 3rd floor and I had some concerns about the freeway noise. We found that the room was really well soundproofed and that the freeway noise was not a problem. The room itself was rather small, but very clean and included a small refrigerator. The mattress was comfortable and there were plenty of pillows. All in all, very comfy.   The free breakfast was

I felt the room was neat and clean. It was too cold to use the pool. Breakfast was individual packages of yogurt, Jimmy Dean Sausage biscuits, bagels, muffins,  juice and milk; 3 choices of bulk cold cereal, coffee, apples, micro-oatmeal- microwave and toaster. We could not get the high speed internet to work in the room which was an inconvenience; but he manager was very nice and let me use his computer in the office to check my emails. Not sure what the problem was there.  The motel is right next to the 405; but we did not notice the noise of the freeway during the night; so we were happy about that. LT Utah

If you need just an inexpensive night or two  by the airport, then La Quinta Costa Mesa will work fine. I booked this motel through the LaQunta Website and got a great AAA rate of $41.10. Check in was quick and the staff very friendly. I had read some previous reviews to ask for a room away from the freeway side, and was given a nice, spotless room on the other side. One tip, you can turn the fan on and it will drown out any outside noise. For me, this is not a problem as I live in a large city with much worse noise from subways, sirens and trucks.        The room was very comfortable and included the usual amenities such as shampoo, hair dryer and ironing board.        There is a free breakfast consisting of hot and cold cereals, hard boiled eggs and various breads and bagels

This La Quinta Inn is  a satisfactory larger, older-style motel with a  pool and nearby Hooters Restaurant, but not much else within walking distance.  I booked through Expedia.  My room was clean and functional, although the sink stopper did not work and the bath/shower was rather small, with a small chip in the enamel. Entrance was exterior hallway and luggage trolly did not appear to be available.  Parking was somewhate limited.  	The staff was cordial. The Freeway outside was too noisy to open any window in the room, but ventilation system seemed to work fine. Free internet was nice. The motel is three or four exits north from the airport on the 405, but not very easy to find. There was no fridge or microwave, although ice was convenient.  	I had an early flight and rental

Summary Heading: Request a room on the side facing away from the freeway
Summary: Got it from Hotwire, 2.5 stars, ho, ho, not.  Hotwire is easily a half-star high on everything in Orange County.  I give it a 2 rating because I've stayed at some real dives in my life, and I reserve the 1 rating for those special places.   Don't let them put you on the freeway side or your room will rumble with truck traffic at night.  The rooms are old, but pretty large, actually.  Not so much dirty as in need of remodel.  They need new beds or at least foam pads.  Continental breakfast.  Next door to Hooters, which makes eating/beer quite easy.  The access to the motel is weird and a little confusing.  I did not notice any PC terminals for use in the lobby, however, they promise free internet in the rooms.  Parking can be a bit tight near the room.  I think what makes this

Hotwire should be ashamed to rate this location a two and half star hotel. It isn't even a hotel, motel is more like it and it sits right on the 405, I mean the freeway noise is your bedmate. The toilet runs all the time. The rooms are  dumpy looking. The parking lot is in terrible condition. It looks like a gang hangout. Do Not Be Fooled By HOTWIRE'S Rating System. This is not a two and half star hotel. The Courtyard Marriott is a two and half star hotel. You want photos of this place? It isn't worth the space on my digital camera!

We asked for a room that would be quiet and not facing I-405.  The lady at the desk said "can you hear any traffic noise in hear" and proceeded to give us the room that was literally 20 feet away from the freeway.  When we got to the room, it was noisy even with the AC and TV on.  We also had used cups next to the coffee pot and a used bar of soap in the bathroom.  I will definately not stay here again!!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a good price
Summary: I stayed at La Quinta Inn Costa Mesa for  5 days.  The staff is super friendly and wonderful.  They took care of any problems right away.  The room was very clean and had high speed internet.  When I checked in, internet was not working.  However, I called the number provided and they sent someone to fix it right away.  They also have a shuttle service to and from the airport and anywhere close by.  The night that I got in, they did not have a shuttle driver.  However, they told me to catch a cab from the airport and they pay for it (which they did).  I rode their shuttel to another hotel about 3 miles away, where I had to attend a conference.  So, I could get around even without a car.  There are two problems with this hotel though...1) It is located next to I-405 which makes

Summary Heading: Great value for the $$ and very pet-friendly!
Summary: I read several negative reviews about this motel so was somewhat apprehensive when I booked however I was very satisfied with everything on my recent 2 day stay. Several people mentioned it was "noisy" so I assume they were talking about it being next to the 405 Freeway.  However once you are in the room, there was no problem. I stay here primarily because I have 2 dogs and most places that allow pets have a 1 pet maximum so it was ideal for those with have pets. It is convenient to both Costa Mesa & Irvine with easy access to the 405 and 55 Freeways. I would definitely recommend it to anyone especially if you have pets! The staff was courteous and I was able to checkin early.  The room was clean and A/C was O.K. & you do have internet access in the room. The Huntington Beach

I paid 120.00 for a single room that was definitely not worth that much.   I kept trying to check-out on the TV as the menu on the TV said, when I called to ask for help, they said oh yeah, that doesn't work anymore, and they advised me to just get a receipt from the online booking program.  The fixings for the in-room coffee- maker weren't stocked, I called, they sent more around but left it outside without letting me know....had to call again and be told it was outside (and I mean outside, not in a hallway). Then the coffeemaker itself didn't work at all.  Free breakfast was over at 9:00 am which seems awfully early to me!  Also, this was MOTEL, not a hotel........room access is from the outside by the dark parking lot.  About three feet from the fwy.  Should have been MUCH

I would say that this La Quinta is not up to even the modest standards of the average hotels in this chain.  The location is central to shopping and other Orange County attractions, but the hotel is so close to the freeway (I-405), that the sound of traffic easily permeates the rooms facing that direction.  The rooms were reasonablely clean, and the staff met expectations for friendliness, but the breakfast was lacking in choices and the breakfast area was very cramped and usually dirty.  I thought we had gotten a great deal for this hotel, but due to the noise and lack of other amenities, I would not return to this La Quinta.

NOISY NOISY NOISY.  Do not stay here if you plan on sleeping later than 6 am.  I turned on the fan, used earplugs, AND my iPod, and still heard road noise.  I am not a picky traveler, but this place is the WORST.  I wouldn't pay 40.00 a a night for this place, and the total charge was over $100 for one night.  Stay at the Super 8 in Santa Ana - lower price, and much quieter, same amenities.  Also, internet access was so slow that I couldn't even use it...

Summary Heading: Staff compliment for this La Quinta
Summary: Due to a flight delay we were in a pinch with no place to stay as we arrived from Chicago into Los Angeles.  It had been a 28 hour Christmas (due to time changes) by the time our weary family of five stumbled into the hotel after midnight.  Robert was working and began going out of his way to make our stay what we needed.  Since we would only be staying four hours to sleep before our next flight, we just needed beds to crash in and this hotel met the need.  Granted, it was not exactly plush, but the bathroom was HUGE and the room spotless.  Robert arranged a wake-up call for 4:30 for us and called until he knew we were up.  He had also arranged for a cab to pick us up right outside our door.  We were very grateful for his smile and I'm not sure if we would have gotten the same

We stayed for 2 nights at this standard La Quinta property, located just northwest of the intersection of the I-405 and Harbor Blvd. This location is excellent for shopping at South Coast Plaza, the mega mall is about one mile east of the hotel on South Coast Drive.  I’m a gold member of the La Quinta Returns frequent sleeper program (10+ nites per year). I would give this location an average to slightly below rating for the La Quinta chain. The building and interior is somewhat dated, the rooms are standard, ours was clean but slightly smaller than the usual La Quinta king room. The best thing about our stay was the $62 AAA nightly rate, a bargain for this geographical area. Be warned that the hotel is about 50 feet from the northbound San Diego Freeway and the traffic noise is
